Text

﻿Undine [Schreiner]57-schreiner , [Olive]58-olive 1855 - 1920

I. [A QUEER LITTLE CHILD

KAROO]210-a queer little child karoo , red sand , great mounds of round iron stones , and bushes never very beautiful to look at and now almost burned into the ground by the blazing summer 's sun . [An old Dutch farmhouse]211-an old dutch farmhouse built of the brightest red brick to match the ground and stones ; an old stone wall broken down here and there at irregular intervals , as if to allow for the ready ingress and egress of the hundred enterprising goats , whose delight it is daily to regale [themselves]212-themselves on the deformed peach trees and leafless cabbage stalks which [the enclosure]213-the enclosure contains ; [an old tent - waggon]214-an old tent - waggon , whose tent and floor have long gone the way of all flesh wood flesh into the fire ; an ancient willow tree , which stands vainly trying to reflect itself in [a small pond of thick red fluid]215-a small pond of thick red fluid , and under which may at all times be seen a couple of dirty and benighted ducks , who there disport [themselves]216-themselves under the happy delusion of its being water .

All these parts compose a picture in which , when looked at by daylight , it were hard work to find the slightest trace of beauty ; but tonight , penetrated in

[every nook]217-every nook and corner by the cold white light of an almost full moon , there is a strange weird beauty , a beauty which [the veriest sheep - souled Boer that ever smoked pipe or wore vel - skoen]218-the veriest sheep - souled boer that ever smoked pipe or wore vel - skoen , might feel if [he]218-the veriest sheep - souled boer that ever smoked pipe or wore vel - skoen had but one ray of light left in [him]218-the veriest sheep - souled boer that ever smoked pipe or wore vel - skoen .

It was a silent night . Even the great dogs had crept to sleep under [the old tent - waggon]219-the old tent - waggon , and nothing living or moving was to be seen except [a small child]220-a small child and a smaller ape who were perched in one of the gaps of the stone wall . There [they]221-they had sat for the last hour , never moving but very busy cogitating , if one might judge from the grave expression of both faces . Likely the smaller pondered on the dire injustice of tying [him]220-a small child up all day and giving [him]220-a small child orange peel in place of orange pulp , and uncracked almonds , which all [the world]222-the world knew [he]220-a small child could not break . [His]220-a small child thoughts might have been the most profoundly philosophical , however , if judged by the appearance of [his]220-a small child small black countenance abstruse inquiries into the nature , origin , and destiny of the moon , whose course [he]220-a small child was following with eyes hardly less grave and earnest than the large brown pair above [him]220-a small child .

[He]220-a small child was wrapped up in the end of the small blue pinafore which [the child]223-the child had on , the only parts visible being the small wizard - like face and a small black hand , with which [he]220-a small child held [his]220-a small child chin and every now and then raised for a soft sympathetic pat of the little white hand that served as chin - rest

to the white , dark - eyed face above [him]220-a small child . [The child]223-the child might have been ten years old , but [she]223-the child looked much less as [she]223-the child sat there , perched on the top of a large round stone with [her]223-the child thin little legs drawn up under [her]223-the child in a queer little fashion of [her]223-the child own .

" [Socrates]59-socrates , "[223-the child] [she]223-the child said , presently . [The monkey]225-the monkey turned [his]225-the monkey soft brown eyes and fixed them full on [hers]223-the child . " [I]223-the child wish [we]2973-we knew , "[223-the child] said [the child]223-the child . [Socrates]59-socrates gave a long sigh in answer and turned the gaze of [his]59-socrates great sad eyes back to the slowly moving moon . " Come to prayers , come to prayers , "[223-the child] shouted a stentorian voice from one of the back windows , and [Socrates]59-socrates ' reflections for that night were ended . [He]59-socrates was tied up to [his]59-socrates stand ; and with a kiss on the crown of [his]59-socrates little grey head [the owner of the blue pinafore]227-the owner of the blue pinafore left [him]59-socrates and went into [the house]228-the house . [The house]228-the house , as [we]230-we have said , was Dutch , built in the true Dutch style , with [one large front room , from which opened [six or eight cabin - like apartments]232-six or eight cabin - like apartments to serve as [bedrooms]233-bedrooms]231-one large front room , from which opened six or eight cabin - like apartments to serve as bedrooms ; and with that indispensable of [all Dutch farmhouses]234-all dutch farmhouses overhead a great loft .

In [the front room]235-the front room were two large glass cupboards let into the wall , which in the days of [[their]236-their old Dutch proprietor]237-their old dutch proprietor had been wo nt to contain dolls , earthenware , and all the wealth and glory of [the household]238-the household , and which even now , in spite of [their]236-their

being filled with books , had an uncomfortably Dutch appearance . [The room]239-the room was well furnished , and lighted by a great lamp standing on the centre - table . Before it , with an open Bible and Prayer Book , sat [the farmer]240-the farmer : [an English Africander]241-an english africander with nothing worthy of remark about [him]240-the farmer , if it were not the unusually fine development of [his]240-the farmer tall muscular figure and the unusually large amount of yellow hair upon [his]240-the farmer face . There were five others in [the room]239-the room [[his]240-the farmer wife]243-his wife , [a delicate , refined , fair little woman who reclined on the sofa [[his]240-the farmer son]245-his son , handsome and bright - eyed , and now [home]246-home for the holidays and [two little Dutch girls]247-two little dutch girls , grey - eyed , yellow - haired , pudding - faced , who were here to share with [[his]240-the farmer step - daughter]248-his step - daughter]244-a delicate , refined , fair little woman who reclined on the sofa his son , handsome and bright - eyed , and now home for the holidays and two little dutch girls , grey - eyed , yellow - haired , pudding - faced , who were here to share with his step - daughter the instruction of [the very stiff and upright individual who sat on a chair near the door]249-the very stiff and upright individual who sat on a chair near the door . [This individual]250-this individual wore three curls on each side of [her]250-this individual head and carried a large wart on the tip of [her]250-this individual chin .

" Late for prayers again , [Undine]143-undine , "[251-she] [she]251-she said , as [the owner of the little blue pinafore]252-the owner of the little blue pinafore slipped in at the door and took [her]252-the owner of the little blue pinafore way to the nearest seat . [No one else]253-no one else took any notice of [her]252-the owner of the little blue pinafore entrance , and the chapter being finished [they]254-we kneeled down to pray . [Undine]143-undine did not listen to the prayer but to the great red clock overhead , that was ticking away such solemn words , [the child]223-the child thought , as [she]223-the child bent below it :

" Another week gone , another day gone . What[223-the child]

have [you]256-you done ? [We]254-we never come back , [we]254-we moments ; [we]254-we fly , but [we]254-we never return , never , never , tick , tick . What have [you]256-you done with [us]254-we ? If [you]256-you do the best [you]256-you can with [all the rest of [us]254-we]257-all the rest of us , [you]256-you can never bring one of [us]254-we back , never , never , tick , tick . "[256-you]

[Undine]143-undine tried to listen to the prayer , but the old clock 's voice was louder . " Tick , tick , "[143-undine] cried the inexorable old clock , " what good have [you]256-you ever done ? How are [you]256-you better able to die now than [you]256-you were last week ? [You]256-you are nearer death , but are [you]256-you ready , ready , ready , tick , tick , tick ? "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine tried to listen to the prayer again , and [she]143-undine caught these words : " [Thousands]61-thousands , [O Lord]2974-o lord , are going to destruction every moment . "[143-undine] " Yes , yes , yes , "[143-undine] said the clock , " tick , tick , hell , hell , going , going , going , thousands , thousands , thousands , tick , tick , tick , tick . "[143-undine]

[She]143-undine could kneel there while the old clock told only of [her]143-undine own sins and fate , but now when every tick talked of half [the world]222-the world , for [whom there was no help , no hope , who were going , going , going]259-whom there was no help , no hope , who were going , going , going [she]143-undine felt as though [she]143-undine were being suffocated and the walls and roof were throbbing and coming down on [her]143-undine . [She]143-undine leaped up from [her]143-undine knees , and was recalled to a sense of things present only by being very sharply pulled onto them again . Fortunately the prayer was almost ended , and when [they]260-they rose there were at once so many human voices trying to

make [themselves]260-they heard that the voice of [the old wooden prophet]261-the old wooden prophet was quickly drowned .

" [Undine]143-undine , [[my]262-the stiff and upright individual dear]2975-my dear , [I]262-the stiff and upright individual really must report [your]143-undine conduct to [[your]143-undine mamma]2976-your mamma ; it really is most reprehensible , "[262-the stiff and upright individual] said [the stiff and upright individual]262-the stiff and upright individual . " [You]143-undine surely have time enough in which to run about ; [you]143-undine might forget [your]143-undine play and worship [God]62-god , when [you]143-undine come here . [[Your]143-undine mamma]2976-your mamma thinks so . Do [you]143-undine not ? "[262-the stiff and upright individual]

[The lady]263-the lady thus appealed to not only fully endorsed the opinion , but also , on hearing the nature of the offence , ordained that henceforth [the offender]264-the offender 's seat should be in the centre of [the room]239-the room , beside [[her]264-the offender stepfather]266-her stepfather , and so to speak under the eye of [the assembly]267-the assembly . This was intended as a direful chastisement , but [the child]223-the child 's thoughts were still occupied with the ominous tickings of the old clock , and [she]223-the child would have cared nothing just then if [they]269-they had sentenced [her]223-the child to sit next [some savage king of Timbuctoo who makes [his]270-some savage king of timbuctoo who makes his meals off little girls meals off [little girls]271-little girls]270-some savage king of timbuctoo who makes his meals off little girls . [She]223-the child stood there before [them]269-they , with the end of the blue pinafore twisted round one small arm which the other was nursing and patting as tenderly as if it had been [Socrates]59-socrates .

" Really , [Undine]143-undine , [you]223-the child are [the hardest child to manage]2978-the hardest child to manage . There is no need to put on that look of proud indifference ; go to bed at once and let [me]272-her mother see no more of [you]223-the child tonight , "[272-her mother] said [[her]223-the child mother]272-her mother ; and [the child]223-the child took up [her]223-the child light and went . Soon [she]223-the child had put it out and crept into bed , but [she]223-the child could not forget the old clock ; and how dark [the room]239-the room was ! Perfect ,

boundless , endless darkness it might be , for anything [she]223-the child could see ; like that silent darkness which surrounds [poor lost souls]275-poor lost souls and is all the answer [they]275-poor lost souls get when [they]275-poor lost souls cry aloud to [God]62-god . [She]223-the child pulled the cover over [her]223-the child head and buried it under the pillows ; but [whoever has tried these means of dodging disagreeable thoughts]276-whoever has tried these means of dodging disagreeable thoughts knows how signally they always fail . [She]223-the child found this out ; for by and by a small white face showed itself above the blankets and a pair of troubled eyes looked out into the surrounding darkness .

" [Dear God]2979-dear god ! [great God]2980-great god ! "[277-the little child] cried [the little child]277-the little child , covering [her]277-the little child face with both hands , " [You]2979-dear god who are [so very happy and great and strong , who can do all things , O dear God]2981-so very happy and great and strong , who can do all things , o dear god ! save [them]275-poor lost souls . [They]275-poor lost souls are going , going , forever , forever , O [God]62-god ! [God]62-god ! "[277-the little child] [She]223-the child lay still for some minutes and then burst forth again , this time in a perfect agony : " O [God]62-god ! [great God]2980-great god ! save just one soul tonight because [I]223-the child pray . [I]223-the child know that [I]223-the child am wicked and will never be saved , but [I]223-the child pray with faith ; save , oh save one soul , for [my]223-the child prayer . [Great God]62-god ! [God]62-god ! [God]62-god ! "[223-the child]

[She]223-the child sat up and buried [her]223-the child face in both [her]223-the child trembling hands . What was the use of [her]223-the child praying [she]223-the child who did not love [God]62-god , who could not believe , who could never be saved ? How easy it was to understand how [the great Son of God]278-the great son of god could come down to die for souls . [The child]223-the child felt that night as though [she]223-the child , too , could have died to save only a few , a few

souls from the great company of [the God - hated who were passing over the edge to darkness]280-the god - hated who were passing over the edge to darkness . How many had gone since [she]223-the child came into [that room]281-that room tonight ! How many through the long dim ages of the past ! [The old Greeks]282-the old greeks and [Romans]283-romans , and the wild millions of [Asia]1-asia ; and how many would pass over long after [she]223-the child had taken [her]223-the child place in [the great company]284-the great company and vanished into sin and woe forever ! Before and behind [her]223-the child seemed to stretch a chain of endless pain and anguish .

After a time [she]223-the child lay down and tried to close [her]223-the child eyes and drop asleep ; but now it seemed as if already [she]223-the child had passed into [that unknown land]285-that unknown land , prepared by [God]62-god for the souls at whom [he]278-the great son of god laughs . In [Dante]63-dante 's hell there were fire and fellowship , earth and pain , but in [hers]223-the child there was nothing so merciful or so material . [She]223-the child seemed in [a wide void in which there was only endless space and blackness]286-a wide void in which there was only endless space and blackness , and [she]223-the child had [not even two hands , the one of which might touch the other and in touching find fellowship]287-not even two hands , the one of which might touch the other and in touching find fellowship ; and when [she]223-the child cried aloud [her]223-the child voice fell dead upon the air . There was only emptiness , and black space , above , around , below , and [she]223-the child was [one alone]288-one alone . Oh , how the silence ached ! One throb of pain , one touch , one sound , how blessed they would be .

An indescribable terror seized [the child]223-the child . Such must be death , eternal death , the death of the wicked , changeless and everlasting as the throne of [the God who made it]290-the god who made it . [She]223-the child crept out of bed

trem- trembling

bling and lay down on [the cold mud floor]291-the cold mud floor ; that at least was hard and solid , and it seemed to calm [her]223-the child . [She]223-the child pressed [her]223-the child face onto it , and a few burning tears fell on it ; then [she]223-the child lay as still as though [she]223-the child were asleep . How comforting it was , [that solid earth]292-that solid earth ; but it was dead and cold , and [she]223-the child would like the touch of something warmer ; so after a time [she]223-the child got up and , noiselessly opening the door , stood in [the large front room]293-the large front room . It was dark and quite still but for the ticking of the old clock and the sound of [her]223-the child own breath . [She]223-the child stood for a minute listening ; then [she]223-the child crept on till [her]223-the child fingers touched a door at the far end of [the room]239-the room . After a little pressure it opened , and [she]223-the child went in . There were two beds in [the room]239-the room , both occupied , and [she]223-the child kneeled down at the foot of the nearest and stretched out [her]223-the child hand . It came in contact with what [she]223-the child was in search of a small foot , soft and warm and full of life . [She]223-the child held it for some moments in both hands , and then , afraid of waking [the sleeper]296-the sleeper , rose to go , noiselessly and softly as [she]223-the child had come .

How [the owner of the foot [one of [the grey - eyed , cheese - faced little Dutch girls]299-the grey - eyed , cheese - faced little dutch girls]298-one of the grey - eyed , cheese - faced little dutch girls]297-the owner of the foot one of the grey - eyed , cheese - faced little dutch girls would have wondered and been mystified , could [she]223-the child have watched the proceedings of [[her]223-the child little white - nightgowned visitor , who , feeling [her]223-the child way softly by chairs and tables]300-her little white - nightgowned visitor , who , feeling her way softly by chairs and tables , soon found [herself]223-the child again in [[her]223-the child own room]301-her own room .

[She]223-the child was comforted , but not sufficiently ; so [she]223-the child

drew from between the mattresses on [her]223-the child bed a small brown New Testament . Pressing it close to [her]223-the child side with one little arm , with the other [she]223-the child dragged a large wooden chair to the window ; and with its aid , and that of a stool , climbed up into the window seat . Pushing [her]223-the child hand through a broken pane , [she]223-the child sent the heavy wooden shutter flying back on its hinges . A flood of white moonlight fell into [the room]239-the room , and the face of the moon [herself]223-the child looked in on the little tumbled bed and the whitewashed walls and the mite of a thing , with its little white nightgown and bare feet , perched up in the window .

The mite of a thing closed [her]223-the child eyes tight and opened [her]223-the child book , turning the leaves over and over again , and at last brought down a small finger upon one of them . [She]223-the child opened [her]223-the child eyes and stooped down to read by the moonlight the words on which it had alighted ; they were these " Which was [the son of Melchi]2983-the son of melchi , which was [the son of Addi]2984-the son of addi , which was [the son of Cosam]2985-the son of cosam , which was [the son of [Elmodam]64-elmodam]2986-the son of elmodam , which was [the son of Er]2987-the son of er . "[223-the child] [She]223-the child closed the book and sat looking at the cover in silence , with very much the expression of [Socrates]59-socrates when lost in the contemplation of a nut [he]59-socrates had vainly endeavoured to crack . Faith is strong , however , and reason weak , at ten years ; so the brown comforter was opened again ; and , after the fashion of [the Apostles]303-the apostles and [good men of old]304-good men of old , [Providence]65-providence was appealed to .

This time the words were these " Strive to enter in at the straight gate , for many [I]223-the child say unto [you]2988-you shall seek to enter in , and shall not be able . "[223-the child] [She]223-the child did not close the book this time but sat looking at its open pages with [her]223-the child eyebrows slightly bent ; then [she]223-the child caught the book up tightly in one hand and flung it from [her]223-the child with such force that it left the story of its journey written in a large brown dent on the whitewashed wall opposite . [She]223-the child threw [her]223-the child head down on the window seat and cried long and bitterly ; but by and by , when [she]223-the child grew quieter , [she]223-the child sat up and pressed [her]223-the child little burning cheek against the window pane . How calm and still [the outside world]305-the outside world was ; so far removed from all passion and strife , damnation , fire and brimstone ; so strong , so self - contained . How peacefully the great round stones lay resting on each other . Through that subtle sympathy which binds together all things , and to stumps and rocks gives a speech which even [we]306-we can understand , the night spoke to [the little child]277-the little child the sweet words of comfort which [she]223-the child had looked for in vain in [the brown Testament]308-the brown testament . [She]223-the child left off thinking and only sat and listened , and the sweet night wind blew in through the broken pane and touched [her]223-the child softly , till the weary eyelids closed and [the little head]309-the little head found rest once more on the window seat .

Of course [Undine]143-undine was late next morning , late even for Sunday morning . [Socrates]59-socrates , in despair of ever getting [his]59-socrates breakfast , sat disconsolate on the

top of [his]59-socrates box , making believe to eat [his]59-socrates tail , and every now and then raising [his]59-socrates hands to [his]59-socrates head and slowly rubbing them across [his]59-socrates forehead , as if still suffering from the effect of too much moonlight thought .

It was going to be a sweltering day ; even now it gave one an unpleasant sensation to look at the little hills of red round stones scattered here and there and acting the part of [great reflectors]310-great reflectors ; as though [man and herb]311-man and herb were not desiccated and burnt red enough without [their]311-man and herb help . Indoors the blue flies buzzed . In spite of the soothing effect of more than half - closed shutters all sat down to breakfast feeling mortally aggrieved , though hardly knowing in what respect , and , according to [their]311-man and herb several dispositions , desiring to have it out with [some one]312-some one or lapsing into silence .

When [Undine]143-undine came to the table [she]143-undine was met with the usual : " Late again , [[my]313-the governess dear]2975-my dear ; surely going to bed when [you]2975-my dear do , [you]2975-my dear might get up a little earlier . It is this sleeping so much that makes [you]2975-my dear so incurably stupid . [Sannie]66-sannie and [Annie]67-nancy were up hours ago , "[313-the governess] said [the governess]313-the governess , casting an approving glance at [the two little maidens opposite , who by [their]314-the two little maidens opposite , who by their earnest patronage of mutton chops and fat were incontrovertibly proving their africander origin earnest patronage of mutton chops and fat were incontrovertibly proving [their]314-the two little maidens opposite , who by their earnest patronage of mutton chops and fat were incontrovertibly proving their africander origin Africander origin]314-the two little maidens opposite , who by their earnest patronage of mutton chops and fat were incontrovertibly proving their africander origin .

" [They]314-the two little maidens opposite , who by their earnest patronage of mutton chops and fat were incontrovertibly proving their africander origin went to bed much later than [you]2975-my dear and were up earlier , and have done [their]314-the two little maidens opposite , who by their earnest patronage of mutton chops and fat were incontrovertibly proving their africander origin hair much better than [you]2975-my dear , "[313-the governess] continued [[her]313-the governess instructress]315-her instructress , [whose ideas were so truly correct , feminine , and orthodox]316-whose ideas were so truly correct , feminine , and orthodox , that

[they]317-they might all have been placed in an ordinary breakfast saucer and left there forever , without the least fear of [their]317-they ever running over .

The meal being ended , [the farmer]240-the farmer went out to bully [the herdsmen]319-the herdsmen for not having let the sheep out earlier , and to saunter about till the heat should drive [him]240-the farmer in ; while [[his]240-the farmer wife]243-his wife hied to [the nether regions]321-the nether regions , where bitter and clamorous war was being waged between [Hendrik]68-hendrik and [Gobalee]69-gobalee as to the possession of the sheep's - head - and - feet . [The two little Dutch girls]322-the two little dutch girls stood in the [kitchen]323-kitchen doorway , and for once the dawning of a light , which if it had arisen might have been called animation , shone in [their]322-the two little dutch girls placid countenances as [they]322-the two little dutch girls drank in every word and even now and then inserted one .

[Undine]143-undine collected some bits of bread , took half a green mielie 1 and a cup of water , and , putting on [her]143-undine great brown kappie , went out to visit [Socrates]59-socrates in [the yard]324-the yard . [He]240-the farmer was glad of the contents of cup and plate , but quickly satisfied [himself]240-the farmer and began playing with [his]240-the farmer mielie , 2 now throwing it from [him]240-the farmer with disdain and gazing up into the sky with an air of deep abstraction , as though completely unconscious of its existence , then seizing it up , taking a bite and hugging it to [him]240-the farmer , with an expression of earnestness so comical it might have set a Methodist

1 The mielies " corn "[143-undine] being on the cob .

2 Used them in S. [Africa]2-africa both for a single " pip "[143-undine] and for the cob with the pips on . Here it is obviously used in the latter sense .

[parson]325-parson laughing on [his]325-parson way to class meeting . [Undine]143-undine did not laugh ; [she]143-undine sat down on the ground beside [him]240-the farmer and looked at [him]240-the farmer , wondering if [he]240-the farmer really felt so happy , or only played so wildly because [his]240-the farmer heart was heavy . [She]143-undine wondered if [he]240-the farmer ever wished to be anything in [the wide world]326-the wide world but [himself]240-the farmer , and yet did n't see anything that [he]240-the farmer liked better ; wondered if [he]240-the farmer ever longed to die , and yet wished never to die , and nothing in [the world]222-the world ever to die ; wondered if it made [him]240-the farmer feel queer to look up at that little white fleecy cloud in the blue sky overhead ; wondered what the little cloud meant and how it came there and why it came there , and why anything was where it was , and why [the world]222-the world was [the world]222-the world , and the sun the sun , and [she]143-undine , [she]143-undine ; and why [She]143-undine could not wonder any more , for two strong hands were shaking [her]143-undine so that the little white cloud , [Socrates]59-socrates , the blue sky and [red earth]330-red earth , were all jumbled up together .

" Do [you]143-undine wish to ruin [your]143-undine complexion completely , [[you]143-undine wicked child]2990-you wicked child , that [you]143-undine sit here staring up into the sky as if [you]143-undine had never seen it before and were bereft of all [your]143-undine senses ? Get [your]143-undine kappie from that ape and come into [the house]228-the house at once . "[143-undine]

For [Mr. Socrates]59-socrates had possessed [himself]59-socrates of the large brown kappie and seemed in no hurry to restore it . Finds are keeps according to the code , and it was only after a world of persuasion had been lavished upon [him]59-socrates that [he]59-socrates very gingerly descended

from [his]59-socrates box and , with an air of melancholy resignation and a touch of condescension , delivered it to [its owner]331-its owner . Then [he]59-socrates sat gravely following with [his]59-socrates eyes the little blue pinafore and brown kappie as [they]332-they vanished into [the house]228-the house , and , there being nothing left worth [his]59-socrates looking at , [he]59-socrates then clambered up into [his]59-socrates box to take a doze .

The sheep's - head - and - feet quarrel had been settled , and when [Undine]143-undine entered [the front room]235-the front room [she]143-undine found [the two little Dutch girls]322-the two little dutch girls demurely seated on two chairs with [their]322-the two little dutch girls hymn books in [their]322-the two little dutch girls hands , learning [their]322-the two little dutch girls Sunday lessons . [Undine]143-undine , too , got [her]143-undine hymn book down from the shelf , but instead of following the virtuous example before [her]143-undine , [she]143-undine placed [her]143-undine book on the floor , laid [herself]143-undine across a chair , and in this very highly unorthodox position had just composed [herself]143-undine to learn , when [she]143-undine was asked if [she]143-undine had not yet rested enough and were going to sleep again . Of course there was nothing for it but to sit up and learn away steadily till the hour arrived at which , every Sunday morning , [the three scholars]336-the three scholars were marched off into [a side room]337-a side room to receive such religious instruction as was suited to [their]336-the three scholars limited capacities and tender years . The first part of the program , which consisted in the recitation of lessons , was soon over . Then bibles were produced . The little brown Testament was not one of them false friend it might sometimes be , but [friend]338-friend for

all that , and not to be brought out for [common eyes]339-common eyes to gaze on .

[The stiff and upright individual]262-the stiff and upright individual sat in a large armchair , and before [her]143-undine [the two little Dutch girls on high - backed riem - bottomed chairs]341-the two little dutch girls on high - backed riem - bottomed chairs , while [Undine]143-undine took possession of a green waggon - chest that stood near the door . The chapter chosen for [their]336-the three scholars perusal and consideration was the twenty - fifth of [Matthew]70-matthew , and when it was concluded each was in turn required to ask some question bearing on its contents . [The eldest of [the Dutch girls on whom the heat , the darkness of the room]343-the dutch girls on whom the heat , the darkness of the room , and the exertion of spelling out the long English words had had an almost stupefying effect sat for some moments gazing at the face of [[her]143-undine oracle]344-her oracle]342-the eldest of the dutch girls on whom the heat , the darkness of the room , and the exertion of spelling out the long english words had had an almost stupefying effect sat for some moments gazing at the face of her oracle with an expression of hopeless vacancy . At length a happy thought occurred to [her]143-undine : Were [the virgins men]345-the virgins men or [women]346-women ? The mental effort required for the birth of this question seemed so completely to have exhausted all [her]143-undine powers of mind as to make it highly probable that the reply of [the oracle]347-the oracle was lost upon [her]143-undine and that [she]143-undine remained forever in total ignorance on the momentous subject of [her]143-undine inquiry .

It was now the turn of [number two , who , with astonishing brightness]348-number two , who , with astonishing brightness , asked if [the bridesmaids]349-the bridesmaids wore white muslin dresses and carried eau - de - Cologne bottles in [their]349-the bridesmaids pockets . [This searcher]350-this searcher after truth having been satisfied , it was [Undine]143-undine 's turn to

quire and learn . But [that young lady]351-that young lady sat upon the green box , noiselessly tapping it with [her]351-that young lady heels and fixing on the skin carpet that attention which should have been bestowed on [[her]351-that young lady worthy instructress]352-her worthy instructress .

" Well , [Undine]143-undine , [[my]351-that young lady dear]2975-my dear , what have [you]143-undine to ask ?
