"[358-the others]

" And what lesson does this teach [us]3001-us , [[my]143-undine dear]2975-my dear ? "[143-undine] " That [God]62-god has prepared a heaven for [the people [he]2998-he means to save]3003-the people he means to save and a hell for [the people [he]2998-he means to burn]3004-the people he means to burn , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , very gravely , never raising [her]143-undine eyes from the carpet on which they rested . There was a pause ; then came the remark : " Hardly the right way of putting it , [[my]143-undine dear]2975-my dear . It teaches [you]2975-my dear that [you]2975-my dear should be [a very good little girl]3006-a very good little girl , so that when [you]2975-my dear die [God]62-god may take [you]2975-my dear to [heaven]3007-heaven and not send [you]2975-my dear to [hell]3008-hell to burn forever and ever . "[143-undine] " [I]143-undine would much sooner be wicked and go to [hell]3008-hell than be good only because [I]143-undine was afraid of going [there]3010-there , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , now raising [her]143-undine eyes from the carpet and fixing them on the horror - stricken countenance of [[her]143-undine instructress]315-her instructress .

" [Undine]143-undine ! "[360-that unfortunate individual] gasped forth [that unfortunate individual]360-that unfortunate individual . " [Undine]143-undine , what do [you]143-undine mean ? [You]143-undine were always [an evil and wicked child]3011-an evil and wicked child , but [you]143-undine grow viler every day . "[360-that unfortunate individual]

" Yes , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , getting off the box , with a face alternately as red as the sprigs on [her]143-undine little print dress and as pale as [her]143-undine little white pinafore " yes , [I]143-undine do n't want to go to [heaven]3007-heaven , and , if [God]62-god wants to , [he]3013-he can send [me]143-undine to [hell]3008-hell and [I]143-undine will never again ask [him]3013-he not to , never . [I]143-undine know [I]143-undine 'm very wicked , but [I]143-undine 'm not half so wicked or so cruel as [he]3013-he is . Nothing is , not even the devil . [The devil]3015-the devil is glad when [we]361-us go to hell , but [he]363-he did not make [us]361-us[143-undine]

on purpose to send [us]361-us [there]3010-there , and [he]363-he did not make hell , and [he]363-he did not make [himself]363-he , and [I]0-i 'm sorry for [him]363-he . [I]0-i believe [he]363-he tries to be good and [God]62-god wo n't let [him]363-he , that 's what [I]0-i believe , " said [Undine]143-undine , who , with [her]143-undine [wild dark eyes and clenched hands]3016-wild dark eyes and clenched hands , looked more like [some spirit who had just arrived from the regions of which [she]143-undine spoke than [a carefully - brought - up little Christian]3018-a carefully - brought - up little christian receiving [her]143-undine Sunday lesson]3017-some spirit who had just arrived from the regions of which she spoke than a carefully - brought - up little christian receiving her sunday lesson .[0-i]

If [she]364-her had been [Medusa]71-medusa [her]364-her gaze could not more completely have paralysed [[her]364-her opponent]365-her opponent , who sat there as if turned into stone ; while [the two little pudding]366-the two little pudding - faces looked from one to the other with wild astonishment in [their]366-the two little pudding big grey eyes . [Undine]143-undine clasped [her]143-undine little hands behind [her]143-undine and walked slowly out of [the room]239-the room . It was the first time that [she]143-undine had ever given utterance to the evil thoughts with which [her]143-undine small and , as [she]143-undine believed , devil - ridden soul was haunted ; they were fiendishly evil thoughts , all of them , [she]143-undine knew ; but , if they were [hers]143-undine , why should [she]143-undine not give them utterance ? [Her]143-undine little heart swelled so it well nigh suffocated [her]143-undine , but it was with a sense of freedom and strength that [she]143-undine was pacing up and down [[her]143-undine little room]368-her little room , when [she]143-undine heard the key turn in the door .

It was pleasant enough to think of having a day all to [herself]143-undine with no fear of interruption and no company but [her]143-undine books ; but to think of that clink of the key and know that , wishing it or not , [she]143-undine was

[a prisoner]369-a prisoner , made [her]143-undine stamp [her]143-undine feet upon the ground as [she]143-undine walked up and down and to rebel in [her]143-undine bitter little heart against all powers , human and divine .

[The world]222-the world was not the place for [her]143-undine , [she]143-undine was feeling persuaded ; [she]143-undine was not fit for it . Why then had [she]143-undine been made so bad , and put into it ? It was no use saying [she]143-undine ought to be good ; [she]143-undine could n't . [The devil]3015-the devil did not come to [other people]372-other people and make [them]372-other people think such thoughts as [he]3015-the devil made [her]143-undine . [She]143-undine felt [herself]143-undine very much aggrieved by these attacks from [the infernal regions]373-the infernal regions , and presently became very wrathful . Then reaction set in and [she]143-undine grew sleepy . Lying down upon the floor , [she]143-undine was soon sound asleep , dreaming of the glorious time when [she]143-undine would be [a woman]374-a woman and would know everything and be loved by [everyone]375-everyone , and when [she]143-undine would be free .

The ringing of the dinner bell wakened [her]143-undine ; and , finding that nothing in the shape of food was sent [her]143-undine , [she]143-undine kneeled down before [her]143-undine little bookshelf in search of refreshment of another order . There were delicious fairy tales Arabian Nights whose old torn pages seemed to emit an odour of myrrh and roses caught from [the gardens of [Bagdad]4-bagdad]376-the gardens of bagdad [Hans Andersen]72-hans andersen 's beautiful song in prose about [the mermaid]377-the mermaid and [the young prince]378-the young prince but these and others were of course not to be looked at . It would have hurt [the child]223-the child 's conscience as much to have read a fairy tale on Sunday as to have told a lie ; one of the crimes which always came to haunt [her]143-undine in the dark watchful

hours of the night was [her]143-undine having read , on one never - to - be - forgotten Sunday afternoon , a part of that story of " [The Mermaid]377-the mermaid and [the Prince]3020-the prince . "[143-undine]

So [Undine]143-undine , rebel though [she]143-undine was , touched not , looked not , at the wicked thing , but from its hiding - place behind the other books brought forth a large , dull - coloured , leather - bound volume .

It was A Careful and strict Enquiry into the Modern Prevailing Notions of the Freedom of Will , which is supposed to be essential to Moral Agency , Virtue and Vice , Reward and Punishment , Praise and Blame , by [Jonathan Edwards]73-jonathan edwards , A.B. [They]380-they would have laughed at [her]143-undine for reading [such an old man]381-such an old man 's book and one with so grandiloquent and lengthy a title , so it was always stowed safely away behind the others where there was no fear of its being discovered by prying eyes . The faded ribbon place - marker had already found its way into the middle of the book , and [the child]223-the child was soon deeply absorbed in sections eight , nine and ten of section two , in part three . [She]143-undine did not get through more than these , for each sentence was found so pregnant with profound and misty thoughts that [she]143-undine was obliged to read it carefully , and often re - read it , before it could be dismissed .

There was a strange contrast between [the little reader]383-the little reader and [her]143-undine great brown book as [she]143-undine sat there on the floor on that Sunday afternoon . [The child]223-the child so warm , with the wild blood dancing in every vein ,

looking out so eagerly into [the world]222-the world , so ready to give and take the book so old , so dead , with the life thoughts of [another generation]386-another generation petrified in its old yellow leaves , now probably being read for the last time .

The book had belonged to [[her]143-undine own father]387-her own father , who , much to the grief of [[his]387-her own father father]388-his father , had turned aside from the paths of truth and Arminianism , to the ways of Calvinism and error , and in those evil ways had died . About three o'clock the key turned and [one of [the little Dutch girls]390-the little dutch girls]389-one of the little dutch girls put [her]389-one of the little dutch girls face in at the door . " [You]223-the child can come out when [you]223-the child like , "[389-one of the little dutch girls] [she]389-one of the little dutch girls said . [Undine]143-undine did not even raise [her]143-undine eyes from the book , determining to show that [she]143-undine by no means objected to being made [a prisoner]369-a prisoner in [[her]143-undine own room]301-her own room ; and [she]143-undine would in all probability have remained where [she]143-undine was until called to tea , had [she]143-undine not suddenly remembered [Socrates]59-socrates . Of course pride must be swallowed and [his]59-socrates wants attended to ; so with an air of extreme indifference [she]143-undine made [her]143-undine way through [the front room]235-the front room and , having got a mug of water and thrown a large damp towel over the brown kappie , went out into [the yard]324-the yard .

[She]143-undine found [Socrates]59-socrates lying on the floor of [his]59-socrates box , quite exhausted with the heat and very glad to get under the shade of the damp towel . Loosening [him]59-socrates from the stand , [she]143-undine carried [him]59-socrates down to [the little dam]395-the little dam , where , under the scant shade of the willow-

tree , [[her]143-undine brother]396-her brother [Frank]74-frank lay reclining on [his]74-frank back . [He]59-socrates had thrown open [his]59-socrates jacket and waistcoat , more from force of habit than from reason , [one]397-one would think ; for the wind , like the breath from an oven , seemed , in place of cooling , to blight and desiccate all it touched . [He]59-socrates was a fine specimen of [an English Africander]241-an english africander , tall and broad , with a fair handsome face , though rather sleepy - looking just now as [he]59-socrates lay with [his]59-socrates legs raised against the trunk of the old tree and [his]59-socrates hat pulled half over [his]59-socrates eyes . With one hand [he]59-socrates kept it there while with the other [he]59-socrates picked up small bits of baked earth wherewith to pelt the miserable ducks who , red , dirty , and hot , were endeavouring to swim in diluted mud by way of improving [their]399-their condition .

[Undine]143-undine sat down close to the trunk of the tree , for that cast a small shadow if the branches did not ; and for some minutes nothing was said . " Had [him]59-socrates that time , "[74-frank] muttered [Frank]74-frank at last , as a more than usually lucky hit caught [the old drake]400-the old drake in the eye . " [I]143-undine wonder why [you]59-socrates do that , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine ; " everything is miserable in [the whole world]3021-the whole world . "[143-undine] The only response to this observation was another throw , but presently [he]59-socrates said , " So [you]143-undine 've been in the wars today , [little woman]3022-little woman , eh ? "[59-socrates] [Undine]143-undine made no reply , but [stroked Socrates]59-socrates softly the wrong way .

" Too bad to make [you]59-socrates go without [your]59-socrates dinner , [little woman]3022-little woman , was n't it ? "[59-socrates] " [I]143-undine do n't mind that one bit , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , " but [I]143-undine wish [I]143-undine had never been born . [I]143-undine 'm miserable , and [nobody]3024-nobody loves [me]143-undine . "[143-undine] " Why , [I]74-frank do , and [[we]3025-we all of [us]3025-we]3026-we all of us do , though [you]143-undine are such [a queer little coon]3027-a queer little coon , "[74-frank] answered [Frank]74-frank lazily . " Yes , that 's just it , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , gravely tying [Socrates]59-socrates ' tail into a knot as [she]143-undine spoke , much to [that gentleman]401-that gentleman 's dissatisfaction . " Yes , that 's just it ; [you]143-undine only care about [me]143-undine because [I]143-undine 'm [[your]143-undine sister]3028-your sister ; [you]143-undine call [me]143-undine queer and strange ; [you]143-undine do n't like [me]143-undine one bit only [Socrates]59-socrates . "[143-undine]

" Well , that is good . How do [you]143-undine know that [Socrates]59-socrates likes [you]143-undine , and not the bread and butter [you]143-undine bring [him]59-socrates ? "[74-frank] asked [Frank]74-frank .

" [I]143-undine know [he]59-socrates likes [me]143-undine , "[143-undine] answered [Undine]143-undine , very indignantly . " Ca n't [I]143-undine see it ? Do n't [I]143-undine know it ? When [we]3029-we sit together of an evening , [I]143-undine can feel [he]59-socrates is thinking just what [I]143-undine am , and when [I]143-undine talk to [him]59-socrates [he]59-socrates understands [me]143-undine . That is what [I]143-undine hate , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , twisting at the tail more vigorously than ever ; " [people]3030-people do n't know anything about it , and [they]3030-people say [he]59-socrates has n't got a soul . How do [they]3030-people know , [I]143-undine should like to know ? If only [people]3030-people would not talk till [they]3030-people knew , [I]143-undine think [the world]222-the world would be [a much nicer place]3033-a much nicer place . "[143-undine]

[Frank]74-frank said nothing , but laughed , and directed a bit of mud straight at the tip of [Socrates]59-socrates ' black nose ,

who merely opened [his]59-socrates eyes and closed them again very solemnly .

" [I]143-undine wish [I]143-undine were one of those ducks , "[143-undine] remarked [Undine]143-undine , presently . " [I]74-frank do n't ; [they]3034-they look hot , "[74-frank] said [Frank]74-frank ; " and [I]74-frank thought [you]143-undine said , just now , everything in [the whole world]3021-the whole world was miserable . "[74-frank] " Yes , but not so very miserable because [they]3034-they do n't think ; at least , perhaps [they]3034-they do ; but [they]3034-they 've no bibles , [you]143-undine see , and [I]143-undine do n't think [the devil]3015-the devil ever tempts [them]3034-they . It would not be worth [his]3015-the devil trouble , they are so small . "[143-undine] " If [he]3015-the devil paid visits only on account of size , [I]396-her brother expect [you]143-undine would not see much of [him]3015-the devil , "[396-her brother] said [[her]143-undine brother]396-her brother , with an amused expression on [his]396-her brother face . " Are bibles [your]143-undine great trouble ? "[396-her brother]

" Yes , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , unhesitatingly . " Sometimes [I]143-undine feel quite good , and [I]143-undine am sitting and reading , and [I]143-undine come to something that is quite different from what it was somewhere else . Then the devil makes [me]143-undine think , How can two things that say the opposite both be true ? And then [I]143-undine feel wicked and [I]143-undine ca n't go on reading any more . Sometimes , too , when [I]143-undine 'm praying and [I]143-undine feel as though [I]143-undine loved [God]62-god very much , [I]143-undine remember all at once how it says in the Bible that [he]3015-the devil never forgives [anyone]3037-anyone for nothing , but always makes [some one]312-some one suffer pain first ; and [I]143-undine remember all the other cruel things it tells about [him]3015-the devil ; and then [I]143-undine hate [him]3015-the devil , and for a long time [I]143-undine ca n't pray again .[143-undine]

Oh dear ! " [she]143-undine said after a little pause . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [the world]222-the world belonged to [me]0-i . [I]0-i would make it much better ; [I]0-i would let [all the devils out of [hell]3008-hell]404-all the devils out of hell and love [them]404-all the devils out of hell and make [them]404-all the devils out of hell good , so there would be [no one]406-no one to tempt [the people]407-the people any more . Did [you]408-you ever feel so wicked as [I]0-i do when [you]408-you were little like [me]0-i ? " asked [Undine]143-undine , looking earnestly at [him]408-you , as though with the vague hope that [his]408-you answer might be in the affirmative .[408-you]

" No , [I]409-the ducks should rather think not , "[409-the ducks] was the answer . " [I]409-the ducks used to make little clay oxen and train [kids]3039-kids in an old box and enjoy [myself]409-the ducks ; that is what [I]409-the ducks used to do when [I]409-the ducks was [your]408-you age . "[409-the ducks] [Undine]143-undine heaved a little weary sigh and looked at [the ducks]409-the ducks . " [I]143-undine wonder if there are [any people in [the world]222-the world]3040-any people in the world who feel like [I]143-undine do and [who have such wicked thoughts]3042-who have such wicked thoughts , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said at last . " Of course there are , and much wickeder , too ; there are [people who do n't believe the Bible]3043-people who do n't believe the bible is true , or anything else , and [they]3043-people who do n't believe the bible write books also . "[143-undine] " Do [they]3043-people who do n't believe the bible ? "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . " [I]143-undine wish [I]143-undine could read them . Have [you]74-frank ever ? "[143-undine] " No , "[74-frank] said [Frank]74-frank ; " it 's too much bother ; but [I]74-frank will , when [I]74-frank 'm [a man]3044-a man ; "[74-frank] and pulling [his]74-frank hat lower over [his]74-frank eyes , [he]74-frank either made believe to do so or really went to sleep .

[Undine]143-undine did not go away , but sat at [his]74-frank feet , nursing [Socrates]59-socrates and watching the ducks , till [the koppies]410-the koppies

began to cast long shadows and the fast cooling air told that sunset was not far off .

By and by the back door of [the house]228-the house opened and [the whole family]412-the whole family appeared equipped for [their]412-the whole family Sunday evening walk all , with the exception of [the smallest Dutch girl , who , complaining of a headache]413-the smallest dutch girl , who , complaining of a headache , was left to keep [Undine]143-undine company . " Take care of everything ; get into no mischief ; and above all remember that it is Sunday , "[412-the whole family] were the parting injunctions which [they]412-the whole family received as [the group]414-the group , which now included [Frank]74-frank , moved off . [The two children]415-the two children stood still watching [them]412-the whole family till [they]412-the whole family passed out of sight . Then [Undine]143-undine , after crying and praying half the night , and reading [Edwards]73-jonathan edwards and meditating half the day , began to discover that , [she]143-undine was neither anchorite nor [saint]416-saint , but only a very young animal with much wild blood in its young veins that needed circulating . It may have been the evening 's cool that made [her]143-undine conscious of this , for it seemed to have an inebriating effect upon [Socrates]59-socrates , who leaped , grinned , and turned somersets in a manner truly astonishing .

" [I]143-undine wonder , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , " if [Socrates]59-socrates and [I]143-undine were to run a race , which of [us]412-the whole family would beat "[143-undine] ; and without waiting for a reply , [she]143-undine set about testing the matter at once . With one end of [his]59-socrates chain held firmly in [her]143-undine hand [they]412-the whole family set off , but had not gone thirty paces when it had slipped out and [Socrates]59-socrates , chain and all , was making [his]59-socrates way to the nearest koppie , with

jingling , screeching and leaping , much to the mingled horror and delight of [[his]59-socrates little pursuer]417-his little pursuer . The delight soon vanished , however , for , [the koppie]418-the koppie reached , [Mr. Socrates]59-socrates felt [himself]59-socrates quite in [his]59-socrates own element , and absolutely refused to be cozened by soft words or specious promises . Seating [himself]59-socrates on the top of a large round stone , [he]59-socrates would very leisurely stretch out [his]59-socrates legs , scratch [himself]59-socrates , and then look up into the blue sky with an air of melancholy abstraction ; this till [[his]59-socrates breathless pursuer]419-his breathless pursuer was within half a foot of [him]59-socrates ; then , with a whirl , a cry , and a somerset , off to another and more inaccessible stone , round which [[his]59-socrates little pursuer]417-his little pursuer might dance and beseech in vain , leaping to catch the tip of the chain [he]59-socrates left hanging almost within reach of [her]417-his little pursuer fingers . It is uncertain how long this game might have continued had not the idea entered [Socrates]59-socrates ' small head that more fun might be got from scampering over the roofs at [home]246-home than by remaining where [he]59-socrates was .

[Accordingly]75-accordingly , [he]59-socrates was off like an arrow , while [Undine]143-undine followed [him]59-socrates breathlessly , minus one shoe and with more rents in [her]143-undine garments than could well be counted . Arrived at [the house]228-the house , [she]143-undine found the exemplary [Sennie]76-sennie standing exactly where and as [she]143-undine had left [her]76-sennie ; except that [she]143-undine had placed one finger in [her]143-undine mouth and partly turned [her]143-undine head to look at [Socrates]59-socrates , who was now on the roof of [the house]228-the house ,

busily occupied in pulling out thatch and working away with the greatest dispatch and precision .

[Undine]143-undine quickly saw that , if this were allowed to go on for many minutes , [he]59-socrates would have worked [his]59-socrates way into [the loft]424-the loft and perhaps to a bloody death as the reward of [his]59-socrates evil deeds . What was to be done ? [She]143-undine looked at [the little Dutch girl]425-the little dutch girl in despair ; [the little Dutch girl]425-the little dutch girl looked at [her]143-undine . " [He]59-socrates is naughty , "[427-that little maiden] said [that little maiden]427-that little maiden at length , and then slowly replaced the finger [she]427-that little maiden had taken out of [her]427-that little maiden small mouth . [Undine]143-undine turned away in disgust ; there was no help to be got from [her]143-undine , and nothing for it but to climb the roof [herself]143-undine and capture [him]59-socrates . With much difficulty a long ladder was brought which reached just to the top of the wall ; and this was soon mounted . Once there , how to get on to [the ridge]428-the ridge was the question ; for at every touch the old thatch crumbled away by handfuls , and [she]143-undine had not crawled many inches before it seemed inevitable that [she]143-undine should soon find [herself]143-undine deposited among the skins in [the loft]424-the loft or with the thatch upon the ground .

" [You]143-undine will fall down and die , "[425-the little dutch girl] said [the little Dutch girl]425-the little dutch girl , very deliberately , as [she]425-the little dutch girl watched [Undine]143-undine 's perilous ascent with almost as much interest as [Socrates]59-socrates , who had now taken [his]59-socrates seat on one of

[the gables]431-the gables , and with [his]59-socrates chin resting on [his]59-socrates hand was contemplating [her]143-undine movements most attentively .

[Undine]143-undine took no notice of either , but continued to climb , doing more harm at every move than [Socrates]59-socrates in twenty . [The ridge]428-the ridge was gained at last , after infinite trouble , but not so [Socrates]59-socrates . [He]59-socrates waited till [her]143-undine fingers touched [his]59-socrates tail ; and then , with that appendage cocked high in air , walked off very quietly to the other gable , where [he]59-socrates ensconced [himself]59-socrates far more comfortably than [[his]59-socrates little pursuer]417-his little pursuer found it possible to do at [hers]143-undine . There was no getting down again , for the first step down would have been on the ground ; there was nothing to be done but sit still and wait . Consequently the appalling and shocking spectacle which met the eyes of [the upper powers]434-the upper powers , on [their]434-the upper powers return [home]246-home , was [Undine]143-undine , shoeless , kappieless and torn , seated on [the ridge]428-the ridge and holding on with one arm to the gable , while at the other end [Socrates]59-socrates , with clanking chain and tail in air , was dancing [a true devil]437-a true devil 's quadrille . Never were [worthy parents]438-worthy parents and [instructors]439-instructors , on [their]434-the upper powers return from a quiet Sabbath ramble , met by so horrific and wrath - rousing a sight . A second ladder was quickly got and [Undine]143-undine safety deposited upon the ground , where [she]143-undine was instantly marched off into [the house]228-the house to answer for [her]143-undine evil conduct . " How did [you]143-undine get into this plight , [[you]143-undine wicked , [wicked little girl]3046-wicked little girl]3045-you wicked , wicked little girl ? "[272-her mother] said [[her]143-undine mother]272-her mother .

[Undine]143-undine stood with [her]143-undine hands crossed and [her]143-undine eyes fixed on the one little white toe that had forced its way out of the stocking . " [I]143-undine did not mean to , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , feeling very contrite and not a little ashamed of [herself]143-undine . " Did not mean to ! Of course not ! [You]143-undine never mean to do anything that [you]143-undine do . The wind loosened [Socrates]59-socrates and blew [you]143-undine both up onto the roof of [the house]228-the house ! Of course it did ; [we]3048-we all know that it did . "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine felt very much inclined to say that [she]143-undine was sorry and was not going to do so any more ; then [she]143-undine remembered that saying so might make [her]143-undine punishment less , so [she]143-undine stood still and looked down at [her]143-undine toe . [The lean and lanky individual]442-the lean and lanky individual now struck in [her]143-undine note . " [Undine]143-undine , [[my]143-undine dear]2975-my dear [Undine]143-undine , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said in a very low and subdued voice , " if [you]143-undine continue this course of action , what will become of [your]143-undine immortal soul ? What will become of it ? "[143-undine] This was too much for [Undine]143-undine who had stood still to receive [her]143-undine bullying , filled with contrition and repentance ; it raised all the evil in [her]143-undine nature . " [I]143-undine know [I]143-undine 'm wicked and [I]143-undine do n't care , and [I]143-undine do n't care what becomes of [my]143-undine soul , and [I]143-undine 'm not afraid of anything , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , lifting up [her]143-undine face and throwing back [her]143-undine long tangled hair defiantly .

" Was there ever in [this world]3050-this world so evil disposed[443-a child]

and ungodly [a child]443-a child ? " said [[her]143-undine spiritual guide]3051-her spiritual guide , shaking [her]3051-her spiritual guide head solemnly . "[443-a child] Go to bed , [Undine]143-undine ; go to bed ; [I]0-i shall say no more to [you]143-undine . "[0-i]

" Good - night , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine and [she]143-undine walked off to [[her]143-undine room]444-her room with almost a smile upon [her]143-undine face . But once there and alone , [she]143-undine flung [her]143-undine tired little body across the foot of the bed and cried bitterly . " Oh , [I]143-undine wish [I]143-undine was dead ! [I]143-undine wish [I]143-undine was dead ! There is [nobody]3024-nobody like [me]143-undine , and [nobody]3024-nobody loves [me]143-undine . Oh , [I]143-undine wish [I]143-undine was dead ! "[143-undine] And at last , without undressing , fell asleep .

II . [UNDINE]143-undine 'S JOTTINGS

' TWAS a bright summer afternoon , just three weeks after [my]0-i arrival in [England]5-england . [We]445-we were expecting [visitors]446-visitors , and [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret and [I]0-i had taken [our]445-we needlework out among the rose trees in [the garden]447-the garden .

[[My]0-i brother]448-my brother [Frank]74-frank lolled beside [us]445-we on the grass , pulling flowers to pieces and showering the leaves over [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret 's golden hair and white dress . [He]74-frank had changed in the three years that had passed since last [I]0-i saw [him]74-frank , and had grown noble and handsome enough , [I]0-i thought , even to possess [the beautiful woman on whom [his]74-frank eyes were resting]449-the beautiful woman on whom his eyes were resting . In [my]0-i estimation [no one else]253-no one else was worthy to own [her]449-the beautiful woman on whom his eyes were resting ; certainly not [[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather , whom [I]0-i could not learn to like . [He]74-frank reminded [me]0-i , when [I]0-i first saw [him]74-frank , of the ox hides so often seen lying near the little dam at [home , which had once been damp but by dint of lying in the sun]452-home , which had once been damp but by dint of lying in the sun had been reduced to a stone - like mass of wrinkles and lines ; and [he]74-frank was so tall and thin . For a long time [I]0-i never could see [him]74-frank rise from [his]74-frank seat without having recalled to [my]0-i mind the image of [an earthworm creeping out of the ground , which

unfolds and unfolds itself to unimagined lengths]453-an earthworm creeping out of the ground , which unfolds and unfolds itself to unimagined lengths . [He]74-frank had more resemblance to the skin than to the earthworm , however ; for [he]74-frank was mentally as ossified and incapable of growth as any ox hide under the sun . Only in connection with [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret did there seem a trace of softness in [his]74-frank nature , and it could not be otherwise . Nature gives to [a few persons]454-a few persons to have the influence of sunshine on all [they]454-a few persons touch silently softening , warming , melting it and [she]455-she was one . [I]0-i worshipped [her]455-she ; for in those days [I]0-i had not eaten of the tree of knowledge , and worshipped and thought perfect all [I]0-i loved .

[I]0-i did not care for [[my]0-i grandmother]456-my grandmother nor yet dislike [her]455-she . [She]455-she was [a weak , nervous little old woman]457-a weak , nervous little old woman , who had had all the soul pressed out of [her]455-she long ago , and whose trembling little hands [I]0-i never saw at rest for an instant , except [she]455-she were asleep . On that summer afternoon [we]458-they three sat there , feeling very happy . [They]458-they because [they]458-they were together , and [I]0-i because the roses were beautiful and the sky blue and they glad . The work had dropped from [my]0-i hands and [I]0-i had just got into a delicious dream , in which rosebuds , [princes]459-princes and spirits were largely concerned , when [Frank]74-frank tossed a great white rosebud into [my]0-i face .

" At [your]0-i old work again , "[74-frank] [he]74-frank said , laughing . " [You]0-i 've no idea , "[74-frank] turning to [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret , " what evil thoughts are always fermenting in that little innocent - looking head . It 's [my]74-frank decided opinion that[74-frank]

in a pre - state of existence [she]455-she was [a Buddhist philosopher]460-a buddhist philosopher , or something else equally disagreeable and full of contemplations , and at [her]455-she rebirth [she]455-she did not become quite rejuvenised or lose all [her]455-she old habits ; otherwise [I]0-i ca n't account for [her]455-she , " said [Frank]74-frank , turning round onto [his]74-frank back , while [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret and [I]0-i laughed .[0-i]

" It 's all very well to laugh , "[74-frank] [he]74-frank continued , " but [she]455-she is awfully bad , much worse than [I]74-frank am . [She]455-she is only [a little girl]3054-a little girl and [she]455-she has not any right to have thoughts at all . It 's all very well for [me]74-frank to think that it 's a hard state of affairs when [a poor fellow]3055-a poor fellow has to be called into existence for the purpose of being sent to fire and brimstone ; but it does not do for [her]455-she ; it 's highly improper , highly , "[74-frank] said [Frank]74-frank , rolling round onto [his]74-frank face again .

[Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret opened [her]77-aunt margaret big blue eyes and looked at [me]0-i . [I]0-i had been so shy and said so little since [I]0-i came [there]3010-there , that [I]0-i think [they]462-they all thought [me]0-i [a particularly childish child]463-a particularly childish child ; and [I]0-i was glad of it . [I]0-i was young , but [I]0-i had learnt a little worldly wisdom enough to tell [me]0-i that , if [a man]3044-a man is unfortunate enough to have ideas of [his]3044-a man own , [he]3044-a man had best keep them to [himself]3044-a man . [I]0-i was tired of being called queer and strange and odd , and all those other epithets which [I]0-i had so learned to hate ; and here was [Frank]74-frank dragging all [my]0-i weaknesses out into the sunshine that the old names might be branded on [me]0-i again . What [I]0-i should have said [I]0-i do n't know ,

but at that moment , greatly to [my]0-i joy , [[our]465-our expected guests]466-our expected guests arrived . [They]466-our expected guests consisted of [a parson]467-a parson , [[his]467-a parson wife]243-his wife , [an old young lady]469-an old young lady , and [a certain [Jonathan Barnacles]78-jonathan barnacles , whose wife had been a cousin to [[my]0-i father]471-my father]470-a certain jonathan barnacles , whose wife had been a cousin to my father . All these had come to assist in the stirring up of the deadened consciences of [[[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather 's congregation]473-my grandfather 's congregation .

From behind [our]465-our wall of roses [we]465-our could , without being seen , observe and criticise [them]466-our expected guests as [they]466-our expected guests walked up [the long garden path]474-the long garden path . The advance was led by [the Rev. [Joseph Goodman]79-joseph goodman]475-the rev. joseph goodman and [[his]79-joseph goodman portly spouse]476-his portly spouse , both tall , both fat : [she]476-his portly spouse decidedly good looking , with large brown eyes and a Roman nose ; [he]79-joseph goodman , decidedly greasy and with a dirty white choker . [I]0-i was struck dumb with horror at the way in which [the good lady]477-the good lady turned [her]477-the good lady head from side to side , evidently bent , as [I]0-i thought , on discovering [our]465-our whereabouts , but , as [I]0-i afterwards learnt , merely from a long - acquired habit and a wish to overlook [no one]406-no one . Close at [their]465-our heels was [a little angular figure , dressed in a very fashionable and juvenile manner , whose head and face were completely enveloped in a blue gauze veil]479-a little angular figure , dressed in a very fashionable and juvenile manner , whose head and face were completely enveloped in a blue gauze veil . [Frank]74-frank said [she]476-his portly spouse had taken to attending revivals and staying to prayer - meetings only since the arrival in [their]465-our circuit of [a young assistant preacher whose mother [she]476-his portly spouse was old enough to be]480-a young assistant preacher whose mother she was old enough to be .

The rear was brought up by [Jonathan Barnacles]78-jonathan barnacles ,

Esq . , at whom [I]0-i looked with more interest ; for , after the Dutch fashion , might [he]78-jonathan barnacles not be called [a relation of [mine]0-i]481-a relation of mine ? [He]78-jonathan barnacles was [a lean , bony man of about two - and - forty , with large calm blue eyes , lanky and scanty hair and beard]482-a lean , bony man of about two - and - forty , with large calm blue eyes , lanky and scanty hair and beard , and an enormous mouth a mouth that seemed forever hungering and seeking after something . [I]0-i wished [he]78-jonathan barnacles were no connection of [mine]0-i when [I]0-i looked at it , [little child though [I]0-i was]483-little child though i was . Looked at from the lip upwards , [he]78-jonathan barnacles might have been [an angel]484-an angel ; looked at from the lip downwards , [he]78-jonathan barnacles might have been [a devil]485-a devil . [He]78-jonathan barnacles was dressed then and [I]0-i never , in all the years [I]0-i knew [him]78-jonathan barnacles , saw [him]78-jonathan barnacles in anything else , except on Sundays in a rusty brown jacket and a pair of dark green - and - blue - plaid trousers . To [me]0-i those trousers have become so a part of [the man]486-the man that [I]0-i can never see any like them without being unpleasantly reminded of [him]78-jonathan barnacles .

As soon as [the visitors]487-the visitors had gone into [the house]228-the house [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret rose to follow [them]487-the visitors , and [Frank]74-frank and [I]0-i were left alone . [He]74-frank asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i were going to the revival meeting that evening . " [You]0-i had better , "[74-frank] [he]74-frank said ; " it 's great fun . [I]74-frank always do : [I]74-frank take [my]74-frank notebook and pencil ; one hears things worth remembering sometimes . Besides , [you]490-you 'll get into hot water if [you]490-you do n't go , and pretend to be edified , too . There are just three grand crimes according to [[your]490-you grandfather]3056-your grandfather 's creed to give expression to an idea that has not been propounded at least one hundred times before [you]490-you were born ; to believe in the[74-frank]

pos- possible

sible salvation of [a Roman Catholic]489-a roman catholic ; and to absent [yourself]490-you from a little heaven below :

" [I]74-frank have been [there]3010-there , and still would go , ' Tis like a little heaven below "[74-frank]

hummed [Frank]74-frank as [he]74-frank rose to go into [the house]228-the house , where [he]74-frank would no doubt look up [his]74-frank " Golden Light , "[74-frank] as [he]74-frank nicknamed [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret .

[I]0-i went to the revival meeting that evening , for [I]0-i had never been to one before . [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret and [I]0-i started some time after [the others]358-the others , so [we]493-we had a pleasant long walk all to [ourselves]493-we . [Frank]74-frank , in spite of the sage advice of the morning , did not go . [I]0-i suppose , having got what [he]74-frank wanted , [he]74-frank did not care whether [he]74-frank pleased [[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather or not , and could not make up [his]74-frank mind to leave an easy chair and cigar for " those purgatorial Methodist planks , "[74-frank] as [he]74-frank irreverently called the straight - backed pews in [[[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather 's chapel]496-my grandfather 's chapel . [We]493-we walked on in silence at first through the quiet twilight . At last [I]0-i said : " Do [you]497-you like going to revival meetings ? Do [they]3058-they do [you]497-you good , [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret ? "[0-i] " [I]497-you do n't know that [they]3058-they ever did , "[497-you] [she]497-you said , hesitating a little , " but [Christ]80-christ does show [himself]80-christ wonderfully sometimes ; and [I]497-you feel , if only one soul is saved , it must be [God]62-god 's own work and [I]497-you must help it . Think , if only [one soul]3059-one soul be saved from endless pain and sin , what a glorious work . "[497-you]

The twilight gave [me]0-i boldness , so [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i wish [you]497-you could feel as [I]0-i do , that [[our]493-we Father]3060-our father will let nothing [he]3060-our father has made be lost forever . As long as [I]0-i believe as [you]497-you do [I]0-i could not love [him]3060-our father , nor serve [him]3060-our father ; but since [I]0-i have left off looking to the Bible , and listen to what [he]3060-our father says in [my]0-i own soul , [I]0-i love [him]3060-our father and [I]0-i am happy . "[0-i] " [I]498-i wish [you]0-i could make [me]498-i think so too , "[498-i] [she]498-i said , " but [I]499-i know it is wrong even to say so . If once [we]493-we listen to [our]493-we own hearts and use [our]493-we reason , [we]493-we go away from [God]62-god . Yet do [you]0-i know , if [some one whom [I]499-i loved very much]3061-some one whom i loved very much were to die not loving [Christ]80-christ , [I]499-i think [I]499-i am sure , [I]499-i should go mad , quite mad . It is so terrible that [you]0-i can not pray for [them]3061-some one whom i loved very much , that [you]0-i can not do anything for [them]3061-some one whom i loved very much when once [they]3061-some one whom i loved very much are gone . [We]3062-we must pray for [them]3061-some one whom i loved very much now , now , "[499-i] [she]499-i said , with a passionate earnestness that astonished [me]0-i ; [she]499-i was so bright and placid generally . [I]0-i looked up into [her]499-i face , and [I]0-i fancied there were tears in [her]499-i eyes , but [I]0-i could hardly tell , for it was so dark . [I]0-i knew of whom [she]499-i was thinking , and long after [I]0-i remembered [her]499-i words . [The chapel]500-the chapel was dimly lighted . Only round the pulpit there were two or three candles , whose light served to make clearly visible [the three principal actors in the scene about to be performed]501-the three principal actors in the scene about to be performed .

In front of the pulpit stood [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan , and when [he]81-cousin jonathan spoke [I]0-i could look at nothing but that mouth , that dreadful mouth , that seemed to have

a horrible fascination for [me]0-i . On [his]81-cousin jonathan right [he]81-cousin jonathan was supported by [the Rev. Joseph Goodman]79-joseph goodman , who stood with eyes turned heavenwards and fat hands folded meekly across [his]81-cousin jonathan greasy and distended waistcoat . On [his]81-cousin jonathan left stood [[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather , [his]81-cousin jonathan cold hard eye engaged in critically examining the scattered occupants of the different pews .

The proceedings were opened by the singing of a hymn , in which the torments awaiting [all mankind]503-all mankind , except that infinitesimal portion who are [believers in Christ]504-believers in christ , were set forth vividly , and in no bad verse . That being ended , [[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather engaged in prayer . The prayer was very much in the same key as the hymn had been , but a little bolder and weaker . When it was ended [Brother Vickers]82-brother vickers prayed . [He]82-brother vickers was [one of those who most frequently called [Frank]74-frank 's notebook into requisition]506-one of those who most frequently called frank 's notebook into requisition ; and if [[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather 's way of treating fire and brimstone was cool and calm , so certainly was not [his]82-brother vickers . [The good man]508-the good man fairly worked [himself]508-the good man into a profuse perspiration and dragged away at the pew - back before [us]509-us with both hands and with such fervent energy that [I]0-i momentarily expected to see [him]508-the good man fly , pew - back and all , against [my]0-i head . [Brother Vickers]82-brother vickers ' prayer ended , another hymn was sung , and then [Brother Jones]83-brother jones was called upon .

[Some men]510-some men must think [the Almighty]84-the almighty very ignorant , for [they]510-some men never kneel down to speak to [him]84-the almighty without feeling [themselves]510-some men called upon to explain to [him]84-the almighty

the whole plan of salvation , creation , and damnation : subjects on which , one might almost suppose , [he]84-the almighty would be better informed than [themselves]510-some men . [Brother Jones]83-brother jones was one of these . It may have been that [my]0-i mood was not very charitable that evening , but it certainly seemed to [me]0-i that , in place of praying to [any other being]511-any other being , [he]84-the almighty was laying out for [his]84-the almighty own personal edification and satisfaction the whole circle of [his]84-the almighty theological knowledge .

When [we]512-we rose from [our]512-we knees , before [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan gave out the next hymn , [Mr. Goodman]85-mr. goodman came forward and told [us]512-we that , if the spirit of [God]62-god had touched any of [our]512-we hearts during the preceding prayers , [we]512-we were requested to come up .

" Do come up , [dear friends]3063-dear friends , do come up , "[85-mr. goodman] [he]85-mr. goodman said .

The hymn finished , the spirit still remaining inactive and [no one]406-no one having accepted the invitation , it was repeated a second time , more urgently than at first .

" Do come up , [dear friends]3063-dear friends , do come up . While [Brother Stiles]86-brother stiles engages in prayer , do come up . "[86-brother stiles]

[Brother Stiles]86-brother stiles began , [Brother Stiles]86-brother stiles ended ; [no one]406-no one moved . Before [Brother Stubbles]87-brother stubbles engaged , the invitation was again renewed : " The time is young , [dear friends]3063-dear friends . Will [no one]406-no one begin ? Will [no one]406-no one come up ? "[87-brother stubbles]

[No one]406-no one would ; so [Brother Stubbles]87-brother stubbles began . Between every verse of the hymn that followed [Mr.

Goodman]85-mr. goodman continued to ask , at last almost with tears , if [no one]406-no one would come up , if [no one]406-no one would lead the way . " Do come , do come , "[85-mr. goodman] [he]85-mr. goodman cried , as [he]85-mr. goodman moved both hands unctuously to and fro ; and [my]0-i heart was touched with pity for [the unfortunate man]518-the unfortunate man . [I]0-i looked round [the chapel]500-the chapel anxiously to see if there was no sign of an upward movement , but could discover none .

[Brother Snappers , who prayed next]520-brother snappers , who prayed next , seemed to have been moved in the same way , for [he]520-brother snappers , who prayed next scolded quite rabidly : If there were any there that evening and [he]520-brother snappers , who prayed next knew there were such whose hearts [God]62-god had touched , let [them]521-they beware ! If [they]521-they refused to accept the invitation , if [they]521-they refused to come up , that night , that very moment , the spirit of [God]62-god might leave [them]521-they ; and that day year , or that day month , or that day week , nay , by that time tomorrow , [they]521-they might be in [that place from which there would be no coming up forever]522-that place from which there would be no coming up forever . [He]85-mr. goodman did not say so , but [he]85-mr. goodman left [one]397-one the impression that [he]85-mr. goodman would not have many tears to weep if such were the case .

[Brother Goodman]88-brother goodman [himself]88-brother goodman prayed next , a rambling , meandering sort of prayer , which would have been just as suitable at a funeral , a coronation , or a wedding .

Then [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan , after a last vain appeal , closed the meeting with a prayer ; and that prayer , sweet , tender and earnest , seemed strangely out of harmony with the rest of the evening 's proceedings .

' Twas like entering [a silent sunny cove]524-a silent sunny cove after being tossed among black breakers . [He]88-brother goodman prayed for those who had not yet felt the love of [Christ]80-christ , that to [them]521-they it might speak with its glorious power , till at length , perfect in purity , [they]521-they might become but the living reflection of that unfathomable love . Perfect purity , perfect truth ; through every sentence the yearning for it breathed ; and when [we]525-we rose from [our]525-we knees and [I]0-i looked up into [his]88-brother goodman face , [I]0-i could not see that the mouth was always craving something ; [I]0-i looked only at the serene eyes and brow .

When the meeting was over [we]525-we all walked [home]246-home rather silently , for it had been a failure to [all of [us]525-we]527-all of us . As for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i had made up [my]0-i mind , even in spite of [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's beautiful prayer , never to attend another ; never , come what would . On [our]525-we way [home]246-home [the Goodmans]89-the goodmans turned in to have a chat at [[Brother Vickers]82-brother vickers 's]529-brother vickers 's , [Frank]74-frank and [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret went for a stroll on [the beach]530-the beach , and when [we]525-we got to [the house]228-the house [[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather and [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan took [themselves]89-the goodmans off to [the study]533-the study . There was nothing else to be done , so [I]0-i curled [myself]0-i up at one end of the great parlour sofa with [Wolf]90-wolf 's fairy tales . [I]0-i still enjoyed them as much as [I]0-i had done when [I]0-i was eight years old , though [I]0-i had such an old , old - womanish feeling sometimes .

Presently [[my]0-i grandmother]456-my grandmother and [Miss Mell]91-miss mell came in and sat down at the other end of [the room]239-the room . [I]0-i think [they]536-they soon forgot [my]0-i presence ; [Miss Mell]91-miss mell kept

up a constant flow of talk , while [[my]0-i poor nervous little grandmother]537-my poor nervous little grandmother put in a timid little yes or no when [she]537-my poor nervous little grandmother thought it required , and pulled away at the fringe of [her]537-my poor nervous little grandmother crochet wrapper . [She]537-my poor nervous little grandmother was old and not beautiful , but [she]537-my poor nervous little grandmother looked so beside [Miss Mell]91-miss mell who sat opposite [her]537-my poor nervous little grandmother in [her]537-my poor nervous little grandmother juvenile dress , with [her]537-my poor nervous little grandmother wrinkles and [her]537-my poor nervous little grandmother sharp nose and chin , over which the skin was drawn so tightly that a little more would surely have caused it to crack . At first [I]0-i was too much engrossed by [my]0-i book to pay any attention to what [they]536-they said ; but when [my]0-i tale was ended [I]0-i sat and listened .

" A pity [she]537-my poor nervous little grandmother praises up [those great fat girls]3068-those great fat girls so , "[91-miss mell] [Miss Mell]91-miss mell was just saying of [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman . " What were [you]456-my grandmother talking about , [dears]3076-dears , when [I]94-ma came in ? " Ah ! this is a sad , sad , wicked world , "[92-mrs. goodman] said [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman , gazing fixedly at the wall opposite and shaking [her]92-mrs. goodman head slowly . "[92-mrs. goodman] [Miss Mell]91-miss mell , not perceiving the exact bearing of these remarks on the subject in hand , sat still ; but [[my]0-i grandmother]456-my grandmother uttered a timid , " Yes . "[456-my grandmother] " Ah ! [you]2975-my dear may well say yes , [dear]3073-dear . [I]456-my grandmother have had a dreadful blow this evening . If [[my]456-my grandmother dear girls]3095-my dear girls had not given [their]3095-my dear girls hearts to [Christ]80-christ , [I]456-my grandmother should tremble for [them]3095-my dear girls , yes , even for [them]3095-my dear girls "[456-my grandmother] ; and the tears that had been gathering in [the good woman]548-the good woman 's eyes rolled slowly down [her]548-the good woman cheeks . " What have [you]2975-my dear heard ? "[91-miss mell] said [Miss Mell]91-miss mell , who already scented something good . " [You]2975-my dear do n't say so , [[my]91-miss mell dear]2975-my dear ! [I]91-miss mell 'm so grieved [I]91-miss mell said one word about it .
