[You]2975-my dear know [I]91-miss mell never talk about such things , never , never ; but , oh ! it is the saddest , saddest thing [I]91-miss mell 've heard for a long , long time ; though [I]91-miss mell always knew that that [Mrs. Harvey]99-mrs. harvey was not [a good woman]3098-a good woman . [I]91-miss mell said so long ago at the time [she]99-mrs. harvey left [[our]3099-our chapel]3100-our chapel for[91-miss mell]

[the church]549-the church . [Mrs. Lovedy]100-mrs. lovedy was nursing [her]100-mrs. lovedy when [[her]100-mrs. lovedy first boy]550-her first boy was born , and [she]100-mrs. lovedy told [me]0-i things , dear , dreadful things ; [she]100-mrs. lovedy said " and there followed the relation , in minutest detail , of things such as [I]100-mrs. lovedy had not even dreamed of , whose hideous shadow had never yet been thrown across [my]100-mrs. lovedy young life . From [[my]100-mrs. lovedy lonely African [home]246-home]3101-my lonely african home [I]100-mrs. lovedy had brought an ignorance of evil and of that which , holy and pure in itself , [man]3103-man 's folly has made so that might have been thought strange in [a child of six years]3104-a child of six years . Much that had been cause of vague speculation and wonder was made clear to [me]100-mrs. lovedy that night , and [I]100-mrs. lovedy was wretched ; for , alas ! is it not the old , old story that the tree of knowledge is the tree of pain , and that , "[100-mrs. lovedy] In the day wherein [thou]551-thou eatest [thou]551-thou shalt surely die " stand written on every fruit of the wonderful tree ?[100-mrs. lovedy]

[The gentlemen]552-the gentlemen came in after a time to say good - night , and [I]0-i slipped off the sofa and went to [[my]0-i own little room]553-my own little room , for [I]0-i did not feel in the mood to be spoken to by [anyone]3037-anyone .

When [I]0-i got [there]3010-there , it somehow seemed that all was changed ; nothing looked as it used to look ; the very light did not produce its old effect when it shone on the white bed curtains ; and [my]0-i beautiful bunch of roses told quite a different tale from that which it had whispered in the morning . [I]0-i felt sour and bitter , and [I]0-i took the poor bunch [I]0-i had gathered with such care and flung it out of the window ; then [I]0-i partly undressed and sat down upon the floor and

set [my]0-i candle down opposite [me]0-i . It did [me]0-i good to look at its wicked red flame flicker and flare . Before that night [I]0-i had often felt sympathy with [my]0-i candle ; but then it had seemed to [me]0-i [a poor soul always striving to grow higher , and never succeeding]556-a poor soul always striving to grow higher , and never succeeding ; now it looked red and bad , like [the new world that had been opened to [me]0-i]557-the new world that had been opened to me . This was [a wretched earth]558-a wretched earth , and perhaps , after all , there was [a place of endless sin and therefore of endless pain]559-a place of endless sin and therefore of endless pain ; it would only be [the world a little more worldly]560-the world a little more worldly , [I]0-i thought .

[Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret came in to wish [me]0-i good night just then ; [she]77-aunt margaret had a crimson wrapper over [her]77-aunt margaret head , so [I]0-i knew [she]77-aunt margaret had just returned from [the beach]530-the beach . [She]77-aunt margaret looked more beautiful than ever and happier than [I]0-i had ever seen [her]77-aunt margaret ; but [she]77-aunt margaret seemed to have changed , just like the roses and the light . " [I]77-aunt margaret thought [I]77-aunt margaret should find [you]0-i in bed , "[77-aunt margaret] [she]77-aunt margaret said , stooping down over [me]0-i . " Which are [you]0-i studying [your]0-i little bare toes or the candle ? "[77-aunt margaret] " Neither , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " but [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was not [a woman]374-a woman . [I]0-i hate [women]346-women ; [they]346-women are horrible and disgusting , and [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had never been born rather than to be one . "[0-i] " Why , [darling]3107-darling , what is the matter now ? [I]77-aunt margaret am very glad [I]77-aunt margaret am [a woman]374-a woman ; it is so sweet "[77-aunt margaret] ; and a soft smile played round [her]77-aunt margaret mouth as [she]77-aunt margaret spoke . " Did [you]0-i like the revival meeting this evening ? "[77-aunt margaret] [she]77-aunt margaret asked [me]0-i after a pause . " No . It was horrible . [I]0-i am never going to another , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , briefly .

" Oh yes , [you]0-i will . [You]0-i will make [papa]3109-papa so angry if [you]0-i do not . "[77-aunt margaret] " [I]0-i ca n't help it , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " There are some places that make [one wicked]3110-one wicked , and it 's not right to go to [them]3111-them . [I]0-i feel tonight as if [everyone in [the world]222-the world]3112-everyone in the world were [a hypocrite]3114-a hypocrite , and [I]0-i shall be one too , if [I]0-i go to [these places]3115-these places just for the sake of pleasing [some one else]3116-some one else as bad as [Miss Mell]91-miss mell and [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman . "[0-i] [You]0-i are tired tonight , [darling]3107-darling ; tomorrow things will look brighter to [your]0-i poor little eyes . [You]0-i have sat up too late . Good night , [sweet]563-sweet ; " and [she]77-aunt margaret went out and [I]563-sweet was left alone with [my]563-sweet red light . [I]563-sweet soon got chilly and sleepy and crept into bed . [I]563-sweet remember that day because , first , on it the joy and peace [I]563-sweet had lived in for two years began to break ; because on it [I]563-sweet first entered the shadow of that cloud in whose darkness [I]563-sweet was to walk for years , hoping nothing , believing nothing , trusting nothing .[563-sweet]

III . THE MAN WITH THE MOUTH

AS [AUNT MARGARET]77-aunt margaret had said , things looked brighter in the morning the beautiful morning that throws its veil of misty light over the great ugly truths which , in all their hideous nakedness , have stood staring [us]564-us in the eyes and riding [us]564-us on the breast all night .

[Undine]143-undine , as soon as [she]143-undine was dressed , ran down to [the beach]530-the beach ; there the tiny waves danced laughing on the sides of the big ones , which in [their]566-their turn chased and overtook [one another]567-one another , tossing [their]566-their heads high into the sunny air and turning to white foam , or making a mad dash for [the land]568-the land and dying away in laughing ripples on [the sand]569-the sand .

On such a morning , on this side of twenty , with [no ghosts to haunt one and come in between the happy sunshine and the eyes , who would not forget that there are such things as revival meetings]570-no ghosts to haunt one and come in between the happy sunshine and the eyes , who would not forget that there are such things as revival meetings , and [good people who always say one thing and mean another]571-good people who always say one thing and mean another , and [jealous old maids]572-jealous old maids and [unfaithful wives]573-unfaithful wives , and dry hippopotamus - hide - like [old men]574-old men ? Who would not forget that underneath this green ,

laugh- laughing

ing , merry old world lies fire and brimstone , into which a fall from any rock may send one in a moment ? [Undine]143-undine forgot this and everything , and grew at last as wild as the dancing waves . [She]143-undine had brought poor [George Macdonald]101-george macdonald with [her]143-undine for company , but now [she]143-undine threw [him]101-george macdonald down upon [the sand]569-the sand , where the waves caught [him]101-george macdonald and made fine sport of [his]101-george macdonald Unspoken Sermons and almost ran away with [them]566-their ; while [she]143-undine leapt from rock to rock , and finally pulled off [her]143-undine shoes and stockings , the better to keep [her]143-undine footing and capture the queer little beings which every wave left behind it in [the rocky hollows]576-the rocky hollows .

[She]143-undine was very busily securing [an extraordinary little monster , with a multiplicity of tails and feelers]577-an extraordinary little monster , with a multiplicity of tails and feelers , and , with [her]143-undine head some two feet lower than [her]143-undine feet , was in no small danger of having an unexpected bath in [the shallow pool]578-the shallow pool , when [she]143-undine heard a voice at [her]143-undine elbow . Rising to [her]143-undine feet with some difficulty and throwing back the wild hair from [her]143-undine eyes , [she]143-undine saw , standing beside [her]143-undine none other than [the man with the green - plaid trousers]579-the man with the green - plaid trousers and the mouth [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan . [He]81-cousin jonathan asked what [she]143-undine was looking for ; and when [he]81-cousin jonathan understood very soon captured the queer little fish .

The presence of [a second person]580-a second person had in an instant taken all the exhilaration and life out of the morning and brought [her]143-undine back to the disagreeable human

world , in which wild hair , wet clothes , and bare feet were terribly disgraceful things . [She]143-undine felt conscience - stricken and looked down into [the little pool]581-the little pool , wishing [she]143-undine were [one of the little fishes swimming there]582-one of the little fishes swimming there .

[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan held out the fish [he]81-cousin jonathan had just caught with one hand ; in the other [he]81-cousin jonathan had poor [George Macdonald]101-george macdonald , looking almost as wet and disreputable as [[its]101-george macdonald mistress]583-its mistress . " [I]81-cousin jonathan find [your]143-undine name in this book , so [I]81-cousin jonathan suppose [you]143-undine must have dropped it , "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan said as [he]81-cousin jonathan gave it to [her]143-undine . " The waves were very nearly stealing it , as [I]81-cousin jonathan fear [they]3117-they may [you]143-undine one of these days , if [you]143-undine continue such [a very zealous little naturalist]3118-a very zealous little naturalist . "[81-cousin jonathan] " [I]143-undine 'm not [a naturalist]3119-a naturalist ; [I]143-undine do n't know anything about fishes or about anything else , "[143-undine] stammered [Undine]143-undine , hardly knowing what [she]143-undine said . [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan smiled , not an unpleasant smile of ridicule , but one of quiet amusement . " [They]3117-they say , when [we]3120-we know [our]3120-we own deficiencies [they]3117-they are half rectified . [You]143-undine would like to know all about [a strange little fellow like this]3121-a strange little fellow like this , would [you]143-undine not ? "[81-cousin jonathan] " [I]143-undine would like to know something about [him]3121-a strange little fellow like this , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine answered , the kind , quiet manner of [[her]143-undine companion]584-her companion already beginning to set [her]143-undine at [her]143-undine ease . " When [I]143-undine was at [home]246-home [I]143-undine used to try and learn a little about plants and insects , but [I]143-undine never had [anyone]3037-anyone to help [me]143-undine and [I]143-undine had not the right books . "[143-undine]

" Perhaps [I]584-her companion could help [you]143-undine a little , "[584-her companion] [he]584-her companion said ; " at[584-her companion]

least [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i could , with books ; but if [you]143-undine do not wish to study them , what makes [you]143-undine take such trouble to catch them ? "[143-undine]

" [I]143-undine do n't know , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , " but [I]143-undine never see anything beautiful without wanting to have it , especially if it 's very hard to get . It 's not beautiful now , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , turning over the poor little fish in [her]143-undine hand . " [I]584-her companion never can see some beautiful things without wishing for them , "[584-her companion] [he]584-her companion said , and when [he]584-her companion spoke those words [he]584-her companion spoke the truth . [He]584-her companion helped [her]143-undine over [the rocks]585-the rocks , with that respectful kindness with which [even little children]586-even little children like to be treated ; and , when [they]587-they reached [the beach]530-the beach , sat down beside [her]143-undine and let [his]584-her companion talk wander on , from a description of the nature and habits of the little creature in [her]143-undine hand to that wonderland which the microscope makes visible ; and [Undine]143-undine sat and listened till [she]143-undine forgot [his]584-her companion mouth and forgot even [her]143-undine own bare toes . " [We]587-they must go [home]246-home to breakfast , "[584-her companion] [he]584-her companion said at last , and [Undine]143-undine went in search of [her]143-undine shoes and stockings . [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan never forgot when it was time for a meal .

On [their]587-they walk [home]246-home [he]81-cousin jonathan changed the conversation and tried to draw [her]143-undine out ; for the study of character pleased [him]81-cousin jonathan , and [he]81-cousin jonathan felt attracted by [the queer , babyish , womanish creature]590-the queer , babyish , womanish creature . [She]143-undine was [an orphan]591-an orphan , too , and almost friendless , and [he]81-cousin jonathan pitied [her]143-undine .

[More- Moreover]102-more- moreover

over , had [she]143-undine not looked lovely as [she]143-undine stood there on [the rocks]585-the rocks with the hot blood in [her]143-undine cheeks and [her]143-undine exquisite little feet clinging to the rough stones . [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan liked beautiful things of the feminine gender .

[Undine]143-undine as [she]143-undine trotted beside [him]81-cousin jonathan had little idea that [he]81-cousin jonathan or [anyone else]593-anyone else could see anything in [her]143-undine to admire ; but with [a woman]374-a woman 's quick perception [she]143-undine felt intuitively that whatever [she]143-undine might say , it was all right , it would be well received ; and accordingly [her]143-undine ideas and words flowed forth in such a stream as would have astonished anyone who knew [her]143-undine as [the shy awkward child in whose throat even yes and no seemed usually to stick]595-the shy awkward child in whose throat even yes and no seemed usually to stick . [Undine]143-undine passed the day almost entirely in [[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's society]596-cousin jonathan 's society . [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret was busy , and when [she]77-aunt margaret had time to spare was with [Frank]74-frank , who was returning to [college]597-college the next day . In the evening [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan left , for [[his]81-cousin jonathan wife]243-his wife was [an invalid]599-an invalid and [he]81-cousin jonathan could never be from [home]246-home long . At parting [he]81-cousin jonathan told [Undine]143-undine that [he]81-cousin jonathan would send [her]143-undine books and that , in return , [she]143-undine was to write and tell [him]81-cousin jonathan what [she]143-undine thought of them . When [he]81-cousin jonathan walked down [the garden path]601-the garden path , [she]143-undine stood looking after [him]81-cousin jonathan and feeling almost as though [an old friend]602-an old friend were going .

[IV]103-iv . GOING TO [CHAPEL

EVERY house]603-chapel every house has [its]603-chapel every house smoky chimney , [[its]603-chapel every house draughty room]604-its draughty room , [its]603-chapel every house creaky door ; every life its own haunting shadows ; and every state of life its own small troubles . It may be , when [we]605-us arrive in a new place or enter upon altered circumstances , the sky is all serenely blue above [us]605-us ; but ' tis never long before the discovering eye perceives the tiny cloud the cloud on the horizon , at first no bigger than [a man]3044-a man 's hand , which , growing greater and never quite dissolving , hangs over [us]605-us , forever ready to rain sorrows on [our]605-us heads . The direction from which [her]143-undine storms were to arise was soon made clear to [Undine]143-undine . After [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan left [she]143-undine took [her]143-undine work and sat down at one end of the pantry dresser where [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret was busy making cakes for tea . Every now and then [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret looked down at [Undine]143-undine and wondered what was knitting [her]143-undine brow and making [her]143-undine little hands work away with such desperate energy .

[Undine]143-undine [herself]143-undine could hardly have traced the gyration of the thoughts that were tossing in [her]143-undine own

small head , but the result was an unalterable determination that [she]143-undine would go to [chapel]607-chapel no more . It was [her]143-undine duty , yet [she]143-undine could not go , [she]143-undine thought ; and wondered wearily if [she]143-undine were always to be afflicted with senses of duty driving [her]143-undine into paths where [no one else]253-no one else would or could walk .

[The Goodmans]89-the goodmans and [Miss Mell]91-miss mell had been asked out to tea , so there were none but [the family round the table]609-the family round the table that evening . " [You]143-undine must make haste , "[104-mr. roch] said [Mr. Roch]104-mr. roch , " and get [your]143-undine tea done ; the meeting begins in three - quarters of an hour . "[104-mr. roch] " [You]143-undine must take care to wrap [yourself]143-undine up warmly , "[610-the grandmother] said [the grandmother]610-the grandmother ; " [you]143-undine are not accustomed to [our]3125-our climate yet . "[610-the grandmother] " [I]143-undine am not going , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . " What do [you]143-undine say ? "[143-undine] asked [[her]143-undine grandmother]611-her grandmother , in whose throat the words stuck so fast that not even [Frank]74-frank , who sat next [her]611-her grandmother , could hear them . " [I]611-her grandmother am not going to the meeting this evening , "[611-her grandmother] [she]611-her grandmother answered , staring very hard at [her]611-her grandmother plate as [she]611-her grandmother spoke . " Do [you]143-undine feel ill tonight , [dear]3073-dear ? [You]143-undine look very pale , "[77-aunt margaret] said [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret . " [I]77-aunt margaret am quite well , thank [you]143-undine ; but [I]77-aunt margaret would rather not go tonight . "[77-aunt margaret] " [I]74-frank wish all [[my]74-frank household]3127-my household to be [there]3010-there , "[74-frank] said the dried hide , straightening and elongating [himself]74-frank in [his]74-frank seat .

" Perhaps [she]143-undine wishes to stay with [Frank]74-frank , as it is the last evening , "[612-the poor nervous little grandmother] said [the poor nervous little grandmother]612-the poor nervous little grandmother in an apologetic little whisper . " [Frank]74-frank is going with [Margaret]77-aunt margaret , "[74-frank] said the dried hide , with [his]74-frank leathery , intonationless voice . It sounded so terrible to [Undine]143-undine and filled [her]143-undine with such tremblings , that [the brown Wesleys]613-the brown wesleys and Fletchers in the little bookcase behind [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather seemed to go up to the ceiling and come slowly down to the floor , and [she]143-undine wondered if [everyone in the room]615-everyone in the room could not hear [her]143-undine heart beat . " [I]143-undine would rather not go , [I]143-undine do n't mind staying alone at all , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said at last . " Why do [you]143-undine not wish to go ? "[614-her grandfather] said [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather , fixing [his]614-her grandfather cold eyes upon [her]143-undine . " [I]614-her grandfather do n't think it is [I]614-her grandfather mean [I]614-her grandfather do n't get any good from going , and , [I]614-her grandfather would rather stay please . "[614-her grandfather] [Her]143-undine voice had almost died away as [she]143-undine spoke the last words . " Why do [you]143-undine not wish to go ? "[614-her grandfather] repeated [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather in [his]614-her grandfather usual calm voice . The blood came back to [Undine]143-undine 's cheek , and with it [her]143-undine spirit rose . " Because it would be wicked of [me]143-undine , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , and then , feeling that anything would be better than the silence that ensued , [she]143-undine went on , " [I]143-undine ca n't go and pretend to be serving [God]62-god when all "[143-undine]

" Be silent , "[614-her grandfather] said [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather . " [Little children who act in this manner]3129-little children who act in this manner should be whipped and[614-her grandfather]

taught how to behave [themselves]619-themselves . It is a pity [you]143-undine are not a few years younger , [Undine]143-undine . "[143-undine]

[The child]223-the child looked up at [him]614-her grandfather , with eyes almost blinded by rage and hatred , and trembling in every limb ; then suddenly there came to [her]143-undine a thought the thought of [One who bore all things in meekness , wrongs in silence , who returned cruelty with acts of mercy , and the hatred of evil with the love of a god]621-one who bore all things in meekness , wrongs in silence , who returned cruelty with acts of mercy , and the hatred of evil with the love of a god . Through long years of ceaseless dreaming [he]614-her grandfather had become to [her]143-undine no vague shadowy existence of the long past , but a present living reality , ever aiding and ever sympathising , to whose influence were ascribed all [her]143-undine higher thought and better feeling , no matter from what source they arose . [She]143-undine thought of [him]614-her grandfather , and no answer rose to [her]143-undine lips ; and in place of the fury only a cold fainting at [her]143-undine heart was left . [She]143-undine sat here so quietly , breaking up into little bits the bread in [her]143-undine plate , that [Frank]74-frank , remembering [the Undine of the old African]622-the undine of the old african days , gazed at [her]143-undine in astonishment , expecting an outburst . None came ; and when [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather rose from the table and told [her]143-undine to get ready [she]143-undine quietly went to obey [him]614-her grandfather .

" Conquered , "[624-the old man] thought [the old man]624-the old man as [he]624-the old man put [his]624-the old man coat on in [the hall]625-the hall ; but perhaps [he]624-the old man would hardly have thought so could [he]624-the old man have seen what was passing in [the heart of the conquered]626-the heart of the conquered . " It is very hard and bitter to have to go after all this , but because it is bitter it must be right to go just this once , at[624-the old man]

least as a punishment to [myself]0-i . " So [she]143-undine reasoned as [she]143-undine walked beside [him]624-the old man on the way to [the little Methodist chapel]3130-the little methodist chapel .[624-the old man]

The meeting passed for [Undine]143-undine very much as the last had done ; only that this evening , on the seat in front of [her]143-undine , sat [a tall , gaunt old woman in a black bonnet who from time to time]627-a tall , gaunt old woman in a black bonnet who from time to time pushed and pulled at the shoulder of [the sallow girl who sat next [her]143-undine]628-the sallow girl who sat next her , in an endeavour to drive [her]143-undine up to the rails every time the invitation was uttered afresh . " [I]629-the poor creature do n't want to go , "[629-the poor creature] [the poor creature]629-the poor creature whispered , drawing back ; and [she]143-undine would , [Undine]143-undine thought , have kept [her]143-undine ground had it not been for [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman , who , leaning over the back of the bench , whispered loudly in [her]143-undine ear , " Go up , [[my]92-mrs. goodman dear]2975-my dear ; go up . "[92-mrs. goodman] [The girl]630-the girl looked round with a startled expression . It seemed as though all things , above , around , below , were combining to send [her]630-the girl " up . "[631-the poor preacher] [The poor preacher]631-the poor preacher calling from the rails , the prayers hurling anathemas at [those who did not accept the invitation]632-those who did not accept the invitation , the hand of [[her]143-undine companion]584-her companion persistently applying physical force in the direction of salvation , the mysterious voice from the gloomy depths behind urging [her]143-undine upwards : these were forces which [she]143-undine had not strength to resist , and rising slowly [she]143-undine went up . [Undine]143-undine wondered what [she]143-undine found to tell [him]634-him when [Mr. Goodman]85-mr. goodman 's greasy head was bent down over [her]143-undine .

[She]143-undine was the only fruit that evening , but as [they]635-they

walked [home]246-home [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman expressed [her]92-mrs. goodman joy that the blessed work of [Christ]80-christ had begun and that [she]143-undine had been the humble instrumentality in [his]634-him hands for beginning it .

" A word in season , [[my]105-mrs. jones dear]2975-my dear [Mrs. Jones]105-mrs. jones , a word in season ; let [us]635-they be thankful when [the dear Lord]3133-the dear lord allows [us]635-they to speak a word in season , allows [us]635-they poor weak voices to speak a word for [him]634-him . "[105-mrs. jones] [Mrs. Jones]105-mrs. jones , whose [road]637-road lay in the same direction , was accompanying [them]635-they part of the way . [She]105-mrs. jones fully acquiesced , and at parting begged [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman to come and spend the next day with [her]105-mrs. jones . [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman was deeply grieved , but the next day [they]635-they were returning to [Greenwood]6-greenwood ; [she]92-mrs. goodman would not see more of [her]92-mrs. goodman dear [Mrs. Jones]105-mrs. jones . [That lady]638-that lady was , in [her]638-that lady turn , deeply grieved at hearing this , and bargained that [Sarah Jane]93-sarah jane and [Elizabeth Ann]67-nancy should be sent over to spend a week with [her]92-mrs. goodman . [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman said there was [no one in [the world]222-the world with whom [she]92-mrs. goodman would so gladly have [her]92-mrs. goodman treasures as [[her]92-mrs. goodman dearest , oldest , friend]641-her dearest , oldest , friend , and [they]635-they should surely come]639-no one in the world with whom she would so gladly have her treasures as her dearest , oldest , friend , and they should surely come . [[Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman 's dearest]642-mrs. goodman 's dearest always was [the person whom [she]92-mrs. goodman happened to be addressing at the moment]643-the person whom she happened to be addressing at the moment .

[They]644-they parted with an affectionate embrace , and [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman was still wiping [her]92-mrs. goodman cheek from the traces of [Mrs. Jones]105-mrs. jones 's rather moist salutation when [she]92-mrs. goodman remarked : " What [a dear , good creature]3134-a dear , good creature [Mrs. Jones]105-mrs. jones is ! dress at [her]105-mrs. jones age ; and oh , the adornments of [the outer man]645-the outer man , what are they , [[my]0-i dear]2975-my dear [Miss Mell]91-miss mell , what are they ? "[92-mrs. goodman]

" And [[her]105-mrs. jones poor husband]3135-her poor husband , [[my]92-mrs. goodman dear]2975-my dear , "[92-mrs. goodman] continued [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman , " [he]3135-her poor husband ca n't stand it , [[my]92-mrs. goodman dear]2975-my dear , [he]3135-her poor husband ca n't stand it . " [We]3139-we were in the middle of the first prayer when [she]105-mrs. jones came in , and [I]92-mrs. goodman heard the rustle of the silk as soon as ever [she]105-mrs. jones opened the door . [I]92-mrs. goodman thought , "[92-mrs. goodman] Whoever is that!í So [I]0-i just looked up as [she]647-she went by . " "[0-i] Well , it might be , " said [Miss Mell]91-miss mell .
