" Yes , it 's a great pity ; [she]647-she is such [a dear , good creature]3134-a dear , good creature , "[92-mrs. goodman] said [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman , with much earnestness ; " it is a sad , sad pity [she]647-she should be so close : the fly , the fly in the pot of ointment , [[my]92-mrs. goodman dear]2975-my dear . Ah ![92-mrs. goodman]

that fly ! " And so [the good souls]3143-the good souls continued [their]3143-the good souls conversation all the way [home]246-home .[647-she]

Arrived [there]3010-there , [Undine]143-undine ran away to [[her]143-undine own little room]649-her own little room , tonight to study not [her]143-undine candle , but the little brown Testament . [She]143-undine sat reading a little and dreaming a great deal till [she]143-undine had worked [herself]143-undine into a state of beatific felicity ; and in this state [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret found [her]143-undine when half an hour after [she]77-aunt margaret entered [the room]239-the room . " What is making [you]143-undine so happy ? "[77-aunt margaret] [she]77-aunt margaret asked . " [You]143-undine look like one of the little angels [I]77-aunt margaret used to dream about long ago . "[77-aunt margaret] " Nothing , "[143-undine] answered [Undine]143-undine , the golden light fading as quickly from [her]143-undine face as it was from [her]143-undine heart . Heaven on [earth]651-earth is only found in perfect solitude , whether by [saint]416-saint or by [poet]653-poet ; and ' tis only a step from [the heights of [the celestial mountains]655-the celestial mountains]654-the heights of the celestial mountains to [the depths of [the valleys below]657-the valleys below]656-the depths of the valleys below . When [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret had left [her]143-undine [she]143-undine began slowly to pull off [her]143-undine boots ; and it seemed as though the thought of last night , mingled with today 's bitter feelings , all came back to [her]143-undine .

[She]143-undine could just catch the sound of [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather 's voice as it rose in prayer from [the room below]659-the room below ; and as [she]143-undine sat there listening , [the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months began [their]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months dance over [her]143-undine once more . [They]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months asked the old unanswerable questions , and new ones , more unanswerable still ; and dared even to lay profane hands

on the words that had just been transporting [her]143-undine into [the seventh heaven]661-the seventh heaven .

When , however , the prayer below was ended and [she]143-undine had got into bed , [she]143-undine put these suggestions of the evil one from [her]143-undine . [She]143-undine had been reading too much , [she]143-undine had been thinking too much , [she]143-undine had been turning [her]143-undine eyes away from [Christ]80-christ . For a whole month [she]143-undine would touch no book but [His]80-christ word and think no more , and so resolving [she]143-undine fell asleep . The cloud , the little cloud , at first no larger than [a man]3044-a man 's hand , waxed greater as the months went by grew in the end to be so thick and heavy that at last even [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret 's sunshine was absorbed by it . [Undine]143-undine went quietly to [chapel]607-chapel Sunday after Sunday ; and [a meek , sweet , quiet child]664-a meek , sweet , quiet child [she]143-undine was , [they]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months all said , even if rather dull and stupid . [They]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months little knew how those still eyes made food of [their]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months every action ; how forever [they]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months were being hung in the balances and dismissed to have that unchanging " Tekel "[660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months] written up against [them]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months in [her]143-undine mind . [She]143-undine kept [her]143-undine resolution , and except when at [her]143-undine lessons allowed no book to tempt [her]143-undine but [her]143-undine little brown Testament ; that [she]143-undine pored over daily for hours , just as [she]143-undine had done in [[her]143-undine little whitewashed sanctum at [home]246-home]665-her little whitewashed sanctum at home .

Was the Testament most to blame , or the inherent wickedness of [her]143-undine own small heart , or the good women with whom [she]143-undine came in contact in [[[her]143-undine

grand- grandfather]667-her grand- grandfather 's

father 's house]668-her grand- grandfather 's father 's house who , when not in [chapel]607-chapel or talking of [[their]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months neighbours]670-their neighbours , were thanking [the Lord]671-the lord that [they]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months were not as [[their]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months sisters]672-their sisters in the mire ?

Whichever it might be , at the end of three months [this small heathen in [a Christian land]674-a christian land]673-this small heathen in a christian land had made up [her]143-undine mind to go no more to [chapel]607-chapel , had come to the conclusion that neither prayer - meetings nor [[their]660-the old hobgoblins of doubt who had been silent for so many months cousins]676-their cousins , the class - meetings , were the gates of [the Golden City]677-the golden city , but rather the entrances to that other way that , beginning with a short circumbendibus , at last leads one straight to the gates of [the city]678-the city whose walls are of groans and whose pavements of sighs . Having now a very decided hankering after [that Golden City]679-that golden city and a very decided impression that [she]143-undine was bound for it , it could not but be that [she]143-undine should eschew those entrances . [She]143-undine did not believe that at the gates of [the Golden City]677-the golden city stands [a great winged angel]681-a great winged angel : " How old are [you]143-undine ? "[682-he] [he]682-he asks of [the applicant]683-the applicant for entrance . " Thirteen years . "[682-he] " Have [you]143-undine always tried to do as [your]143-undine conscience told [you]143-undine ? But , no , stay . Had [you]143-undine [no one who gave [you]143-undine bread and butter and shoes]3145-no one who gave you bread and butter and shoes ? "[682-he] " Yes . "[682-he] " Oh , then [they]3146-they kept [your]143-undine conscience . If [you]143-undine only tried to obey [them]3146-they Well and faithfully done , enter into joy , and sit down on a throne . "[682-he]

This was what [she]143-undine did not believe ; and so one Sunday morning [she]143-undine came [downstairs]684-downstairs with a laggard step and slow . When [she]143-undine got to the door of [the breakfast room]685-the breakfast room [she]143-undine ran back again , to pray one prayer more , for it was a terrible mountain [she]143-undine had to cross that morning . The window of [the breakfast room]685-the breakfast room was wide open and the morning light forced its way in , gilding for once [the brown Wesleys]106-the brown wesleys and Fletchers in the bookshelf , and playing over the little bunch of flowers [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret had put beside [her]77-aunt margaret plate . [She]77-aunt margaret ate little , and before breakfast was half over had strewed the carpet with the leaves of [her]77-aunt margaret broken flowers . [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret wondered what was wrong with [[her]77-aunt margaret little niece]687-her little niece , and made vain conjectures ; while [Undine]143-undine kept repeating to [herself]143-undine the nice little speech [she]143-undine had prepared to make to [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather , which [she]143-undine had even taken the trouble to write down the night before by way of strengthening [her]143-undine memory . [She]143-undine would tell [him]614-her grandfather that [she]143-undine could not go to [chapel]607-chapel , because it did [her]143-undine harm ; but [she]143-undine would tell it [him]614-her grandfather so humbly and in such terms that even [he]614-her grandfather must forgive [her]143-undine .

But alas for human plans ! Every time [she]143-undine essayed to begin , the words stuck fast in [her]143-undine throat ; the precious moments sped and breakfast was over without one syllable of [her]143-undine carefully prepared little

oration 's having got further than the region of [her]143-undine heart , where it lay , heavy as lead .

When , however , [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather had risen to go , and had passed out into [the passage]691-the passage , [she]143-undine also rose quickly and , standing in the doorway , said , " [Grandfather]107-grandfather . "[614-her grandfather] [He]614-her grandfather turned round slowly and fixed [his]614-her grandfather cold eyes on [her]143-undine . " What is the matter ? "[614-her grandfather] [he]614-her grandfather asked . Seek of the dumb an answer , and [you]692-you will as easily find it as [Undine]143-undine the words of [her]143-undine precious and laboriously concocted little speech . [They]693-they had hopelessly vanished and gone , and in [their]693-they place came only these " [I]143-undine am not going to [chapel]607-chapel . "[143-undine] " [I]614-her grandfather thought [I]614-her grandfather had given [you]143-undine clearly to understand , [Undine]143-undine , on a previous occasion , that [I]614-her grandfather wished [you]143-undine always to go . [I]614-her grandfather allow no disregard of [my]614-her grandfather wishes in [this house]3148-this house . "[614-her grandfather] So saying , [he]614-her grandfather turned round to enter [[his]614-her grandfather study]694-his study , but [Undine]143-undine passed [him]614-her grandfather quickly and stood in the doorway before [him]614-her grandfather .

" [I]143-undine am not going , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " It is a wicked cruel world in which [one human being]3149-one human being has power over another , but [you]143-undine can not make [me]143-undine do what [I]143-undine think is wrong ; and if [I]143-undine go to [chapel]607-chapel just because [I]143-undine fear [you]143-undine [I]143-undine shall be [a hypocrite like [all the others who go there]3152-all the others who go there]3151-a hypocrite like all the others who go there ; and [I]143-undine will not . [All people who love [Christ]80-christ]3153-all people who love christ should keep away from such places , which only bring disgrace and shame upon [his]614-her grandfather name . If [he]614-her grandfather came[143-undine]

to [earth]651-earth today [he]614-her grandfather would denounce [them]696-them as [he]614-her grandfather did [the pharisees]697-the pharisees and [priests]698-priests in [his]614-her grandfather day . It 's all a mockery and an empty show , and [I]0-i shall never go again , never , never . "[0-i]

[Her]699-her words followed one another in a quick incoherent stream while [she]699-her pounded away vigorously with one little hand in the palm of the other , till both were furiously red . [[Her]699-her grandfather]614-her grandfather stood silently looking down at [her]699-her . In [his]614-her grandfather heart horror and wonder largely mingled with hatred were moving , but [his]614-her grandfather face told nothing . For one moment [he]614-her grandfather felt a wish to strike [her]699-her , but [she]699-her scared [him]614-her grandfather , as [she]699-her had often done [[her]699-her old opponents]701-her old opponents , by [her]699-her wild earnestness . [He]614-her grandfather looked at [her]699-her again , and then , without making an effort to enter [[his]614-her grandfather study]694-his study , walked out the front door , conquered for the first time in [his]614-her grandfather life ; conquered by [a little child]703-a little child . And [Undine]143-undine , [the conqueror]704-the conqueror ? Alas ! Has not [the victor]705-the victor 's fate been , from the beginning , to lie down and weep ? [She]143-undine went out into [the garden]447-the garden and dropped down onto the soft green turf among the rose trees .

The sweet Sunday bells were ringing loud ; through the clear morning air [their]707-they music came to [her]143-undine , sounding strangely soft and sweet now that [she]143-undine knew [they]707-they would never summon [her]143-undine again . For [all others]708-all others [they]707-they were calling , but [they]707-they had no word for [her]143-undine ; [she]143-undine was [one alone]288-one alone , without kinship or

fel- fellowship

lowship among [men]710-men so [she]143-undine said in [her]143-undine bitterness . Had [she]143-undine been born with a curse over [her]143-undine head ? Would it be so wherever [she]143-undine might go , that [her]143-undine hand should be against [every man]711-every man , and [every man]711-every man 's hand against [hers]143-undine ? Or was [she]143-undine really so much worse than [others]713-others that , wherever [she]143-undine might go , love and sympathy would be denied [her]143-undine ? Would [she]143-undine have to walk on alone , alone , unloved , misunderstood , right on to the end ?

[She]143-undine was sobbing and digging away with [her]143-undine toes into the soft earth when [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret came and kneeled down beside [her]143-undine .

" Go away , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , fiercely . " [I]143-undine am alone . Leave [me]143-undine alone . "[143-undine]

" [Undine]143-undine darling , what have [I]143-undine done to [you]143-undine ? What has [anyone]3037-anyone done to [you]143-undine ? [Undine]143-undine , [you]143-undine say [you]143-undine love [Christ]80-christ and are trying to be [[his]80-christ child]3155-his child . Do n't [you]143-undine think [you]143-undine were wrong to speak as [you]143-undine did just now ? "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine threw from [her]77-aunt margaret the soft hand that was caressing [her]77-aunt margaret hair , and said , though more gently , " Please go away "[143-undine] ; and [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret rose and left [her]77-aunt margaret .

Long after , [Undine]143-undine thought , with tears bitterer than those [she]143-undine then shed , of the hand [she]143-undine had thrown from [her]77-aunt margaret that morning ; but they were bitter enough to [the little child]277-the little child [the little child]277-the little child , who had not yet found out , as [we]716-we all must sooner or later , that the path through life in which [each soul]717-each soul must tread is

single ; that [no two]718-no two walk abreast ; that where [one soul]3059-one soul stands , never has stood , and never shall stand , another ; but that [each man]720-each man 's life and struggle is a mystery , incomprehensible and forever hid from every heart but [his]720-each man own .

V. A SUNNY AFTERNOON AND A WILD NIGHT

IT WAS summer again ; a dreamy , hazy , delicious summer afternoon . [Three]721-three sat upon the brow of [a small grassy hillock near [the beach]530-the beach]722-a small grassy hillock near the beach [Frank]74-frank , [Undine]143-undine , and [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret .

The grass was rich with great golden - eyed flowers , and [he]74-frank picked them as [he]74-frank lay there , to fasten in the golden hair of [the woman [he]74-frank loved long silky yellow hair that hung about [her]725-her , soft and fleecy as the small white cloud that lay dreaming far away to seaward]724-the woman he loved long silky yellow hair that hung about her , soft and fleecy as the small white cloud that lay dreaming far away to seaward . [Undine]143-undine , sitting a little apart with [her]143-undine book , looked up ever and again to watch [them]726-they ; they were pleasant to look at as the blue sky overhead or the green grass and shimmering light below . Every now and then [she]143-undine caught a word of [their]726-they conversation ; [they]726-they were making little plans for the spending of the long good years that were coming to [them]726-they , when [they]726-they two should be always together . At last [they]726-they called to [her]143-undine : " What shall the colour of the study curtains be red , green , or yellow ? "[726-they]

" Blue , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine " blue , just the colour of [the sea]3156-the sea where it lies at rest , far away . "[143-undine] " No , no ; not that colour , "[77-aunt margaret] [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret answered , quickly . " [I]77-aunt margaret never did so before , but this afternoon [I]77-aunt margaret hate it . Every time [I]77-aunt margaret look up and see it , [I]77-aunt margaret hate it . "[77-aunt margaret]

" Look at that cloud , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine ; " when [we]728-we came ' twas a tiny speck [we]728-we could hardly see , and now ' tis like a great fairy snow - ship in the sky . "[143-undine] Then a silence fell on [all three]727-all three ; but by and by [Frank]74-frank fastened more golden flowers in the yellow hair , and [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret 's merry laugh was heard mingling with the rippling of the waves and the hum of the brown insects in the grass . [Undine]143-undine sat looking at the picture before [her]143-undine , all green and gold . Surely it must be that in such a world life and love are alone realities , and death and pain are but the fevered dreams of [our]728-we own minds . "[143-undine]

There were withered flowers lying among the grass stalks ; there were heavy shadows growing in [the valleys]729-the valleys ; [the fairy ship]730-the fairy ship was growing darker every moment and would come with the storm wind and the hellish grin of the lightning , to plough up the smooth face of [the sunny sea]731-the sunny sea before morning , but [they]727-all three saw none of those things and sat there smiling in the sunlight .

" [Delilah]108-delilah , [you]108-delilah are bewitching [me]74-frank , "[74-frank] said [Frank]74-frank at last , as [he]74-frank sprang up from the grass on which [he]74-frank had

been lying with [his]74-frank head in [her]143-undine lap . " [I]74-frank promised to be at [Leeford]7-leeford tonight ; must be there , in fact . "[74-frank]

" It 's too late now , "[77-aunt margaret] said [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret , shading [her]77-aunt margaret eyes with [her]77-aunt margaret hand to look at the sinking sun ; " if [you]108-delilah walk ever so fast [you]108-delilah can not get [there]3010-there before dark . "[77-aunt margaret] " [I]77-aunt margaret shall not walk ; [I]77-aunt margaret shall hire [a boat]3158-a boat in [the village]3070-the village and [two boys]3160-two boys , and shall be back again by ten o'clock . "[77-aunt margaret] " It is the last evening , [Frank]74-frank , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , turning [her]143-undine bright childish face up to [his]74-frank , " the last for four whole weeks . Be sure [you]74-frank come back . "[143-undine] [He]74-frank stooped over [her]143-undine and whispered softly for a moment , and then with a good by to [Undine]143-undine sprang down [the green slope]732-the green slope and over the rocks along [the beach]530-the beach . Just as [he]74-frank was passing out of sight [he]74-frank paused for an instant to look back at [them]734-them and call out , " Only till ten o'clock , [you]734-them know , only till ten o'clock . "[74-frank] [The two left]735-the two left rose to go [home]246-home then . " Shall [I]143-undine pull the flowers out of [your]734-them hair ? "[143-undine] asked [Undine]143-undine . " No ; [I]143-undine leave them there ; [I]143-undine feel like only [a little child]703-a little child tonight . Oh , [Undine]143-undine , [I]143-undine hope [you]143-undine will one day be as happy as [I]143-undine am . "[143-undine]

[She]143-undine had reason to be happy , [Undine]143-undine thought ; in a few months more [he]74-frank would have finished [his]74-frank studies and was to settle as [doctor]737-doctor in [Greenwood]6-greenwood , and [they]738-they were to be married ; reason enough , but so

had [most women]739-most women . How glorious it would be when [she]143-undine , too , was one !

Later on in the evening [Undine]143-undine kneeled in the seaward window of [[Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret 's room]740-aunt margaret 's room . [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret stood behind [her]143-undine with [her]77-aunt margaret arms twined round [her]77-aunt margaret , and [both]741-both were looking into the darkness . Except the flash of the distant lightning , nothing was to be seen , nothing to be heard but the faint roll of the thunder and the roar of night wind as it flung the mountains of water it had created against [the cliffs]742-the cliffs or hurried [them]742-the cliffs madly over [the rocks]585-the rocks . " It is no use looking out any longer ; [he]744-he will not come tonight , [Golden]109-golden , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , using , as [she]143-undine often did , [his]744-he pet name . " No , no , [you]143-undine do not know [him]744-he as [I]143-undine do . [He]744-he would do anything rather than disappoint [me]143-undine , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine answered . " But [the boys]3162-the boys , [the boys]3162-the boys , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine ; " [they]3162-the boys would never venture out on a night like this . "[143-undine] " Then [he]744-he would come alone . "[143-undine] The words were said in a calm , measured voice utterly unlike [her]143-undine own ; and [Undine]143-undine looked up at the white face above [her]143-undine and out at the darkness , and shuddered . " What time is it ? "[143-undine] [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret said at last . " [I]143-undine do n't think it 's very late , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , with a piteous attempt at a smile that faded instantly when [she]143-undine had left [the room]239-the room and was making [her]143-undine way through [the sleeping house]746-the sleeping house .

As [she]143-undine stood before the great clock in [the hall]625-the hall it

struck the hours slowly ; and then the solemn ticking was renewed . [She]143-undine thought of the things it might once have spoken to [her]143-undine , concerning the bright brown face that had looked back at [them]748-them from the rocks the rocks where now the wild water was foaming in the darkness and was glad that it could speak them no more .

When [she]143-undine got back to [the room]239-the room , [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret was kneeling at the side of the chair on which the candle stood , with [her]77-aunt margaret two beautiful hands clasped over [her]77-aunt margaret head . " It is just twelve , "[143-undine] whispered [Undine]143-undine as [she]143-undine sat down beside [her]77-aunt margaret . " [He]3164-him will not come tonight ; it is too late . "[143-undine] " Too late , too late ! "[77-aunt margaret] [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret hissed the words from between [her]77-aunt margaret clinched teeth . " [I]77-aunt margaret never prayed for [him]3164-him as [I]77-aunt margaret ought , [I]77-aunt margaret never kept on praying till [I]77-aunt margaret felt [God]62-god 's answer , and now [I]77-aunt margaret can do nothing more for [him]3164-him , nothing more . It is what [I]77-aunt margaret deserve , it is [God]62-god 's punishment on [me]77-aunt margaret for loving [a man who mocked [His]3164-him name , who had no faith in [Christ]80-christ]3165-a man who mocked his name , who had no faith in christ ; but , [Undine]143-undine , [Undine]143-undine , heaven will be no heaven to [me]77-aunt margaret if [he]3164-him is not there . [I]77-aunt margaret would give [my]77-aunt margaret soul so willingly to reclaim [his]3164-him ; [I]77-aunt margaret could bear all for [him]3164-him . Pray , [Undine]143-undine , pray . [I]77-aunt margaret can not . "[77-aunt margaret] And [Undine]143-undine prayed prayed as [we]750-we pray for that which [we]750-we are losing , for that for which [we]750-we fear the day of prayer has almost ended .

" Talk , [Undine]143-undine , talk , "[77-aunt margaret] said [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret . " If[77-aunt margaret]

[you]143-undine are quiet [I]0-i can not bear it . " And [Undine]143-undine talked on , the words of [her]143-undine own sweet dreamy faith talked on till [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret fell asleep with [her]77-aunt margaret head in [the child]223-the child 's lap . Then at last [Undine]143-undine leaned [her]143-undine forehead against the chair , and slept also .[143-undine]

When [she]143-undine awoke next morning [the world]222-the world was laughing , the sky all blue with not one tell - tale cloud , [the hills]752-the hills all green and glittering in the morning light , and [the blue sea beyond]753-the blue sea beyond [them]752-the hills rippling in the sunshine , with a smile like the dimpled smile of [a beautiful wicked woman]754-a beautiful wicked woman after [she]754-a beautiful wicked woman has broken hearts and sucked the sweetness out of human lives . [Undine]143-undine , before [she]143-undine was well awake , smiled back at the picture that laughed back at [her]143-undine through the open window ; then wondered what this heavy weight about [her]143-undine heart might mean , and remembered all . Had [he]755-he come ? Where was [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret ? Glancing round [the room]239-the room , [she]143-undine hurried out to look for [her]77-aunt margaret . As [she]143-undine passed [[her]143-undine grandfather]614-her grandfather 's door [he]755-he opened it and called to [her]143-undine : " Do [you]143-undine know who went out at the front door last night and left it open ? [I]755-he felt the cold wind blowing in , and had to go down and close it , about four o'clock . "[755-he]

[He]755-he felt pretty sure [the culprit]758-the culprit stood before [him]755-he ; [no one else]253-no one else in [the house]228-the house was given to wandering out at night , and in the dark . It would only be of a piece with all [her]143-undine other eccentricities , which had

at last brought [him]755-he to the conclusion that [the child whom [he]755-he thoroughly detested , yet could not get rid of , was not quite in [her]143-undine right mind]761-the child whom he thoroughly detested , yet could not get rid of , was not quite in her right mind .

[She]143-undine gave [him]755-he no answer to [his]755-he question , but asked hurriedly , " Has [he]755-he come ? "[143-undine] And seeing from [his]755-he face that [he]755-he did not know , [she]143-undine passed on . Where was [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret ! Not in [the garden]447-the garden , not in [the house]228-the house . Soon [everyone]375-everyone was in full search of [her]143-undine except [[her]143-undine father]765-her father , who went into [[his]765-her father study]694-his study to prepare next [Sunday]110-sunday 's sermon . [She]143-undine had angered [him]755-he last night by asking [him]755-he to send [some one]312-some one over to [Leeford]7-leeford to hear if [Frank]74-frank had left . [He]755-he hated [[his]755-he future son - in - law]768-his future son - in - law with a hatred only less perfect than that which [he]755-he felt for [[his]755-he little granddaughter]769-his little granddaughter . [A Freethinking child of the devil]770-a freethinking child of the devil , [he]755-he had more than once called [him]755-he to [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret , and [he]755-he would never have had [her]143-undine had it not been that from [[his]755-he mother]771-his mother [he]755-he had inherited something . Gold is like charity ; it covers a multitude of sins ; it maketh a cloak wherein even Freethinking may array itself , and its nakedness shall not appear . Two hours later [he]755-he came out of [[his]755-he study]694-his study with a troubled look . [[His]755-he wife]243-his wife had been to tell [him]755-he that [Margaret]77-aunt margaret was nowhere to be found , and that [one of [the boys]3162-the boys]774-one of the boys had returned from [Leeford]7-leeford . [Frank]74-frank with [the other]776-the other had started in [the boat]777-the boat at eight o'clock the night before , hoping to reach [home]246-home before the storm broke .

If there was one thing in [the world]222-the world [the dried - hide]780-the dried - hide loved , it was [[his]755-he daughter]781-his daughter ; and in the search that followed [no one]406-no one looked so anxiously or so earnestly as [he]755-he . [He]755-he had refused to send [anyone]3037-anyone last night , and [she]781-his daughter had gone [herself]781-his daughter , [he]755-he thought ; and so thinking [he]755-he set out on [the road [she]781-his daughter must have taken]784-the road she must have taken . [Undine]143-undine went to search where [she]143-undine knew [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret 's own heart would have taken [her]143-undine to [the little green hillock]785-the little green hillock where the yellow flowers [he]755-he had picked lay withered here and there , where [she]143-undine could see the rocks on which [he]755-he had stood to wish [his]755-he last goodbye and the placid sunny sea which murmurs on so softly , telling no tales of the beauty and the strength it has devoured . [Undine]143-undine could not bear to stay near [it]786-it and hurried back to [the house]228-the house and [the dear old rose - filled garden]788-the dear old rose - filled garden . [[Her]143-undine grandmother]611-her grandmother met [her]143-undine at the door , crying and wringing [her]611-her grandmother poor weak hands : " Oh , [he]755-he is dead ! [Poor Frank]74-frank is dead ! [They]3167-they have found [his]755-he body , and [the boy]3168-the boy 's that was with [him]755-he . And [[my]611-her grandmother darling]3169-my darling , [[my]611-her grandmother poor darling]3170-my poor darling , where is [she]3168-the boy ? It will kill [her]3168-the boy ! It will kill [her]3168-the boy ! "[611-her grandmother] [Undine]143-undine did not stay to mingle tears with [her]611-her grandmother , but passed from [room]790-room to [room]790-room like one in a dream , searching where yet [she]143-undine did not hope to find ; with the restless moving water ever before [her]143-undine eyes as [she]143-undine wearily closed and opened door after door .

The door of [[her]143-undine own room]301-her own room stood half open , but [she]143-undine only glanced in , and was just leaving [it]793-it when [her]143-undine ear caught a sound from the corner near the window . There , with the sunlight streaming full over its yellow hair , crouched [a naked human figure]794-a naked human figure . The knees were drawn up till the chin rested on them , and one arm was clasped tight round them ; the other was stretched out , and one finger pointed to a crack in the boards . The eyebrows were drawn down till the eyes were hardly visible , but they opened slightly every time the mouth twitched nervously to one side or the other . [Undine]143-undine stood motionless in the doorway and watched [it]794-a naked human figure . Had sorrow touched [her]143-undine reason ? Was [she]143-undine mad ? Or was that really what [she]143-undine looked for that thing with the faded yellow flowers in its hair ? " Ha - ha - ha ! "[143-undine] ' Twas a hellish laugh that filled [the room]239-the room and rang out across the rose trees in [the garden]447-the garden . The finger was still pointing to the crack along the boards .

" Ha - ha - ha ! There [they]3171-they come one , two , three ; there [they]3171-they come the devils that have got [his]3172-him soul , hundreds of [them]3171-they , thousands of [them]3171-they . That is the door [they]3171-they took [him]3172-him down , there . [I]143-undine asked [God]62-god to take [me]143-undine instead , but [He]3172-him would not , and now [they]3171-they have got [me]143-undine too . [He]3172-him used to say there was [no God]3173-no god , and no hell , but [God]62-god will show [him]3172-him now .[143-undine]

Ha - ha - ha ! How [they]797-they come ! [Little devils]798-little devils one , two , three ! "[798-little devils]

[Undine]143-undine uttered a low cry and dropped down onto [her]143-undine knees beside [her]143-undine . The yellow thing , with its faded flowers , crouched down lower , crouched till its chin rested on the floor , and [its]799-i half - closed eyes glanced furtively now on this side now on that . Then springing to [its]799-i feet , with a cry , it seized [Undine]143-undine with both hands and bore [her]143-undine to the ground . Kneeling on [her]143-undine and putting [its]799-i lips close to [her]143-undine ear , [it]799-i hissed forth : " [I]799-i know [you]143-undine , who [you]143-undine are . [You]143-undine look like [Undine]143-undine ; but [you]143-undine are [the devil]3015-the devil ; [the devil to whom [God]62-god gave [his]3175-the devil to whom god gave his soul soul]3175-the devil to whom god gave his soul . [I]799-i know , [I]799-i know . [You]143-undine left [his]3175-the devil to whom god gave his soul body lying there upon [the beach]530-the beach , and [you]143-undine tore it with [your]143-undine cruel hands that [I]799-i might not know it when [I]799-i found it lying there in the grey dawn : but [I]799-i knew it , [I]799-i knew it . "[799-i] [She]800-her fixed [her]800-her teeth in [Undine]143-undine 's arm and clasped [her]143-undine to [her]800-her breast until [Undine]143-undine 's cries were smothered and [she]143-undine became unconscious . When [those who had heard]801-those who had heard [them]802-them entered [the room]239-the room , [Undine]143-undine lay upon the floor insensible , and in the far corner crouched a thing that licked its red lips and cried exultingly as it pointed at [her]143-undine : " [I]143-undine have killed [the devil]3015-the devil ! [I]143-undine have killed [the devil]3015-the devil ! Ha - ha - ha ! "[143-undine] A week after , and [Cousin Barnacles]111-cousin barnacles had taken [Undine]143-undine to [[his]111-cousin barnacles house in [Greenwood]6-greenwood]804-his house in greenwood .

It is not time which makes [old men]574-old men and [[women]346-women of [us]808-us]807-women of us . [Undine]143-undine 's childhood lay buried in the grave

upon [the hillside]809-the hillside where a form which [the sea]3156-the sea had given up was laid , and in [a dark strong house far off where [a mad woman]812-a mad woman grew wilder still if [they]813-they showed [her]143-undine a bible or a yellow flower]811-a dark strong house far off where a mad woman grew wilder still if they showed her a bible or a yellow flower .

Ignorant of [the world]222-the world , shy , childish in [her]143-undine manners , yet for [her]143-undine childhood was forever of the past . [She]143-undine would never again dance with naked feet among the rocks and wonder how , in [the world of green and gold]815-the world of green and gold , [men]710-men ever sigh and pray for rest beneath its crust . For [her]143-undine , henceforth , [the merry laughing children]817-the merry laughing children would be [you]818-you , and grave - eyed men and [women]346-women , [we]808-us and [us]808-us .

[VI]8-vi . [GREENWOOD]6-greenwood

IT WAS a white lifeless face that [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan brought with [him]81-cousin jonathan to [Greenwood]6-greenwood . So ghastly and pale that even [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman and [Miss Mell]91-miss mell , if [they]820-their were not moved to pity , could not find it in [their]820-their hearts to exercise [their]820-their tongues upon it .

All day [Undine]143-undine used to wander in the old wood that lay between [[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's house]821-cousin jonathan 's house and [the village]3070-the village ; used to wander there when the dried leaves were falling down in showers and piling themselves up in little grave - like heaps at the roots of the great trees ; used to look at them and fancy , with a kind of apathetic pleasure , that , when the spring came with its young green , [she]143-undine , like the leaves , would have vanished away . [She]143-undine thought [her]143-undine heart was broken . Perhaps it was ; but [she]143-undine did not know that hearts are only Time 's china cups china cups which [the old father]823-the old father is forever throwing hither and thither , cracking and smashing in [his]823-the old father wild reckless way , and then carefully picking up and cementing so cleverly that the old scar does not even show . [They]824-they may ring a little dead if [you]825-you strike [them]824-they but that is all .

Not knowing this , [Undine]143-undine wondered at [herself]143-undine when [she]143-undine found out that [she]143-undine intended to live , and to grow strong , and pretty too . Then [the women in [the village]3070-the village]826-the women in the village began to say malicious things , and to find out that [she]143-undine was stupid and conceited and unchildlike ; but [she]143-undine cared nothing for what [they]826-the women in the village said , and read [her]143-undine books and curled [herself]143-undine up to dream for hours among the roots of [her]143-undine favorite old tree by [the little bridge in [the woods]829-the woods]828-the little bridge in the woods . At first they were sad , unearthly dreams , but when the year grew older and the golden colour came creeping over [the hills]752-the hills , it crept into [her]143-undine dreams also ; and [she]143-undine would sit there smiling and glad ; then [she]143-undine would wonder at [herself]143-undine and go [home]246-home slowly , thinking of [the dark lonely house]832-the dark lonely house and the Goldenlight that was buried there forever . [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan tried to cheer [her]143-undine , buying books for [her]143-undine , a horse , dresses and trinkets , and everything wherewith [man]3103-man seeks to comfort and delight the heart of [womankind]834-womankind . But , as [[his]81-cousin jonathan wife]243-his wife remarked to [Miss Mell]91-miss mell , [he]81-cousin jonathan might as well have saved [his]81-cousin jonathan money and spared [himself]81-cousin jonathan the trouble : [she]143-undine never showed the least pleasure at receiving [his]81-cousin jonathan prettiest gift , except it happened to be a book that pleased [her]143-undine , and then it was only in a staid , old - womanish way .

Three years had passed by , and [Undine]143-undine [the child]223-the child had changed into [Undine]143-undine [the woman]837-the woman pretty , very pretty , even [Miss Mell]91-miss mell was obliged to allow that , " for [those who like that style of beauty]3179-those who like that style of beauty . "[91-miss mell] But [she]143-undine

was stupid , terribly stupid and old - fashioned . [All [her]143-undine female acquaintances]838-all her female acquaintances were agreed on this point . The most ravishing dress could not win even a glance , the most delicious piece of scandal the least attention . No little party or picnic , however heart - subduing in [person]839-person or purse [the gentlemen who were to be there]840-the gentlemen who were to be there , could ever awaken in [her]143-undine the faintest enthusiasm . [People]3030-people left off having anything to do with [her]143-undine at last .

" [I]96-mrs. barnacles 'm terribly anxious about [her]143-undine , "[96-mrs. barnacles] [Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles would say . " It 's not that [she]143-undine is old ; [she]143-undine is [a mere child]3180-a mere child ; but [I]96-mrs. barnacles do n't see what 's to make [her]143-undine change ; and if [no one]406-no one ever sees [her]143-undine , who 's to marry [her]143-undine ? "[96-mrs. barnacles] [Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles was [a yellow - faced big - nosed invalid]842-a yellow - faced big - nosed invalid , who passed [her]96-mrs. barnacles life on a sofa and was apt to take a dyspeptic view of things . " [She]143-undine has need of all [her]143-undine good looks , if [she]143-undine is to go off ; [men]710-men do n't take readily to [those queer , dull sorts of girls]3183-those queer , dull sorts of girls ; and with those idiotic ideas of [hers]143-undine , on religious matters , too , [half the men]3184-half the men would not have [her]143-undine as a gift . "[96-mrs. barnacles] " Of course [they]3184-half the men would not , "[91-miss mell] [Miss Mell]91-miss mell would here strike in ; " and [I]91-miss mell believe it 's all put on too [her]143-undine not going to [chapel]607-chapel and all the rest of it just to be peculiar . It 's all nonsense . What does [she]143-undine know about such things ? For [clever learned men]3186-clever learned men it 's all very well , but [a stupid child like [her]143-undine]3187-a stupid child like her ought to be well whipped and fed on bread and water for six months ; that would take the nonsense out of [her]143-undine better than anything else . "[91-miss mell]

" Yes , "[96-mrs. barnacles] [Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles would assent , " for [men]710-men it 's all very well , as [you]143-undine say ; but [a woman]374-a woman , and one who lives on charity , ought to keep [them]710-men to [herself]374-a woman if [she]374-a woman has ideas of that unwomanly kind . "[96-mrs. barnacles] [She]96-mrs. barnacles used to tell [Undine]143-undine all this , to [her]143-undine face , sometimes : " Go to [chapel]607-chapel and give up reading those nonsensical books , and act like [other people]372-other people even if [you]143-undine do n't think like [them]372-other people . It wo n't answer , it wo n't answer at all ; and [you]143-undine had better give up all this sort of thing before it 's too late . [You]143-undine 'll repent it if [you]143-undine do n't . "[96-mrs. barnacles] Then [Undine]143-undine , half bitter , half indifferent , would get away from [her]96-mrs. barnacles to the dear old world of inanimate nature , which never calls [us]843-us queer and strange or advises [us]843-us to wear a mask . It was well for [her]96-mrs. barnacles that [she]96-mrs. barnacles cared for that at least , for dark loveless times had fallen on [her]96-mrs. barnacles , and [she]96-mrs. barnacles cared for nothing else . [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan was good to [her]96-mrs. barnacles , did all in [his]81-cousin jonathan power for [her]96-mrs. barnacles , but [she]96-mrs. barnacles liked [him]81-cousin jonathan less as the years went on . [She]96-mrs. barnacles had never loved [him]81-cousin jonathan , and the intellectual help which [he]81-cousin jonathan had been able to give [her]96-mrs. barnacles ceased to be a bond between [them]844-them when [she]96-mrs. barnacles had reached [his]81-cousin jonathan ground and even passed beyond [him]81-cousin jonathan . So now [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan shared the fate common to [all lovers]845-all lovers , and gave out [his]81-cousin jonathan gold , such as it was , for dust .

One afternoon late in the summer [Undine]143-undine sat half buried among the long grass at the foot of [[her]143-undine old tree]846-her old tree . [Mill]112-mill 's Political Economy , with its face turned

to the ground , lay at [her]143-undine feet , while a little black beetle scudded hither and thither among its pages , all unnoticed . [Her]143-undine hands were busily employed in picking off small bits of dried bark from the trunk of the old tree ; while [her]143-undine thoughts were in the same key , and as sweet and impossible of fulfilment , as ever were [little Ellie]67-nancy 's when [she]67-nancy sat alone ' mid the beeches in [the meadow]847-the meadow .

It may be true that [the man who has never dreamed with [his]848-the man who has never dreamed with his eyes open eyes open]848-the man who has never dreamed with his eyes open never can know what disappointment means ; but it is also true that [he]848-the man who has never dreamed with his eyes open never knows what heaven is like . [Undine]143-undine 's stay there was not of long duration , for by and by [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan came sauntering through [the woods]829-the woods in search of [her]143-undine . [She]143-undine was so enwrapped in [her]143-undine own thoughts that [she]143-undine did not notice [his]81-cousin jonathan presence till [his]81-cousin jonathan hand had been passed softly over [her]143-undine hair . " Where are [your]143-undine thoughts wandering ? "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan asked as [he]81-cousin jonathan seated [himself]81-cousin jonathan softly beside [her]143-undine on one of the great knotted roots of the old tree which had forced its way out of the ground . " [Nowhere]9-nowhere , "[81-cousin jonathan] [Undine]143-undine answered wearily . " That is the answer [you]143-undine always make [me]81-cousin jonathan now , "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan said , very gravely ; " [you]143-undine do n't make [a friend of [me]81-cousin jonathan]3192-a friend of me now as [you]143-undine used to , [Undine]143-undine . "[81-cousin jonathan] " Because [I]81-cousin jonathan ca n't . There never was much sympathy between [us]3193-us on any subject ; there is none now . "[81-cousin jonathan]

" It is [you]143-undine who do not understand [me]81-cousin jonathan , "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan

an- answered

swered , passing [his]81-cousin jonathan fingers softly through [her]143-undine hair and letting [his]81-cousin jonathan hand rest on the back of [her]143-undine neck .

There was something in the action , simple as it was , that [she]143-undine did not like ; and a feeling of disgust came , as it had often done lately when [he]81-cousin jonathan kissed or caressed [[his]81-cousin jonathan little daughter]850-his little daughter , as [he]81-cousin jonathan called [her]850-his little daughter . [She]143-undine threw [his]81-cousin jonathan hand from [her]143-undine as [she]143-undine would a toad 's claw , and sprang lightly to [her]143-undine feet . " What is the matter ? "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan asked , looking up at [her]143-undine with [his]81-cousin jonathan serene blue eyes ; and [Undine]143-undine felt ashamed of [her]143-undine ingratitude and foolishness . " Nothing is the matter , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine answered , laughing , " only [I]143-undine am not quite so old as [you]81-cousin jonathan and believe in perpetual motion . "[143-undine] Standing on tiptoe , [she]143-undine caught one of the overhanging boughs and swayed [herself]143-undine gently backwards and forwards . [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan thought , as [he]81-cousin jonathan looked at [her]143-undine , that never , even on that first day when [he]81-cousin jonathan saw [her]143-undine standing with [her]143-undine little naked feet upon [the rocks]585-the rocks , had [she]143-undine looked so deliciously lovely : as round , as downy and inviting as any golden peach that [ever schoolboy eyes]852-ever schoolboy eyes looked at and , looking , thirsted for , because it was unattainable . " How dared [you]81-cousin jonathan intrude upon [me]143-undine in [[my]143-undine private residence]3194-my private residence ! "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , still laughing . " Is it not enough to make [me]143-undine disagreeable ? Why do n't [you]81-cousin jonathan wait till [I]143-undine invite [you]81-cousin jonathan ? "[143-undine] " [I]81-cousin jonathan should have to wait a long time , [I]81-cousin jonathan fear , "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan replied , still looking at [her]143-undine .

" Perhaps so , but death may make [me]143-undine more agreeable and sociable ; and , as [I]143-undine am sure to die long before [you]81-cousin jonathan , when [you]81-cousin jonathan hear that [I]143-undine have departed this life [you]81-cousin jonathan may come and hold converse with [my]143-undine spirit under this tree . [I]143-undine mean to haunt it , if the old monster does not quite dissolve [me]143-undine into nothingness . "[143-undine] [She]143-undine rattled on thus , not knowing what to say and not wishing to be silent . " [You]143-undine have a queer mind , "[81-cousin jonathan] said [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan . " As surely as [you]143-undine seem to be in one of [your]143-undine merry moods , [you]143-undine drag in some grim and ghostly thing to spoil it all . [I]81-cousin jonathan do n't believe [you]143-undine know what it is to be gladly happy . "[81-cousin jonathan]

" Perhaps not . [I]143-undine know that when [I]143-undine was [a child]443-a child and used to romp most wildly and do mad things that [none of the others]3196-none of the others dared , it was just because [I]143-undine was not happy . Whenever [my]143-undine thoughts and miseries were too great for [me]143-undine , [I]143-undine used to let off steam by doing something terribly naughty ; and when [I]143-undine had been lying awake all night under [my]143-undine bed , in the greatest agony about [my]143-undine sins and [other people]372-other people 's , [I]143-undine used to get up and have the most desperate of romps all by [myself]143-undine . [I]143-undine remember one day , when [I]143-undine was only seven years old , having the story of [Cain]113-cain and [Abel]114-abel for [my]143-undine Sunday lesson . It made a great impression on [me]143-undine . If [God]62-god accepted [Abel]114-abel 's sacrifice not because of its value but because of [his]114-abel faith , why , if [I]143-undine only had faith , should not fire come down[143-undine]

from heaven upon [my]0-i sacrifice at [Wilge Kloof]10-wilge kloof . 1 [I]0-i could think of nothing else for days , and so [I]0-i waited till one day when [I]0-i was very hungry and there was very nice meat for dinner . [I]0-i thought the sacrifice must be one that had cost [me]0-i something ; so [I]0-i would not touch a mouthful , but saved the nice little chop that was put on [my]0-i plate till dinner was done and [everyone]375-everyone had gone to take [their]375-everyone siesta . It was a broiling day , but [I]0-i went out to [the shady side of [the house]228-the house]854-the shady side of the house and collected twelve little flat stones and piled them up neatly in a square heap ; then [I]0-i put [my]0-i meat down on them and kneeled down to pray . [I]0-i trembled with ecstatic joy when the prayer was finished , for [I]0-i felt sure that , when [I]0-i looked up , the flames would have descended and devoured [my]0-i fatty chop . [I]0-i was almost afraid to raise [my]0-i eyes . When [I]0-i looked up and saw the chop lying just as [I]0-i had left it , [I]0-i felt astonished , but [my]0-i faith was not at all shaken , and [I]0-i set to work again , praying with all [my]0-i might . [I]0-i looked up again after a long time , thinking [I]0-i would see the chop and perhaps the stones themselves , like [Elijah]115-elijah , licked up by the heavenly fire ; but it was just as [I]0-i had left it , only the sun had made the fat melt a little and run down the stones . [I]0-i kept on praying till [[the people]407-the people in [the house]228-the house]857-the people in the house began to stir , and then [I]0-i threw down the altar and gave the chop to the dogs , and felt ever so wicked and miserable as [I]0-i walked up and down in

[1 Wilge Kloof]10-wilge kloof pronounced Vilgerkloof . [Wilge]116-wilge means willow .

the shade of [the house]228-the house . [I]0-i knew [I]0-i had prayed with faith , and [I]0-i thought the only reason why the fire had not come was because [God]62-god hated [me]0-i , as [he]860-he had done [Cain]113-cain . By and by [I]0-i went down to walk by [the kraals]861-the kraals , and saw [one of [the Kaffir girls]863-the kaffir girls]862-one of the kaffir girls fetching cattle dung to smear the floor of [the house]228-the house with . [I]0-i thought smearing must be delightful work , and [I]0-i could not bear to think about [my]0-i poor altar and [my]0-i chop any more ; so [I]0-i found a hard flat piece of ground at [the back of [the kraal]866-the kraal]865-the back of the kraal , fetched some water in a broken oil can , and mixed up the water with the dung nicely , just as [I]0-i had seen [the black girls]867-the black girls do . [I]0-i worked so hard that in half an hour [I]0-i had smeared a place the size of [a room]868-a room , and [my]0-i clothes and face too . [I]0-i was just beginning to feel quite better and as though [I]0-i did not care so much that [my]0-i offering had been rejected , when [some one]312-some one came and caught [me]0-i in the middle of [my]0-i dirt and happiness , and [I]0-i was perched up on the top of a great box till bedtime . "[0-i]

[Undine]143-undine paused to take breath at the end of this long relation . [She]143-undine did not care much for [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's company nowadays , and the fear that [he]81-cousin jonathan would feel it and be pained made [her]143-undine very voluble generally . " [You]143-undine have changed strangely since those old days , "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan said . " [I]81-cousin jonathan do n't think [you]143-undine are troubled with too much faith now ; [you]143-undine believe in nothing under the sun . "[81-cousin jonathan]

" That only proves what [I]143-undine said just now , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine answered . " [You]81-cousin jonathan do n't understand [me]143-undine . [I]143-undine believe more truly in some things than [you]143-undine do . "[143-undine] " In what , for instance ? "[81-cousin jonathan]

" Oh , in more than one . [You]81-cousin jonathan said yesterday that there was no such thing as a love that must live while the soul lives ; that wrong or neglect can change the love that can be felt but once in a lifetime for [one human being]3149-one human being and which is the best of earthly things . [You]81-cousin jonathan pooh - poohed it and called it dreaming , not reasoning . [I]143-undine merely return the compliment . "[143-undine]

[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan did not like this enthusiastic speech , and smiled a sneering sort of smile . [Beautiful men]870-beautiful men and [women]346-women can afford to sneer ; [Cousin Jonathans]117-cousin jonathans can not , and [he]81-cousin jonathan looked grotesquely ugly as [he]81-cousin jonathan did so . " With [your]143-undine magnificent intellect and [your]143-undine profound reasoning faculties whereby [you]143-undine profess to test everything , one might almost expect [you]143-undine to show a somewhat deeper knowledge of life and human nature . But after all [you]143-undine are only [a child]443-a child , and will grow wiser , when [you]143-undine have seen more of [the world]222-the world , than to believe that love can live without hope or return , any more than a body without food or air . "[81-cousin jonathan]

[Undine]143-undine hated to be told [she]143-undine was but [a child]443-a child and had no knowledge of [the world]222-the world , because there was so much of truth in the assertion . [The little man]874-the little man

knew this and therefore [he]874-the little man told [her]143-undine so , for [he]874-the little man felt angry with [her]143-undine that afternoon , though [he]874-the little man hardly knew why and [his]874-the little man blue eyes never showed it .

" [You]143-undine read all manner of trash and sentimentality till [your]143-undine mind is completely enervated ; [you]143-undine came down here this afternoon to read some of [Mrs. Browning]118-mrs. browning 's poetry and effete nonsense , [I]143-undine have no doubt . "[143-undine] " There lies what [I]143-undine have been reading , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , pointing to where Mill still lay upon the ground . " There is nothing very sentimental in that , [I]143-undine fancy . "[143-undine] " [You]143-undine are likely to get just as much good from this style of reading as from the other , "[874-the little man] [he]874-the little man replied as [he]874-the little man picked up the book . " [You]874-the little man are difficult to please , [[my]143-undine old father]3201-my old father , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said as [she]143-undine caught the bough again and rocked [herself]143-undine gracefully to and fro .

Difficult to please ! Of course [he]874-the little man was . There was one thing in [the world]222-the world that would have pleased [him]874-the little man , and that thing [he]874-the little man could not have . [The little man]874-the little man felt , as [he]874-the little man sat there among the long grass , with [his]874-the little man mild angel eyes and [his]874-the little man seeking mouth , as though [he]874-the little man could have killed [her]143-undine , for [he]874-the little man knew that [she]143-undine would never love [him]874-the little man . [She]143-undine hung as far from [his]874-the little man reach as the rose that hangs on the topmost branch of a bush is from the worm that creeps up and down on the rotten leaves below . [He]874-the little man hated [her]143-undine , and yet [he]874-the little man loved [her]143-undine with a love that had grown with [her]143-undine opening beauty and [her]143-undine softening figure , as the worm grows

while the rose but swells . It is a long way from the dirt to the rose ; but may it not be climbed ?

Was [he]874-the little man asking [himself]874-the little man this question as [he]874-the little man sat looking at [her]143-undine ? [Undine]143-undine thought [he]874-the little man looked ugly and strangely out of place among the dreamy flowering grasses on which were dancing the sunbeams which had made their way through the thick foliage . The little brook that murmured all the more sweetly , because almost buried out of sight [he]874-the little man could not understand what it was saying , and why had [he]874-the little man come to disturb [her]143-undine quiet ? [Her]143-undine conscience was just beginning to give [her]143-undine the most unpleasant twinges for thinking so ungratefully of one who had done more for [her]143-undine than [any other being]511-any other being , when steps and voices coming over [the bridge]878-the bridge made [her]143-undine look round . There were [two gentlemen]879-two gentlemen crossing [it]878-the bridge , and [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan rose to [his]81-cousin jonathan feet and went to meet [them]879-two gentlemen . [He]81-cousin jonathan introduced [them]879-two gentlemen to [Undine]143-undine as [the Mr. Blairs]119-the mr. blairs , [father]880-father and [son]881-son . There must have been at least thirty years ' difference in [their]879-two gentlemen ages , yet as far as form and feature went there was a strong resemblance between [them]879-two gentlemen . [Both]741-both were short and very broadly built , with round noses , round faces , blue eyes , scant beard , and sandy - coloured hair ; but here the resemblance ended . In place of a painfully flexible and sensitive mouth , and eyes more soft and melting than [a woman]374-a woman 's , [the father]884-the father had thick , firm , pressed lips that told of a strong animal nature and an iron will , while the eyes above were so cold and dead that the great

stone in [his]884-the father breast - pin gave out more light and warmth than they did .

[The path]885-the path through [the woods]829-the woods allowed only of two abreast ; [Undine]143-undine had what half [the girls of [Greenwood]6-greenwood]887-the girls of greenwood would have given [their]887-the girls of greenwood little fingers to gain , a long walk and t?te-?-t?te with [Mr. Henry Blair]121-harry blair .

" Are [you]143-undine fond of reading ? "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan asked [her]143-undine , noticing the book in [her]143-undine hands . ' Tis small use trying to graft an orange tree on to [a Coonie]897-a coonie . 1 If [you]898-you have no thought of [your]898-you own , those of [other men]899-other men will find nothing to which [they]899-other men can fasten [themselves]899-other men ; and [you]898-you will have to carry [them]899-other men about with [you]898-you if carry [them]899-other men [you]898-you will much as [you]898-you do [your]898-you rings and [your]898-you gloves , rightfully or wrongfully [yours]898-you , as the case may be ; but always outside of [you]898-you , and never part of [you]898-you .

" Has [he]884-the father [any other children]3210-any other children ? "[143-undine] asked [Undine]143-undine . " Yes , [Albert]97-albert blair , [[his]884-the father eldest]3211-his eldest . Next morning [Undine]143-undine rose early and took [her]143-undine morning walk onto [the little hill that lay behind [[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's house]821-cousin jonathan 's house]907-the little hill that lay behind cousin jonathan 's house . The grass was still heavy with the great glittering dewdrops , and the fresh clear air reminded [her]143-undine of the mornings in [[her]143-undine old African home]909-her old african home when [she]143-undine used to get up early and go to pray behind [the little koppie]910-the little koppie . There it was

so still and beautiful that it was easy to pray and to believe in [God]62-god 's love . [She]143-undine wondered if the dew lying on the English grass were really as lovely as the great drops that used to stand trembling on the bushes and silvery ice - plants among the stones of [the koppie]12-the koppie . [Her]143-undine thoughts went back to those old days not longingly , for there hung over the memory of [her]143-undine childhood little of that free gladness which to [most men]911-most men causes it to lie behind [them]911-most men , [a land of light and song]912-a land of light and song , to be looked back at across [the thirsty steppes of life]913-the thirsty steppes of life with vain longing and sore regret . [She]143-undine had looked out onto [the world]222-the world with eyes too grave and earnest ever since the time when , [a little child of six years]915-a little child of six years , [she]143-undine had kissed the leaves and cried among the thorn bushes , because when chopped down and burnt [they]911-most men would die forever . [She]143-undine had found griefs and mysteries where [other children]916-other children see only playthings , and had passed a tearful solitary childhood in [a home of love and plenty]917-a home of love and plenty . There was no wish for [their]911-most men return in the eyes that looked back to those days ; but [they]911-most men had about [them]911-most men that subtle charm which death alone gives to [men]710-men or times . With all its intense solitude , its tears and doubts and bitter prayers , there had been hours of happiness in [her]143-undine childish life , hours when the heavens had seemed open and [the angels of [God]62-god]919-the angels of god had descended , and ascended from [the earth]920-the earth .

[Her]143-undine thoughts wandered on from those old days to the first year of [her]143-undine life in [England]5-england , to the glad

love that had lived before [her]143-undine and which had been so suddenly put out .

The impression those days had made upon [her]143-undine , extinguishing all hope , all faith , all trust , had somewhat faded , but a strange deadness seemed to have settled down upon [her]143-undine ; and , with an intellect vigorous and alive , it seemed as though all emotional vitality had died within [her]143-undine .

[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan had said , " [You]143-undine believe in nothing . "[81-cousin jonathan] [He]81-cousin jonathan might with as much truth have added , " and love nothing . "[81-cousin jonathan] Not [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's extinction or disappearance into fire and brimstone , or that of anyone else , would now have cost [her]143-undine one tear ; and even for [herself]143-undine [she]143-undine had but a kind of apathetic indifference . In a way , it might be , [she]143-undine loved [her]143-undine books and nature ; but [her]143-undine feeling for [Spencer]123-spencer 's First Principles was not like the love which had poured itself out in hot kisses on the leaves and cover of [her]143-undine little brown Testament .

It was the sense of this coldness and deadness that made the days of passion and feeling look so beautiful to [her]143-undine now , and that almost brought the long - stranger tears into [her]143-undine eyes as [she]143-undine looked down on the glittering dew and thought of those early mornings behind the koppie . Agony , anything , would be better than this dreadful coldness and indifference . Would it never end , never break ? If only [I]0-i could love something , [she]143-undine thought , as [she]143-undine passed slowly over the wet grass . To love

some- something

thing , to believe in something , to worship something , even if that something were only [herself]143-undine to look at something with eyes other than those of calm indifference it would be worth sleepless nights of tears and prayer .

[She]143-undine walked on with [her]143-undine eyes fixed on the ground , and was surprised when [she]143-undine looked up to find [herself]143-undine at [the top of [the hill]922-the hill]921-the top of the hill . It was not a very stirring or striking scene that lay before [her]143-undine , but calm and bright . At the foot of [the little hill on which [she]143-undine stood]923-the little hill on which she stood lay [[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's house]821-cousin jonathan 's house , and beyond that the little wood in which grew [[her]143-undine old tree]846-her old tree . [The white houses of [the village]3070-the village]926-the white houses of the village were visible on the other side of [it]923-the little hill on which she stood , and beyond that again [the large mansion of [the Blairs]929-the blairs with [its]928-the large mansion of the blairs with its roof glittering in the sunshine roof glittering in the sunshine]928-the large mansion of the blairs with its roof glittering in the sunshine . Not a soul was to be seen except at the edge of the wood , where [a man]3044-a man and [woman]931-woman were standing . It looked as though [the woman]837-the woman 's head were resting on [his]3044-a man arm , but [they]933-they soon parted ; [he]3044-a man turned back among the trees , while [the woman]837-the woman took the little path that led straight up [the hill]922-the hill . [Undine]143-undine sat down , listlessly watching [her]143-undine as [she]143-undine came nearer ; then [she]143-undine saw it was not a face [she]143-undine knew or had ever seen before in [Greenwood]6-greenwood . ' Twas a young face like those that sometimes haunted [Undine]143-undine 's waking dreams and made [her]143-undine wish [she]143-undine were [a painter]936-a painter , to fix them everlastingly on canvas . [The woman]837-the woman was of more than middle height , with a magnificently developed yet graceful figure ; [her]837-the woman features were

regular and almost of a Jewish cast , while [her]837-the woman long curled eyelashes drooped over cheeks as dark and brilliantly coloured as the rare hothouse flowers [she]837-the woman wore in [her]837-the woman bosom . [She]837-the woman loves [some one]312-some one , and [she]837-the woman is happy , thought [Undine]143-undine ; if [I]0-i could love [I]0-i would be happy too .

When [she]143-undine sat doing [her]143-undine needlework in [[Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles ' room]940-mrs. barnacles ' room that morning , [she]143-undine asked [her]96-mrs. barnacles who [the beautiful stranger]941-the beautiful stranger was ; for [that lady]638-that lady was kept well informed in the doings and sayings of all [Greenwood]6-greenwood by [the indefatigable Miss Mell]91-miss mell . " [You]143-undine must mean [Alice Brown]95-alice brown , [I]96-mrs. barnacles think , "[96-mrs. barnacles] said [Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles , after a moment 's consideration ; " [they]3213-they say [she]941-the beautiful stranger is growing more and more beautiful .
