"[96-mrs. barnacles] That afternoon [Harry Blair]121-harry blair put in [his]121-harry blair appearance . As a rule [he]121-harry blair was careless enough about [his]121-harry blair dress to be mistaken for [the greatest genius living]943-the greatest genius living ; but on that afternoon [he]121-harry blair had arrayed [himself]121-harry blair with punctilious care , and had come to invite [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan and [Undine]143-undine to look at some fine pictures which had just arrived . [Undine]143-undine had said [she]143-undine was fond of pictures , and these were really beautiful .

Of course [she]143-undine could not refuse to go ; and [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan went , for [he]81-cousin jonathan followed [her]143-undine steps as smoke follows [a train]944-a train . [George Blair]124-george blair was [a rich man]945-a rich man , and [no miser]946-no miser ; [a man who valued [his]124-george blair money only for the status it gave [him]124-george blair in the eyes of [[his]124-george blair fellow men]948-his fellow men and the ease and luxury it might bring [him]124-george blair]947-a man who valued his money only for the status it gave him in the eyes of his fellow men and the ease and luxury it might bring him . The erection and adornment of [[this house]3148-this house at [Greenwood]6-greenwood]950-this house at greenwood had been the employment and delight of the last twelve years . [He]124-george blair would pay away hundreds of pounds for a picture or a statue that was said to be good , though [he]124-george blair was about as well able to understand the one or the other as would have been one of the thoroughbreds that stood in [[his]124-george blair stable]951-his stable . It was the first time [Undine]143-undine had been in [the house]228-the house , for during the three years [she]143-undine had been in [Greenwood]6-greenwood [the owner]953-the owner had been travelling abroad . It was aristocratic to travel on [the Continent]954-the continent , therefore [he]124-george blair went . [He]124-george blair had married [[his]124-george blair first wife]955-his first wife because [she]955-his first wife knew who [[her]955-his first wife great - grandfather]956-her great - grandfather was . [He]124-george blair would have sold [his]124-george blair own soul to be thought refined and of blue blood , but [he]124-george blair never succeeded in producing the desired impression . Perhaps it was the sense that where [he]124-george blair so deplorably failed [[his]124-george blair eldest son]957-his eldest son was by gift of nature preeminently successful , that gave rise to the feeling of dislike [he]124-george blair entertained for [him]957-his eldest son . This , if not so strong as the feeling with which [he]124-george blair regarded [[his]124-george blair younger son]958-his younger son , was to say the least unfatherly .

It half amused , half disgusted [Undine]143-undine to see the little bloated , leaden - eyed creature standing among the elegancies and beauties which [his]124-george blair money had bought , talking of [my]0-i pictures . [My]0-i pictures ! As if anything with a trace of beauty could ever belong to [him]124-george blair . [He]124-george blair might lay out [his]124-george blair money for [them]959-them ; and if they were pictures they might hang on [his]124-george blair walls , if [they]959-them were [women]346-women a luxury in which [he]124-george blair still largely indulged [he]124-george blair might dress [them]959-them richly and buy [their]959-them smiles and obedience ; but possess [them]959-them never ! The flesh - incrusted soul that looked out through the hard blue eyes in [their]959-them setting of red fat , would know nothing of the possession of that which had beauty . [Undine]143-undine thought as [she]143-undine looked at [him]124-george blair how unenviable was the fate of [both women]961-both women and pictures . But [she]143-undine soon forgot [him]124-george blair before a large oil painting . It represented [a battlefield]962-a battlefield . Horses and [riders , dying and dead]963-riders , dying and dead , lay around in wild confusion , while in the foreground , stretched out upon a heap of the slain , lay the figure of [a man gorgeously clad in the knightly costume of the olden days]964-a man gorgeously clad in the knightly costume of the olden days . [His]124-george blair plumed helmet lay at [his]124-george blair side , filled with blood ; and the beautiful face , so faultless in feature , so pitilessly hard in expression , was turned upward to the dark evening sky . At [his]124-george blair feet , clasping them with both hands while it crouched upon the ground , was the figure of [a woman]374-a woman , its delicate and voluptuous development being hardly concealed by the coarse , scanty clothing [it]966-it wore . On the face there

was a wild look almost of joy , though the lines about the mouth were those of speechless agony .

" [You]143-undine seem fascinated by this picture , "[121-harry blair] said [Harry Blair]121-harry blair , gently , as [he]121-harry blair stood behind [her]143-undine . " It is [my]121-harry blair favourite also , but [I]121-harry blair confess [I]121-harry blair like it only because of [the woman]837-the woman 's face ; [I]121-harry blair can make nothing out of it . "[121-harry blair] " It seems to [me]143-undine to tell its own story , "[143-undine] answered [Undine]143-undine , speaking softly , as though more to [herself]143-undine than to [him]121-harry blair . " [He]121-harry blair was [a noble , high - blooded lord]3219-a noble , high - blooded lord , and [she]837-the woman [a poor serf , with only [her]837-the woman soul and beautiful body to give [him]121-harry blair]3220-a poor serf , with only her soul and beautiful body to give him . [He]121-harry blair hardly cared to take [them]3221-them , though it was for nothing ; and now , in the hour of death , [she]837-the woman has followed [him]121-harry blair and found [him]121-harry blair lying dead ; and [she]837-the woman is crouching at [his]121-harry blair feet in agony because [he]121-harry blair is gone , and in wild joy because [he]121-harry blair is [hers]837-the woman alone now , [hers]837-the woman and no other 's , if only that [she]837-the woman may lie at [his]121-harry blair feet and die there . "[121-harry blair] " A very desirable fate , certainly , "[121-harry blair] said a voice behind [her]967-her that was far too melodious and well modulated to be that of either [Harry Blair]121-harry blair or [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan , whom [they]968-they had left in [the next room]969-the next room . [Undine]143-undine looked round quickly from [[her]967-her slaughtered knight]970-her slaughtered knight and passion - filled maiden to behold , standing behind [her]967-her , that " Piece of divine perfection "[143-undine] as [[his]121-harry blair lady admirers]971-his lady admirers were wo nt to call [him]121-harry blair [Mr. Albert Blair]97-albert blair .

[He]121-harry blair was [a man of somewhat more than six feet in height , with a lithe graceful figure and a head of beautiful yellow - brown curls]972-a man of somewhat more than six feet in height , with a lithe graceful figure and a head of beautiful yellow - brown curls . [His]121-harry blair moustaches , of

the same colour , were so delicately curled that [one]397-one felt surprised to see the firm powerful lips under them . [His]121-harry blair features were delicately chiselled , and from the regular white teeth to the small round ear there was neither fault nor flaw to be found in [him]121-harry blair , unless it were [his]121-harry blair eyes . They were of a pale cold blue , and would not have been small had [he]121-harry blair not habitually kept the lids more than half closed . There was nothing lost by that proceeding certainly , for when now and then on rare occasions [he]121-harry blair lifted them , the gleam shot forth was as icy and chilling as a moonbeam falling on a glacier . It was one of these that fell on [Undine]143-undine as [she]143-undine looked round , and it instantly froze [her]143-undine . [She]143-undine knew without looking at [him]121-harry blair that the cold light was falling on the small rent in [her]143-undine glove and on [her]143-undine ruffled hair which [she]143-undine had not smoothed before coming out .

There are [some men]510-some men and [women in whose society]975-women in whose society [we]976-we instantly feel a sublime indifference as to the cut of a coat , the dust on [our]976-we sleeve , or the sit of [our]976-we necktie ; while there are others who , the moment [we]976-we see [them]977-them , set [us]976-we running over all the flaws and defects in costume and person , from the want of blacking on [our]976-we boots to the broken nail on [our]976-we forefinger . There are [men]710-men and women in whose presence [we]976-we seem to be released from [ourselves]976-we and to be possessed of ideas and powers of expression which till then [we]976-we never dreamed of ; while [others]713-others seem to shrivel [us]976-we up and leave [us]976-we standing without

an idea or a correct word in all [our]976-we vocabulary on which [we]976-we can lay hands . One of [these latter]980-these latter was [Albert Blair]97-albert blair .

[Everyone on whom the cold beam fell]981-everyone on whom the cold beam fell felt awkward , ill - dressed , and ignorant . [Elegant dandies]982-elegant dandies felt in [his]982-elegant dandies presence that [their]982-elegant dandies whiskers were too long , the set of [their]982-elegant dandies coats execrable , and [their]982-elegant dandies way of handling a cane simply clownish and disgraceful . [Ladies]983-ladies , however well contented [they]983-ladies had been with [their]983-ladies own appearance the moment before , discovered that [their]983-ladies dress was all in shocking taste , [their]983-ladies knuckles were too large and [their]983-ladies sleeves too short , when the blue eyes were turned upon [them]983-ladies . And [Undine]143-undine in the hour that followed thought of nothing but [her]143-undine split glove and ruffled hair and , while [she]143-undine stared at the pictures , saw as little of their meaning as did [the Piece - of - perfection who walked at [her]143-undine side , with [his]984-the piece - of - perfection who walked at her side , with his deferential manner and his disagreeable eyes , passing commonplace conventional remarks upon all they looked at deferential manner and [his]984-the piece - of - perfection who walked at her side , with his deferential manner and his disagreeable eyes , passing commonplace conventional remarks upon all they looked at disagreeable eyes , passing commonplace conventional remarks upon all [they]985-they looked at]984-the piece - of - perfection who walked at her side , with his deferential manner and his disagreeable eyes , passing commonplace conventional remarks upon all they looked at . It was a great relief to [her]143-undine to get away from [him]984-the piece - of - perfection who walked at her side , with his deferential manner and his disagreeable eyes , passing commonplace conventional remarks upon all they looked at into the fresh evening air , and walk down [the green lane]986-the green lane between [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan and [Harry Blair]121-harry blair .

An hour or two later [that young gentleman]987-that young gentleman was seated in [the smoking - room]988-the smoking - room , with [Mrs. Browning]118-mrs. browning 's Portuguese Sonnets open before [him]987-that young gentleman . [His]987-that young gentleman feet were drawn up under [his]987-that young gentleman chair , [his]987-that young gentleman elbows rested on the table , [his]987-that young gentleman head was stretched forward , and [his]987-that young gentleman great eyes fixed on vacancy . [[His]987-that young gentleman brother]989-his brother [Albert]97-albert blair was at the

other end of [the room]239-the room , reclining in an easy - chair with [his]987-that young gentleman legs stretched over another . [His]987-that young gentleman glass , lamp , an elegant cigar - stand , and a pile of blue papers lay at [his]987-that young gentleman side on a small round table .

Presently [he]987-that young gentleman took the cigar from between [his]987-that young gentleman lips and , throwing down the last of the blue papers , said with one of [his]987-that young gentleman graceful inimitable little yawns : " [You]987-that young gentleman seem to find [your]987-that young gentleman book singularly entertaining this evening . [You]987-that young gentleman have not looked at it once in the last half hour . "[987-that young gentleman] [[His]987-that young gentleman brother]989-his brother started , and answered quickly , " Quite as entertaining as those everlasting blue papers of yours "[989-his brother] ; and then added , after a pause , " Do n't [you]987-that young gentleman think [Miss Bock]125-miss bock is very like [the woman in that picture]3222-the woman in that picture ? "[989-his brother]

" What woman , and what picture ? [You]987-that young gentleman should try and be a little more explicit if [you]987-that young gentleman wish for an answer , "[97-albert blair] said [Albert Blair]97-albert blair , now really closing [his]97-albert blair eyes and puffing the blue smoke softly through [his]97-albert blair lips .

" Of course [I]989-his brother mean the picture [we]3223-we were looking at when [you]987-that young gentleman came up this afternoon , "[989-his brother] responded [[his]987-that young gentleman brother]989-his brother , in a tone that very clearly showed how unwelcome that coming up had been . " Yes , possibly there is a resemblance ; but [your]987-that young gentleman divinity has not nearly such a delicate hand ; and a good hand ranks next to a good figure , "[989-his brother] retorted [[his]987-that young gentleman brother]989-his brother , calmly .

[Harry]121-harry blair looked fire and lightning at [him]989-his brother , and [the

Piece - of - perfection]994-the piece - of - perfection , who had a strange aptitude for seeing things without opening or at least appearing to open [his]97-albert blair eyes , said , as [he]97-albert blair puffed away serenely : " There is no occasion to excite [yourself]987-that young gentleman about what [I]97-albert blair say , [[my]97-albert blair dear fellow]3224-my dear fellow . [She]995-her is [a very pretty little girl]3225-a very pretty little girl , [an uncommonly pretty little girl]3226-an uncommonly pretty little girl ; beats [Lady Edith]126-lady edith and [[her]126-lady edith sister]3227-her sister hollow ; only rather too careless about [her]995-her dress , and a little peculiar in [her]995-her manner , that 's all . "[97-albert blair]

To think of comparing [her]995-her to [Lady Edith]126-lady edith , a die - away beauty with no more soul in [her]995-her than a fly , and to speak of [her]995-her with that cool air of superiority , was a crime on [[his]97-albert blair brother]989-his brother 's part which put into poor [Harry]121-harry blair 's hand a strong inclination to send [Mrs. Browning]118-mrs. browning in [her]118-mrs. browning red morocco binding among [[his]97-albert blair brother]989-his brother 's curls .

Other books had been so sent for smaller offences in [their]998-their boyish days , and [the sender]999-the sender had been invariably knocked over and coolly kicked out of [the room]239-the room . [He]999-the sender was not one of those to whom experience teaches much , still on this occasion [he]999-the sender was wise enough to take [himself]999-the sender out of the way of temptation ; and making [his]999-the sender way into [the garden]447-the garden [he]999-the sender paced up and down [the paths]1002-the paths in the moonlight . Surely that thing of grace and beauty which in two days had filled the whole circle of [his]999-the sender existence surely it was now in like manner wandering up and down under the dark trees around [[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's house]821-cousin jonathan 's house . For had [she]118-mrs. browning not said in answer to [his]999-the sender

ques- question

tion that [she]118-mrs. browning loved walking alone and in the moonlight ?

Now as it happened , on this particular evening [Undine]143-undine sat beside a little table darning [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's stockings , listening and laughing at extracts from the daily papers and Punch , which [the little man]874-the little man read aloud to [her]118-mrs. browning as [he]874-the little man lay on the sofa .

When [she]118-mrs. browning stood up to put [her]118-mrs. browning work away [he]999-the sender asked [her]118-mrs. browning what [she]118-mrs. browning thought of [Mr. Blair]121-harry blair number three . " Think of [him]121-harry blair ? "[118-mrs. browning] [she]118-mrs. browning answered . " [He]121-harry blair is only [an equally proportioned mixture of ice and iron]3228-an equally proportioned mixture of ice and iron . With all [his]121-harry blair deference and politeness , [he]121-harry blair would freeze one or crush one to atoms with as little compunction as a fly , if [one]397-one happened to stand in [his]121-harry blair path . [I]143-undine do n't like [[his]121-harry blair brother]989-his brother , [I]143-undine dislike [the father]884-the father , and [I]143-undine detest [him]884-the father , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , as [she]143-undine threw the last stocking into the basket and thought of [her]143-undine torn glove . [She]143-undine sat down to mend it when [she]143-undine got to [[her]143-undine room]444-her room .

" What [a contemptible little wretch]3232-a contemptible little wretch [I]143-undine am becoming ! "[143-undine] [she]143-undine thought when [she]143-undine had finished it , " to allow such trivialities to break into [my]143-undine real life and drive out higher thought . Am [I]143-undine no better than [other women]3233-other women after all ? [I]143-undine 've no heart ; if [I]143-undine lose [my]143-undine head what is to become of [me]143-undine ? "[143-undine] [She]143-undine felt weary of [herself]143-undine and disgusted , and [she]143-undine could not now lie down on the floor and pray , till in an agony or an ecstasy , [she]143-undine should forget [herself]143-undine . [She]143-undine had taken the first bite at the forbidden fruit , and could see that the terrors which had haunted [her]143-undine were but

the inevitable creations of the human mind , as it looked out in its ignorance on [this world of suffering]1006-this world of suffering and wrong could see that the visions which had entranced [her]143-undine were but the dreams of [the human soul]1007-the human soul in its craving after happiness and truth . So much [she]143-undine saw ; but saw no farther . Inevitably as to the soul in its search after its highest truth there comes a time of agony and of blood , so too there comes a time of deadness and of cold . The old life has been cut down to the roots , the new life has not yet arisen . So , too , in [our]1008-we childish vision of hell , [we]1008-we stand alone in a world of darkness and silence till [the world around [us]1008-we]1009-the world around us and even [we]1008-we [ourselves]1008-we seem to become mere mocking shadows . Yet , could [we]1008-we know it , it is but the silence that comes before the dawning ; it is but the darkness that comes before the day breaks ; it is but [the land of glittering glaciers that lies between [us]1008-we and [the celestial city]1011-the celestial city]1010-the land of glittering glaciers that lies between us and the celestial city . And what if [we]1008-we should perish alone in [its]1012-its mist and cold ? Better to die frozen , striving for [the glorious golden city of God]1013-the glorious golden city of god , up yonder better than here , in [the land of Egypt]1014-the land of egypt , with the flesh pots and the onions , the leeks and the garlic .

That evening , while [Undine]143-undine sat mending [her]143-undine glove , [Albert Blair]97-albert blair still leaned back in [his]97-albert blair chair , sipped [his]97-albert blair glass , and smoked with [his]97-albert blair half - closed eyes , making calculations and thinking hard all the while .

Unknown to [[his]97-albert blair father]388-his father and without capital , [he]97-albert blair

was speculating , as [he]97-albert blair [himself]97-albert blair would have allowed , in a rather wild and reckless manner . These speculations had for [him]97-albert blair the same irresistible fascination that the gaming table had for many , and only through [their]1016-their help , if ever , could [he]97-albert blair hope to free [himself]97-albert blair from [[his]97-albert blair father]388-his father 's control unless [he]97-albert blair should marry [a rich wife]1018-a rich wife ; and to [Albert Blair]97-albert blair 's proud palate [a wife]1019-a wife 's bread would have tasted yet more bitter than [a father]1020-a father 's .

" Still , [I]97-albert blair must keep [Lady Edith]126-lady edith well in hand . If these speculations should fail , it must come to marrying [her]126-lady edith . [She]126-lady edith dresses in good taste and is in perfect style but [I]97-albert blair would rather it were [[her]126-lady edith sister]3227-her sister , "[97-albert blair] [he]97-albert blair soliloquized .

[VII]127-vii . LOVERS

THERE be loves many and gods many ; and happy [the man whose god and love are one happy for the time being]1021-the man whose god and love are one happy for the time being ; most miserable of [mortals when the time of revelation]1022-mortals when the time of revelation comes and at one stroke both [god]1023-god and [lover]1024-lover crumble into dust .

[Harry]121-harry blair 's love for [Undine]143-undine had sprung into life , full grown and omnipotent , on that first afternoon when [he]121-harry blair met [her]143-undine in [the woods]829-the woods ; and if from that time it could not be said to have grown stronger , it had certainly grown larger , until at last [the whole world]3021-the whole world animate and inanimate , intellectual and moral , was for [him]121-harry blair but [one being]1027-one being , imaged and reflected in a thousand ways . [Women]346-women 's dresses and faces had a new meaning for [him]121-harry blair ; for , though standing afar off , were [they]346-women not like to [hers]143-undine ? And the little wild forest flowers that [she]143-undine loved , were they not emblems of [her]143-undine , as [they]346-women nodded [their]346-women innocent white heads at [one another]567-one another ? In the books that [he]121-harry blair read , [he]121-harry blair paused only when [he]121-harry blair came to some sentence that might have been [hers]143-undine ; and all that was beautiful and sweet sang back [her]143-undine name to [him]121-harry blair . Dark days came

for [his]121-harry blair well - worn bible , and for [Beecher]128-beecher 's Life Thoughts and [a score of brethren who had been [his]121-harry blair daily study]1030-a score of brethren who had been his daily study . [She]143-undine never read them ; and [they]346-women were thrown contemptuously onto a lower shelf , to lie there till the wheel of time should have turned .

" Why do [you]143-undine always change the topic when [our]1031-our conversation turns to religious subjects ? "[128-beecher] [Harry]128-beecher asked [Undine]143-undine one day , some four months after [their]1031-our first meeting , as [he]121-harry blair sat in the low bow - window in front of [[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's house]821-cousin jonathan 's house , with [his]121-harry blair feet resting on the gravelled path outside . [Undine]143-undine stood behind [him]121-harry blair , mending a great rent in [her]143-undine dress , made as [they]1031-our had been rambling in the wood together in search of the wild flowers which now , tied into a great bunch , [he]121-harry blair held in [his]121-harry blair hand . " Religion is like love , "[143-undine] answered [Undine]143-undine . " It flourishes best in silence , and is to be felt , not spoken of . "[143-undine]

" [I]121-harry blair do n't mean merely what one may call [emotional religious subjects]3235-emotional religious subjects , "[121-harry blair] [he]121-harry blair answered , looking up into [her]143-undine face with [[his]121-harry blair great pleading woman]1033-his great pleading woman 's eyes . " [You]143-undine were arguing last night with [Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles about the right or wrong of committing suicide . "[121-harry blair]

The dark eyes above [him]121-harry blair looked down on [him]121-harry blair with that half - pitying , half - scornful look that was so often in them when they rested on [him]121-harry blair .

" [You]121-harry blair must be contented with what [you]121-harry blair get , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " But [you]121-harry blair give [me]143-undine so very little . "[143-undine] There was something very piteous in the words and in the face that looked up at [her]143-undine which would have cut sore against the hearts of [many women]1034-many women ; but [she]143-undine cared nothing , only said : " [I]143-undine give light where [I]143-undine get it . When [you]121-harry blair enlighten [my]143-undine spiritual darkness , [I]143-undine shall try and do as much for [yours]121-harry blair . "[143-undine] [She]143-undine had a contemptuous pity for [the great boy]1035-the great boy , with [his]1035-the great boy manly years and [his]1035-the great boy crammed brain , and [his]1035-the great boy passionate love that had made [him]1035-the great boy follow [her]143-undine about for the last four months and serve [her]143-undine like a dog . " If a bird is only fitted to live among [the marshes]3236-the marshes and reeds in [the valley]3237-the valley , why tempt it after [you]121-harry blair to [the cold high rocks where the eagle finds a glorious life in the clear cold air]3238-the cold high rocks where the eagle finds a glorious life in the clear cold air ? "[143-undine] So [Undine]143-undine said to [him]1035-the great boy , and so thinking , [she]143-undine made no attempt to lead [her]143-undine poor wild duck to [the heights for which nature had never fitted [him]1035-the great boy]1036-the heights for which nature had never fitted him , and where [he]1035-the great boy must die of frost and starvation .

[His]1035-the great boy ideas as to what [her]143-undine views might be were not very clear , but [he]1035-the great boy had a vague notion that [she]143-undine believed in nothing ; accordingly [he]1035-the great boy had convinced [himself]1035-the great boy that [he]1035-the great boy also believed in nothing and [he]1035-the great boy had not a little disgusted and very much astonished [her]143-undine by informing [her]143-undine , as [he]1035-the great boy scraped up and down with [his]1035-the great boy boots on the gravel , that [he]1035-the great boy was [an infidel]1037-an infidel , [an

atheist beside whom [Hume]129-hume was orthodox and [Voltaire]130-voltaire [a credulous believer]1039-a credulous believer]1038-an atheist beside whom hume was orthodox and voltaire a credulous believer .

" [I]143-undine am sorry to hear it , "[143-undine] was [Undine]143-undine 's brief reply . " Why should [you]143-undine be sorry that [I]1035-the great boy resemble [you]143-undine ? " [I]1035-the great boy care nothing about it unless [you]143-undine give it [me]1035-the great boy , "[1035-the great boy] [he]1035-the great boy answered , in a deep passionate voice that always angered [her]143-undine .

" What [a poor fool]3240-a poor fool [I]1035-the great boy am ! It was not often the case and it showed the discretion of all parties that it was not that [they]1042-they were alone together , [the three Blairs]1043-the three blairs , [father]880-father and [sons]1045-sons . "[143-undine] It was purgatory before that time to [Harry Blair]121-harry blair , but [he]121-harry blair stuck to [his]121-harry blair pipe with the resolution of [a martyr]1049-a martyr . "[121-harry blair] [The master of the dog]1054-the master of the dog had more than one attraction in [Greenwood]6-greenwood , and [a lady who must be kept in hand close by]1055-a lady who must be kept in hand close by ; so , though [the place]3080-the place was wretchedly dull , [he]121-harry blair was in no hurry to leave [it]3080-the place . " [We]3246-we all know [you]121-harry blair are booked for [Greenwood]6-greenwood till [a certain individual]3247-a certain individual , despairing of a richer morsel , shall consent to swallow [you]121-harry blair . "[121-harry blair] [[His]1058-his youngest son father]388-his father laughed , one of [his]388-his father coarse brutal laughs ; [Albert]97-albert blair leaned down to stroke [Prince]132-prince 's head and went on curling [his]97-albert blair moustaches .

" As to [my]884-the father being in total ignorance , "[884-the father] said [the father]884-the father , " [I]884-the father know nearly as much of [your]121-harry blair little beauty as [you]121-harry blair do [yourself]121-harry blair , and infinitely more about [woman]931-woman in general , [I]884-the father fancy . thousand a year , than [I]0-i do of knocking the ashes off the end of [my]0-i cigar . "[0-i]

[Harry Blair]121-harry blair rose to [his]121-harry blair feet , knocking over the tumbler that stood at [his]121-harry blair elbow . [His]121-harry blair hot blood , which in schoolboy days had gained for [him]121-harry blair the highly appropriate sobriquet of " [Fire Brain]133-fire brain , "[121-harry blair] was now fairly roused : " If [any man]3249-any man but [[my]121-harry blair father]471-my father had dared to speak those words , "[121-harry blair] [he]121-harry blair said with tremendous passion , " [I]121-harry blair would have knocked them down [his]471-my father throat ; as it is , [I]121-harry blair will only prove to [you]121-harry blair that they are a lie , a cowardly dastardly lie . "[121-harry blair] [[His]121-harry blair father]388-his father spoke with a quiet sneer : " [You]121-harry blair surely forget in [whose house [you]121-harry blair are standing]3251-whose house you are standing , whose money it is that causes [women]346-women to look at [you]121-harry blair ! Go and tell [your]121-harry blair beautiful [Undine]143-undine that [[your]121-harry blair father]3253-your father has turned [you]121-harry blair out of [[his]3253-your father house]3254-his house , that [you]121-harry blair have not a penny in [the world]222-the world , nor the wits to make one ; go and tell [her]143-undine that [[your]121-harry blair father]3253-your father would rather see [his]3253-your father money rolling in the gutter than that a penny of it should ever come to [you]121-harry blair . Go and tell [her]143-undine that , and see what [her]143-undine answer will be ! Go , go at once . "[388-his father] There was no passion in the words ; they were calmly , sneeringly spoken , as words are that have been lying on the tongue for years , ready for use . [Albert Blair]97-albert blair sat lazily looking into the fire . [He]97-albert blair had known it would come to this some day , and [he]97-albert blair was glad ; it gave [him]97-albert blair a better chance .

When [he]97-albert blair looked up [[his]97-albert blair brother]989-his brother had left [the room]239-the room ,

and [[his]97-albert blair father]388-his father , sitting opposite [him]97-albert blair , was puffing away vigorously .

" [The young dog]3257-the young dog ! "[388-his father] [he]388-his father said after a pause . " [He]3257-the young dog has all [[his]3257-the young dog mother]771-his mother 's damned impertinence , and [he]3257-the young dog shall learn a lesson or two yet before [he]3257-the young dog dies . [Young dog]3259-young dog ! "[388-his father] [Albert]97-albert blair made no remark and a long silence followed , suddenly broken , greatly to [his]97-albert blair surprise , by a long - continued , deep chuckling laugh proceeding from [[his]97-albert blair father]388-his father . [The Piece - of - perfection]994-the piece - of - perfection for once fairly opened [his]388-his father eyes and stared at [him]97-albert blair . [[His]388-his father respected senior]1068-his respected senior was not generally given to mirth , even of the demoniac order . " [I]388-his father 'll do it , "[388-his father] [he]388-his father chuckled , " [I]388-his father 'll do it . "[388-his father] And then , seeming to remember [himself]388-his father , [he]388-his father rose , kicked the dog , and took [his]388-his father departure , leaving [[his]388-his father son]245-his son in undivided possession of the fire and [his]245-his son own meditations . The next morning was cold and stinging and [Undine]143-undine half repented that [she]143-undine had not stayed at [home]246-home , as [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan wished , in place of going for [her]143-undine morning walk . [She]143-undine was just turning homeward when , hearing a step beside [her]143-undine , [she]143-undine looked round , and saw , to [her]143-undine great astonishment , no less a personage than [Mr. George Blair]124-george blair , looking redder than usual and almost out of breath .

" [I]388-his father heard this was [your]143-undine favourite early walk , "[388-his father] [he]388-his father began , after wishing [her]143-undine good morning ; " and [I]388-his father have walked [myself]388-his father almost out of breath , fearing [I]388-his father[388-his father]

might miss [you]143-undine . [I]0-i have long wished for an opportunity of seeing [you]143-undine in private , and at last [I]0-i have it . "[0-i]

A pause followed , [Undine]143-undine ransacking [her]143-undine brain to discover some possible cause for [his]388-his father desiring a private interview with [her]143-undine .

" [I]388-his father trust , "[388-his father] [he]388-his father began again , " that [you]143-undine will not be much surprised at what [I]388-his father am about to say . "[388-his father]

[He]1071-he paused to take breath at the end of [his]1071-he pedantic little oration , while [Undine]143-undine turned on [him]1071-he a face in which nothing but blank astonishment was written ; it changed to one of disgust as [her]143-undine eyes rested on [the little red - faced creature]1072-the little red - faced creature . [He]1071-he saw the look and had expected to see it . [He]1071-he had had , as [he]1071-he said , great experience in [woman]931-woman , and knew that [the handsome penniless young lover]1074-the handsome penniless young lover must hope to

carry the day by storm or not at all , that time and reflection are fatal to [his]1071-he success ; while [the man of fifty]1075-the man of fifty , with [his]1071-he bloated face and bags of money , has nothing but these to rely on ; and [they]1076-they work for [him]1071-he more surely when [he]1071-he is absent than present .

[He]1071-he took no notice of the look [she]143-undine gave [him]1071-he , but it made [him]1071-he swear in the fatty depths of [his]1071-he inmost heart that , come what would , [he]1071-he should yet have [her]143-undine as [[his]1071-he wife]243-his wife . [He]1071-he drew the little scarlet cloak that was slipping back lightly over [her]143-undine shoulder , and fastened it with a brooch formed of diamond - studded flowers which [he]1071-he drew from [his]1071-he pocket . [The old man]624-the old man peered out at [her]143-undine from [his]624-the old man rolls of fat , and before turning to leave [her]143-undine said , " Then [I]624-the old man had best wish [you]143-undine good morning ; but before [I]624-the old man do so may [I]624-the old man beg of [you]143-undine , [[my]624-the old man dear]2975-my dear [Miss Bock]125-miss bock , to remember that if ever [you]143-undine should change [your]143-undine mind and [we]3267-we never know what the future may bring [us]3267-we , [I]624-the old man shall not have changed . [Undine]143-undine stood to watch [him]624-the old man as [he]624-the old man rolled out of sight .

" [[His]624-the old man wife]243-his wife ! "[143-undine] [She]143-undine laughed a merry , mocking laugh . " [[His]624-the old man wife]243-his wife ! " Money , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " What is money ? "[143-undine] And kicked with [her]143-undine little foot a rotten stick which lay in [her]143-undine path as contemptuously as [she]143-undine had just thrown from [her]143-undine the wealth that a word might have made [hers]143-undine . Aye , gold and love , what are [they]1091-they ? [The great gods that rule [us]1087-us]1092-the great gods that rule us ! Gold , [god of the body with its lusts and its clay]1093-god of the body with its lusts and its clay ; Love , god of the soul with its fire and its passions . " Money ! What is money ? "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , derisively , for [she]143-undine had seen no deeper into life than love

songs and dreams could take [her]143-undine ; and [she]143-undine wrapped the little scarlet cloak about [her]143-undine and went [home]246-home light of heart and singing .

[She]143-undine found a letter waiting for [her]143-undine on [her]143-undine bedroom table , but took off [her]143-undine things and stood warming [her]143-undine hands at the fire before opening it . " Only from [poor Harry Blair]121-harry blair , about some book or flower , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " Poor "[143-undine] falls naturally before some names ; it did before [his]1099-he . [She]143-undine opened the letter and threw the wrapper into the fire , where it flamed up and turned to ashes , like [a young heart devoured by that cruel merciless old God of Love]1100-a young heart devoured by that cruel merciless old god of love . At first as [she]143-undine read [she]143-undine looked a little puzzled , then angry , then amused , and finally with a mingling of all three upon [her]143-undine face sat down before the fire with the three great blue sheets in [her]143-undine lap . It was as passionate an appeal as ever was penned by [arrow - smitten man]1101-arrow - smitten man .

For [her]143-undine sake [he]1099-he had given up all fortune , [friends]1102-friends , rank without a thought and without a regret . [She]143-undine alone could give [him]1099-he that for which alone [he]1099-he longed , that which alone could make [him]1099-he happy . Would [she]143-undine refuse [him]1099-he ? No , [she]143-undine could not , would not ; [he]1099-he felt sure of that . Nothing else was dear to [him]1099-he on [earth]651-earth , nothing else did [he]1099-he desire . So it ran on . It might be years , [he]1099-he said , before [he]1099-he could make [her]143-undine [[his]1099-he wife]243-his wife , but all [he]1099-he yearned

to know was that [her]143-undine heart was [his]1099-he , [her]143-undine head , [her]143-undine soul .

When [Undine]143-undine got thus far the disgust [she]143-undine felt got into [her]143-undine fingers , which sent the two sheets [she]143-undine had finished into the fire after the wrapper .

" [The father]884-the father asked for [my]143-undine body and offered [me]143-undine gold in return ; [he]884-the father asks [my]143-undine soul , spirit and body , and has nothing in [the universe]3271-the universe to give but a pair of [great staring woman]3272-great staring woman 's eyes , and a soft brain , crammed to bursting and without a particle of sense in it . "[143-undine] So [she]143-undine said to [herself]143-undine , as [she]143-undine sat tearing up the last page , still unread , and letting the fragments fall in a blue shower at [her]143-undine feet .

Well was it for [the hapless penman]1105-the hapless penman that [he]1105-the hapless penman could not see this and was not where [he]1105-the hapless penman longed to be lying at [her]143-undine feet ; better wandering [the woods]829-the woods where now and then , as the wind swayed the leafless branches , [he]1105-the hapless penman would catch a glimpse of [the house which held [her]143-undine]1107-the house which held her . [She]143-undine had just finished writing [him]1105-the hapless penman a few very cool and careless lines in answer , when the breakfast bell rang . " [I]143-undine will say nothing about it to [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan . It must make [a man]3044-a man feel wretchedly small to find that [another]3274-another knows [his]3044-a man love has been thrown back at [him]3044-a man . And [I]143-undine suppose it is a kind of love [they]3275-they both have for [me]143-undine , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine thought as [she]143-undine rose to go .

It is so nice to be desired by [others]713-others , so nice to be beautiful . [He]81-cousin jonathan understood [her]143-undine better than [anyone else]593-anyone else had ever done , in many ways . [He]81-cousin jonathan knew of that

power of passion that lay dead and unawakened beneath the cold , feelingless shell ; and [he]81-cousin jonathan knew as surely that the day would come when it would be called into wild life , not by [his]81-cousin jonathan hand or that of any [Harry Blair]121-harry blair , with [woman]931-woman 's eyes and soft trusting nature .

" [You]143-undine have still got [your]143-undine red cloak on ; [I]81-cousin jonathan always like [you]143-undine best in it , "[81-cousin jonathan] [he]81-cousin jonathan said , as [he]81-cousin jonathan drew [her]143-undine to [him]81-cousin jonathan to receive the morning kiss [he]81-cousin jonathan had given [her]143-undine ever since [she]143-undine came to [him]81-cousin jonathan . When breakfast was over [she]143-undine dispatched the note , as cold and killing a missive as ever carried

destruc- destruction

tion to [aerial castle]1116-aerial castle . [She]143-undine did not love [him]81-cousin jonathan , never could ; would never care to be [[any man]3249-any man 's wife]1082-any man 's wife ; hoped [they]1119-they would always be [good friends]1120-good friends ; hoped [he]81-cousin jonathan would find some one to make [him]81-cousin jonathan happy and love [him]81-cousin jonathan ; so the note ended .

All the morning [she]143-undine sat with [Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles who was really very ill ; but when the afternoon came , bringing [Miss Mell]91-miss mell and [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman , [she]143-undine felt free to take [her]143-undine book and cloak and wander out . ' Twas cheerless and wintry enough , but the air was pleasant and fresh after [the close room]1121-the close room , and [her]143-undine book engrossed [her]143-undine attention . Presently [she]143-undine heard voices , but did not look up until [she]143-undine found [herself]143-undine close to [Albert Blair]97-albert blair . There was [no one]406-no one with [him]97-albert blair but [his]97-albert blair dog , so [she]143-undine concluded [he]97-albert blair must have been speaking to it . [Master]1123-master and dog made a pretty picture as [they]1124-they stood on a raised bank , with the leaden sky and leafless trees for a background . [Both]741-both looked so strong and placid , so perfect after [their]741-both types . The half - closed eyes caught sight of [her]143-undine in a moment , and [their owner]1126-their owner came forward to meet [her]143-undine . [He]1126-their owner made some graceful remarks concerning the weather , inquired after [[her]143-undine cousin]1127-her cousin ; and [they]1124-they paused as [they]1124-they walked beneath the very trees where poor [Harry]121-harry blair had wandered in the morning .

" Here , [sir]3287-sir ! here ! "[1126-their owner] [he]1126-their owner called to the dog , who bounded out of [the little path]1128-the little path in search of some imaginary game . The dog came slowly back and

rubbed [his]1126-their owner head against [[his]1126-their owner master]1052-his master 's knee , who stooped down to stroke [his]1126-their owner head .

" How absolutely that dog obeys [you]1126-their owner , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , feeling as [she]143-undine always did in the presence of [the Piece - of - perfection]994-the piece - of - perfection , at a loss for an idea . " [I]1126-their owner make most things which belong to [me]1126-their owner do that , "[1126-their owner] [he]1126-their owner answered , quietly ; and as [she]143-undine glanced up at the firm lips beneath the delicate golden moustache [she]143-undine felt it must be so . How nice it must be to have something [you]1131-you must obey , something [you]1131-you can not help obeying , whether [you]1131-you wish or not ! [I]0-i never have , [she]143-undine thought . " Have [you]1126-their owner had that dog long ? "[143-undine] [she]143-undine asked . " About two years , and [he]1126-their owner never leaves [me]143-undine ; sleeps at the door of [[my]143-undine room]3288-my room every night . "[143-undine] " [You]1126-their owner would miss [him]1126-their owner now if [you]1126-their owner were to lose [him]1126-their owner , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , thinking of [Socrates]59-socrates . " Perhaps so , "[1126-their owner] [he]1126-their owner replied , carelessly curling the tip of [his]1126-their owner moustache ; " [he]1126-their owner is an exquisite animal . [I]1126-their owner have been offered fifty pounds for [him]1126-their owner , but would not let [him]1126-their owner go for four times that sum . "[1126-their owner] Again [he]1126-their owner stooped and touched the dog 's head , who walked close beside [him]1126-their owner , proud and pleased . [Undine]143-undine , walking at the other side , envied [him]1126-their owner . " Will [you]143-undine allow [me]1126-their owner the pleasure of carrying [your]143-undine book ? It is rather too large a one for [you]143-undine , "[1126-their owner] [he]1126-their owner said , noticing the ponderous volume under [her]143-undine arm .

Taking it from [her]143-undine , [he]1126-their owner glanced at the title , and [Undine]143-undine saw the satirical lines at the corner of [his]1126-their owner

mouth and eyes grow deeper ; but [he]1126-their owner only said in [his]1126-their owner blandest tone , " Rather stiff reading , [I]1126-their owner should imagine , "[1126-their owner] and stooped to loosen a dry branch that had caught in [her]143-undine skirt .

[Undine]143-undine wished the book buried under the highest pile of leaves that ever wind collected and left there to rot ; though only half an hour before [she]143-undine had been so absorbed by it that [Greenwood]6-greenwood and the vanities of the present life were banished from [her]143-undine mind .

In the presence of [all other men]1132-all other men and [women]346-women [she]143-undine could walk erect . Why in [this man]1134-this man 's presence was [she]143-undine bowed down , wishing only to do and say what [he]1134-this man might approve ? [Others]713-others might ridicule [her]143-undine dress , [her]143-undine manners , [her]143-undine tastes , and [she]143-undine would cling to [them]713-others with the greater tenacity ; but if a line deepened round [this man]1134-this man 's mouth , [she]143-undine would have given untold treasure to be able to alter or disclaim them .

[She]143-undine was glad when the walk was over as [she]143-undine always was to get out of [his]1134-this man society and yet , when [she]143-undine was alone before the fire , [she]143-undine took the great book and quietly tore out the leaves one by one and watched them wither and shrivel in the flames . " [I]143-undine must be going mad , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " What makes [me]143-undine do this , and take such pleasure in doing it ? "[143-undine] Going mad ! of course [she]143-undine was , as [we]1137-we most of [us]1137-we go once in [our]1137-we lives and , thank the gods , not more than once .

[Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan was sitting with [[his]81-cousin jonathan wife]243-his wife

up- [upstairs

stairs]1139-upstairs stairs ; and when it grew dark [Undine]143-undine built up the fire , blew out the light , and lay down on the sofa .

Presently down [the passage]691-the passage came [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan on the way to [[his]81-cousin jonathan study]694-his study ; quietly , for [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan 's footfalls were never heard . As [he]81-cousin jonathan passed [he]81-cousin jonathan looked in at the door . The red coals cast a ruddy glow over [the little room]1142-the little room , and the chairs and tables cast long flickering shadows on the brown wall . On the sofa in the corner opposite the fire [she]143-undine lay , just visible in [her]143-undine white dress , with arms clasped over [her]143-undine head and dark eyes fixed on the firelight : not seeing it , but only a tall figure with a rough dog at its side standing on a leaf - strewn bank , with the wintry sky and barren trees for setting .

Long the little figure in [its]1143-its brown coat and plaid trousers stood watching in the doorway ; at last [it]1143-its entered and kneeled down softly beside [her]143-undine . [He]81-cousin jonathan had loved [her]143-undine so long , [he]81-cousin jonathan had loved [her]143-undine so passionately , with the best love [his]81-cousin jonathan nature could give ; and tonight this love spoke itself in words as vehement and startling as the passion itself had been long restrained and covered over . [She]143-undine started up and threw [him]81-cousin jonathan from [her]143-undine , and , quivering with rage , stood before [him]81-cousin jonathan . Still on [his]81-cousin jonathan knees at [her]143-undine feet , [the little man]874-the little man caught [her]143-undine hand and glanced up at the face above [him]81-cousin jonathan . Even in the dim firelight , the look of intense loathing it wore was visible . It brought [him]81-cousin jonathan back to reason .

Dropping the hand , filled with insufferable shame , [he]81-cousin jonathan crawled from [the room]239-the room almost on hands and knees , as though to hide [him]81-cousin jonathan in the ground . As [he]81-cousin jonathan shuffled through the doorway [he]81-cousin jonathan dropped one green slipper on the mat . [Undine]143-undine stood as [one in a dream]1146-one in a dream and watched [the little figure]1147-the little figure in [its]1147-the little figure plaid trousers and brown coat as it glided swiftly from [the room]239-the room , to pass out of [her]143-undine sight forever . For [the little man]874-the little man , in [his]874-the little man green plaid , with [his]874-the little man angel eyes and beautiful prayers , [she]143-undine was to see no more , though from afar off [his]874-the little man shadow might fall on and darken [her]143-undine . As [she]143-undine passed out at the door [she]143-undine drew up [her]143-undine skirts , lest in passing they might touch the shoe that lay there .

" ' Tis [a pretty little thing]3289-a pretty little thing , "[97-albert blair] soliloquized [Albert Blair]97-albert blair as [he]97-albert blair walked [home]246-home through the wood the same evening ; " a pretty little thing , and if [she]3289-a pretty little thing were trained might be good for something . [She]3289-a pretty little thing would not care to be [[any man]3249-any man 's wife]1082-any man 's wife , [she]3289-a pretty little thing tells [[my]97-albert blair poor fool of [a brother]3293-a brother]3292-my poor fool of a brother . Well , if these affairs of [mine]97-albert blair turn out well and [I]97-albert blair am able to indulge a fancy , who knows ? How should [you]97-albert blair like a certain little eccentricity for [a mistress]3294-a mistress , [Prince]3295-prince ? "[97-albert blair] [he]97-albert blair said , touching with the tips of [his]97-albert blair fingers the dog 's head . " Whether [I]97-albert blair ever let things go as far as that or not , [I]97-albert blair may see what [I]97-albert blair can do with [her]1151-her . Ha , ha ! [he]97-albert blair had [his]97-albert blair thoughts of [her]1151-her . " And [Albert Blair]97-albert blair smiled [his]97-albert blair quiet smile . The next morning , when [Undine]143-undine had fallen into [her]143-undine first troubled sleep , [[Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles ' maid]1152-mrs. barnacles ' maid came to rouse [her]143-undine . [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan had been obliged to leave on some unexpected and most important business and might be gone for weeks . [He]81-cousin jonathan had started before daybreak , and [[his]81-cousin jonathan wife]243-his wife was terribly cut up at [his]81-cousin jonathan having left [her]1151-her when [she]1151-her was so ill . [She]1151-her seemed worse and wanted to see [Undine]143-undine at once , [the girl]630-the girl said . When [Undine]143-undine entered [the room]239-the room [she]143-undine found [the poor invalid]1156-the poor invalid in tears . " It was so cruel of [him]1156-the poor invalid to go away like this , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , sobbing ; " [he]1156-the poor invalid knows how that hateful [Miss Mell]91-miss mell and [Mrs. Goodman]92-mrs. goodman will talk and say [he]1156-the poor invalid cares nothing for [me]143-undine , to go away and leave [me]143-undine when [I]143-undine am so ill , and yet [he]1156-the poor invalid does it . "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine tried to console [her]1151-her and felt [she]143-undine could not tell [her]1151-her , as [she]143-undine had determined , that in a few hours [she]143-undine also would leave . In [her]143-undine cold way [she]143-undine felt pity for [the poor woman whose husband]1157-the poor woman whose husband cared as little for [her]1157-the poor woman whose husband as [she]1157-the poor woman whose husband did for [him]1158-him , who loved nothing , had [no friends]1159-no friends , and lived in the constant fear and dread of [Goodman]92-mrs. goodman , [Mell]91-miss mell , Co.

" [I]143-undine was thinking , "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine said , " of going to stay[143-undine]

with [[my]0-i grandmother]456-my grandmother . Since [[my]0-i grandfather]451-my grandfather 's death [she]456-my grandmother lives alone and has often asked [me]0-i to come to [her]456-my grandmother ; but [I]0-i will not leave [you]1162-you till [you]1162-you are better . "[0-i]

So all that day [Undine]143-undine sat at [her]143-undine bedside .

[She]1127-her cousin looked ill and pale , but [he]97-albert blair had never liked [her]1127-her cousin aspect so well as [he]97-albert blair did at that moment . " [[Your]1127-her cousin cousin]3260-your cousin is seriously ill , [I]97-albert blair hear , "[97-albert blair] [he]97-albert blair said as [he]97-albert blair came forward to meet [her]1127-her cousin ; " and [you]1127-her cousin look as though [you]1127-her cousin had not found much rest last night . " [I]143-undine had not to sit up last night ; [Mr. Barnacles]136-mr. barnacles left only early this morning , "[143-undine] answered [Undine]143-undine .

" So [I]143-undine heard just now . Would n't [you]1127-her cousin allow [me]143-undine to send [some one]312-some one to sleep here ? " [He]3295-prince will do just as [I]1052-his master tell [him]3295-prince , "[1052-his master] said [[his]97-albert blair master]1052-his master , touching the dog with [his]1052-his master foot . " Here [Prince]132-prince , lie down ! "[143-undine] " [Poor old fellow]3311-poor old fellow ! The dog looked up at [her]143-undine with [his]97-albert blair loving ,

trust- trustful

ful eyes and tried to lick [her]143-undine face , till [she]143-undine buried it again in [his]97-albert blair neck .

[Albert Blair]97-albert blair called again the next day and every day in the dreary two weeks that followed , but [he]97-albert blair never stayed more than a few minutes , and sometimes did not even come in , only wanting to hear how [the invalid]1163-the invalid was . [Undine]143-undine as [she]143-undine sat before the fire , not caring to read or work , counted the slow hours as [they]1173-they passed , for [they]1173-they brought [his]97-albert blair coming nearer . [Prince]132-prince stayed with [her]143-undine always . [She]143-undine had thought never to love another animal again when [Socrates]59-socrates died ; but [our]1174-our hearts are often larger than [our]1174-our wills , and the great curly dog had grown to be almost what the brown - eyed monkey had been to [her]143-undine in other days .

[VIII]137-viii . BEAUTIFUL SNOW

IT WAS a cold wintry afternoon and the white snow clouds were lying low and heavy . [Undine]143-undine , after many almost sleepless nights , crept down to [the little parlour]1175-the little parlour and had a fire made there , the first that had been made since [Cousin Jonathan]81-cousin jonathan left .

[Miss Mell]91-miss mell , now [[her]91-miss mell friend]1176-her friend was getting better , had offered to come and sit up with [her]143-undine ; and [Undine]143-undine , as [she]143-undine nestled down in the great armchair , looked forward to a long evening of drowsy rest . [Prince]132-prince lay sleeping before [her]143-undine with [his]97-albert blair head at [her]143-undine feet , and [she]143-undine , half dozing , watched the little sparks as they fluttered up the chimney . So short , so warm , so bright ; how pleasant the life of a spark must be ! " [You]143-undine seem to find something very absorbing in the contemplation of the fire this evening , "[1177-a voice beside her] said [a voice beside [her]143-undine]1177-a voice beside her ; and [Prince]132-prince , wide awake in an instant , leaped up to greet [[his]97-albert blair master]1052-his master . " [You]132-prince quite startled [me]143-undine , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " [I]143-undine did not think [you]132-prince would come tonight ; it is getting almost dark . "[143-undine]

" Yes ; [we]3314-we have the promise of a heavy fall of[1177-a voice beside her]

snow , " [he]1052-his master said , as [he]1052-his master seated [himself]1052-his master in an armchair on the other side of the fire .[143-undine]

" [You]143-undine can have no idea what a charming picture [this room]3315-this room makes , coming in from the cold outside , "[1052-his master] [he]1052-his master continued , trying at the same time to repulse [Prince]132-prince , who in a transport of joy had put a paw on each shoulder . " [You]132-prince must take [him]1052-his master [home]246-home with [you]132-prince tonight , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . " [I]143-undine am not going to be so cruel as to keep [him]1052-his master here any longer ; and [you]132-prince must miss [him]1052-his master . "[143-undine] " No , [I]994-the piece - of - perfection never miss [him]1052-his master . [You]143-undine had better keep [him]1052-his master if [he]1052-his master is any pleasure to [you]143-undine , "[994-the piece - of - perfection] answered [the Piece - of - perfection]994-the piece - of - perfection , stretching out one delicate white hand to the dancing flame . After a short silence [he]1052-his master said , " Do [you]143-undine never wish to return to [Africa]2-africa ? "[1052-his master] " No , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine replied . " [I]1052-his master know [no one there]3317-no one there . [[My]1052-his master stepfather]3318-my stepfather has remarried . But [I]1052-his master should like to see [the old farm]3319-the old farm and [[my]1052-his master little monkey]3320-my little monkey 's grave again . "[1052-his master] [He]1052-his master was leaning back now with [his]1052-his master face in the shadow ; [she]143-undine could not see the lines [she]143-undine dreaded at the corners of [his]1052-his master mouth , so [she]143-undine answered , " Yes , [he]1052-his master was [the best friend [I]143-undine had]3321-the best friend i had . "[143-undine] Another pause followed ; then [he]1052-his master said , more abruptly than was [his]1052-his master wo nt , " [I]1052-his master have a favour to ask of [you]143-undine , [Miss Bock]125-miss bock .[1052-his master]

" [You]143-undine rather puzzle [me]1052-his master , "[1052-his master] [he]1052-his master said . " [I]1052-his master never feel sure [I]1052-his master understand [you]1180-you , and [I]1052-his master do [most men]911-most men . At times [I]1052-his master form an opinion of [you]1180-you , at times another , but[1052-his master]

[I]0-i never feel sure that [I]0-i am right . [I]0-i wish [you]1180-you could satisfy [my]0-i curiosity and explain to [me]0-i how it is [you]1180-you come to have such extraordinary views and manners . "[1180-you]

" Why do [you]1052-his master not put some other word in the place of "[0-i] extraordinaryí say , " pernicious , í "[0-i] reprehensibleí ? That is what [you]1052-his master really think , " [she]125-miss bock replied , using a freer speech with [him]1052-his master than ever before , for in the firelight the bands of speech are loosed and the tongues of [men]710-men and [women]346-women do wonders . [He]1052-his master never paid [her]125-miss bock compliments or spoke to [her]125-miss bock as [he]1052-his master would to [another woman]3325-another woman , so [he]1052-his master answered quietly , "[1052-his master] Those words would be almost too strong ; say , unwomanly . " [Another making this remark]3326-another making this remark would have been answered by a contemptuous silence ; or at best [she]125-miss bock would have launched out into a denunciation of that singular injustice which cramps and dwarfs [a woman]374-a woman 's mind , making it an unpardonable offence against [her]125-miss bock womanhood to entertain a thought or give utterance to an idea that has not been repeated and reŽchoed till it is as stale and unpalatable as a last year 's loaf . Tonight [she]125-miss bock only said : "[1181-they] Why are [they]1181-they unwomanly ? What is [your]1052-his master idea of what [a woman]374-a woman ought to be ? "[1052-his master]

" [You]1052-his master are asking [me]1052-his master a question hard to answer , "[1052-his master] [he]1052-his master replied , looking with [his]1052-his master half - closed eyes into the fire . " [A woman to be womanly]3328-a woman to be womanly should have nothing striking or peculiar about [her]374-a woman ; [she]374-a woman should[1052-his master]

shun all extremes in manners and modes of expression ; [she]374-a woman should have no strong views on any question , especially when they differ from those of [her]374-a woman surroundings ; [she]374-a woman should not be too reserved in [her]374-a woman manners , and still less too affable and undignified . There is between all extremes a happy mediate , and there [a woman]374-a woman should always be found . [Men]710-men may turn to one side or the other ; [woman]931-woman never must . "[1052-his master]

[Undine]143-undine said nothing when [he]1052-his master ended . [She]143-undine could not help it ; [she]143-undine had been born with strong and determined ideas on every subject , sub- and superlunar , and not one step of [her]143-undine sixteen years ' journey had [she]143-undine walked in [the happy mediate road]1186-the happy mediate road . It was too late to change now . [They]1187-they had told [her]143-undine that the day would come when [she]143-undine would repent having done nothing to try to conform [herself]143-undine , at least outwardly , to the views of [others]713-others ; and [she]143-undine did repent it as [she]143-undine sat there that evening . [She]143-undine would have parted with all that was highest and best in [herself]143-undine to become a little less [Undine]143-undine , a little more like [anyone else]593-anyone else . Who was [this man]1134-this man , what was [he]1134-this man , that [he]1134-this man should make [her]143-undine grovel so ? [she]143-undine asked [herself]143-undine . " [You]143-undine have not yet answered [me]994-the piece - of - perfection , "[994-the piece - of - perfection] said [the Piece - of - perfection]994-the piece - of - perfection , again stretching out [his]1134-this man delicate hands to the blaze . " Are [you]143-undine going to satisfy [my]994-the piece - of - perfection curiosity ? "[994-the piece - of - perfection]

It seemed so strangely delightful to do something at [his]1134-this man request , and yet [she]143-undine seemed to have nothing to tell , nothing that [she]143-undine could tell [him]1134-this man ; and [she]143-undine said so .

" Nothing ! And [you]1134-this man have lived for sixteen years and in [two continents]3329-two continents , and certainly are not troubled with lack of ideas . [You]1134-this man must excuse [me]143-undine , however . [I]143-undine have no right to press [you]1134-this man in this way . "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine sat leaning forward with [her]143-undine arms folded on [her]143-undine knees , looking into the bright flame that threw its light full upon [her]143-undine , and began , awkwardly and stupidly enough at first , to tell of the old African days awkwardly and stupidly enough till [she]143-undine forgot the presence of [the man who was leaning back in the shade on the other side of the fire and watching [her]143-undine with [his]1134-this man cold blue eyes]1192-the man who was leaning back in the shade on the other side of the fire and watching her with his cold blue eyes . Then [she]143-undine saw only [Socrates]59-socrates and [[her]1193-her governess]1194-her governess , and [the little Dutch girls]390-the little dutch girls , and [the old red farmhouse in [the Karoo]17-the karoo]1196-the old red farmhouse in the karoo saw the little round - stone koppies , with [their]1197-their milk bushes and red sand , and was again [the little child]277-the little child among [them]1197-their all , with [the child]223-the child 's thoughts and longings . [Albert Blair]97-albert blair sat and listened without the shade of a sneer upon [his]97-albert blair lips . [Most men]911-most men have [their]911-most men moments of insanity , which belie and are at variance with all the days and years of the past and will find [no successor in the future]1201-no successor in the future , moments when [their]911-most men thoughts and feelings are opposed to all [they]911-most men have ever deemed rational , right or possible . Such moments came for the first time and the last to the Piece - of - perfection as [he]97-albert blair sat listening to [Undine]143-undine in the firelight .

A pity , nay , a passionate sympathy , filled [his]97-albert blair heart for [her]143-undine ; for one moment [he]97-albert blair forgot that the soul which troubled itself further than to find and eat the bread and honey of this life was the soul of [a fool]890-a fool forgot that the only right of [a woman]374-a woman is the right of the rose to smile and be , not to think and live . Forgetting all this , bewitched , befooled , infatuated , [he]97-albert blair stretched out [his]97-albert blair hand to [the little figure opposite [him]97-albert blair]1204-the little figure opposite him . " [Your]143-undine life has been lonely ; [no one]406-no one has understood [you]143-undine ; [you]143-undine may have had [no one]406-no one to guide [you]143-undine , "[97-albert blair] [he]97-albert blair said , speaking for the first time and in a voice strangely sweet and unlike [his]97-albert blair own . " Will [you]1204-the little figure opposite him let [me]97-albert blair be [[your]1204-the little figure opposite him friend]3332-your friend and take care of [you]143-undine ? "[97-albert blair] [She]1204-the little figure opposite him sat and looked at [him]97-albert blair as one in a dream . " Come to [me]97-albert blair , [darling]3107-darling , "[97-albert blair] [he]97-albert blair said , holding out [his]97-albert blair hand to [her]1204-the little figure opposite him . Still [she]1204-the little figure opposite him sat and looked at [him]97-albert blair ; then [he]97-albert blair drew [her]1204-the little figure opposite him softly to [his]97-albert blair arms , and [she]1204-the little figure opposite him nestled close to [him]97-albert blair . [She]1204-the little figure opposite him did not kiss [him]97-albert blair or speak : only clung to [him]97-albert blair and rested with [her]1204-the little figure opposite him arms round [his]97-albert blair neck and [her]1204-the little figure opposite him head on [his]97-albert blair shoulder . If [she]1204-the little figure opposite him lay there hours or moments , [she]1204-the little figure opposite him did not know ; it was enough to be there . " Why do [you]1204-the little figure opposite him lie so quietly , [darling]3107-darling ? Why do [you]1204-the little figure opposite him not tell [me]97-albert blair that [you]1204-the little figure opposite him love [me]97-albert blair ? "[97-albert blair] [he]97-albert blair said , turning [her]1204-the little figure opposite him face round to [his]97-albert blair .

It seemed to break [her]1204-the little figure opposite him rest , and [she]1204-the little figure opposite him only answered [him]97-albert blair by putting [her]1204-the little figure opposite him hand softly on [his]97-albert blair cheek . " Are [you]1204-the little figure opposite him not going to kiss [me]97-albert blair , [[my]97-albert blair little girl]3335-my little girl ? "[97-albert blair] [he]97-albert blair asked again , lightly bringing [his]97-albert blair lips down to [hers]1204-the little figure opposite him and kissing [them]1205-them . [She]1204-the little figure opposite him kissed [him]97-albert blair and then buried [her]1204-the little figure opposite him face in [his]97-albert blair shoulder . " Did [you]1204-the little figure opposite him ever care about [anyone]3037-anyone before [you]1204-the little figure opposite him loved [me]97-albert blair ? Did [you]1204-the little figure opposite him , [darling]3107-darling ? "[97-albert blair] [he]97-albert blair asked [her]1204-the little figure opposite him , running [his]97-albert blair fingers through [her]1204-the little figure opposite him hair . What was the past ? What was the future ? The present was enough . [She]1204-the little figure opposite him answered , " No . [Undine]143-undine kneeled down before the low window and drew back the blind to watch [him]97-albert blair as [he]97-albert blair passed down [the garden path]601-the garden path .

The snow had fallen , the clouds had gone , and the full moon poured down [her]143-undine light on a white glittering world so white , so pure , so calm . Even the iron paling had its coat of crystal , and the dark evergreens that grew beside the window were bent beneath their load . As far as the eye could reach stretched the silent white snow ; only down [the little garden path]1221-the little garden path there were [his]97-albert blair footmarks in it .

[IX]138-ix . [TRODDEN SNOW]15-trodden snow

" [UNDINE]143-undine , "[97-albert blair] said [the Piece - of - perfection]994-the piece - of - perfection the next day , as [he]97-albert blair stood in the doorway putting on [his]97-albert blair greatcoat , preparatory to taking [his]97-albert blair departure ; " did [that little old cousin of [yours]143-undine]3344-that little old cousin of yours never try to make love to [you]143-undine ? "[97-albert blair]

" No , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . [She]143-undine hated [him]97-albert blair so , it would have given [her]143-undine such infinite satisfaction to have injured [him]97-albert blair ; yet at the same time it seemed the height of meanness to speak against [him]97-albert blair [the man who had befriended [her]143-undine]1223-the man who had befriended her . The untruth seemed , in the darkness and confusion of the moment , higher than the truth , and it passed from [her]143-undine lips to bring forth the poisoned fruit which the lie bears , be it spoken for [God]62-god 's glory or the salvation of a soul .

[She]143-undine would have retracted it almost in the same breath , but [he]97-albert blair answered quickly , " [I]97-albert blair am glad to hear it ; [I]97-albert blair have a greater respect for [[my]97-albert blair old pedagogue]3345-my old pedagogue than for almost [any man]3249-any man [I]97-albert blair know , but [I]97-albert blair had an idea from the way [he]97-albert blair sometimes spoke of [you]143-undine that [he]97-albert blair cared rather more for [you]143-undine than [[a second cousin]3347-a second cousin 's husband]3348-a second cousin 's husband generally does . [I]97-albert blair am glad it was fancy .[97-albert blair]

[I]0-i will come again this evening and take [you]143-undine for a walk . " And [he]97-albert blair was gone .[0-i]

[He]97-albert blair was gone , and the untrue word was gone also . [She]143-undine stood in [the hall]625-the hall and buried [her]143-undine face in both hands , utterly humiliated . [She]143-undine had told a lie , and told it to [him]97-albert blair . Now it was all swallowed up in this it was to [him]97-albert blair .

[She]143-undine ran out through [the little garden]1225-the little garden with nothing on [her]143-undine head and the sleet and snow falling thick upon [her]143-undine . [He]97-albert blair was just entering the wood . It was late the next morning when [Undine]143-undine rose ; for it is very pleasant , when [one]397-one has delicious visions , to be dreaming and dozing in bed on a winter 's morning . [He]121-harry blair is much older than [she]630-the girl is , but [a penniless girl]3375-a penniless girl ca n't be too fastidious , and [he]121-harry blair is terribly rich . What do [you]91-miss mell think [some one]312-some one comes here once and sometimes twice a day for ? "[91-miss mell] " Oh , [he]121-harry blair is polite to [all women]1215-all women ; [his]121-harry blair attentions mean nothing . [He]121-harry blair will look higher when [he]121-harry blair chooses [a wife]1019-a wife , "[96-mrs. barnacles] said [Mrs. Barnacles]96-mrs. barnacles . [Miss Mell]91-miss mell smiled a far - seeing smile and broke [her]91-miss mell cake . While [they]1256-they sat talking of [her]91-miss mell in [the little parlour]1175-the little parlour , [Undine]143-undine was standing for the last time under [her]143-undine old tree in the wood . It was leafless and bare now , and great white icicles hung from its branches . [The little stream]1258-the little stream was silent and noiseless .

Next summer the green leaves would break forth on it and the little brook would run laughing past , whispering to the long grasses and white forest flowers , and among its knotted swollen roots the bright - backed beetles and busy ants would run ; but [she]143-undine would rest no more among them . " Good - bye[143-undine]

old tree , " [she]143-undine said , breaking off a bit of its dry frosty bark . "[143-undine] Good - bye , [[my]0-i friend]1259-my friend , [[my]0-i dear old friend]1260-my dear old friend .
