[Undine]143-undine gave it , with all the more alacrity as [Algernon Sidney]167-algernon sidney had just fallen over the pole , to the great damage of [his]167-algernon sidney skin and nose .

At breakfast [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps maintained a rigid silence ; [she]165-mrs. snappercaps ate with a purpose and drank copiously and with energy , and [[her]165-mrs. snappercaps husband]1482-her husband clearly perceived that evil was approaching . [He]1482-her husband picked [his]1482-her husband chop and drank [his]1482-her husband coffee in silent uneasiness , though in what direction the storm would burst [he]1482-her husband could form no conjecture .

Breakfast being ended , [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps climbed

into the waggon , and after some trouble produced from one of the lowest boxes a great red bible and a copy of [Wesley]168-master john wesley 's hymns with great shining clasps . Armed with these weapons , [she]165-mrs. snappercaps again descended , and took [her]165-mrs. snappercaps seat on a camp - stool that stood against the back wheel on the shady side of the waggon . [[Her]165-mrs. snappercaps husband]1482-her husband , having already assumed [his]1482-her husband favourite posture , lay at full length on the ground , with [his]1482-her husband head resting on [his]1482-her husband arms .

" [Mr. Snappercaps]164-mr. snappercaps , do [you]164-mr. snappercaps intend to listen ? "[243-his wife] said [[his]1482-her husband wife]243-his wife . " Listen to what ? "[164-mr. snappercaps] asked [Mr. Snappercaps]164-mr. snappercaps , looking up sleepily .

" To the word of [God]62-god , "[165-mrs. snappercaps] responded [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps . When the question was converted into these terms it was impossible to reply in the negative , so [he]1482-her husband picked [himself]1482-her husband up and , leaning back against the front wheel , pulled [his]1482-her husband hat low over [his]1482-her husband eyes and wondered what on earth this new turn of affairs portended . Six years [he]1482-her husband had been married , and never yet had [she]165-mrs. snappercaps used such instruments for administering to [him]1482-her husband the reward of [his]1482-her husband numerous transgressions ; but today [he]1482-her husband felt a vague yet strong conviction that the books were to become the instruments of [his]1482-her husband correction for some as yet unknown dereliction from the path of duty . To [Undine]143-undine , who sat on the ground nursing [the baby]1556-the baby , [she]165-mrs. snappercaps said , " [You]143-undine , no doubt , will not wish to remain ; [you]143-undine may go . [I]165-mrs. snappercaps compel [no one]406-no one to stay , "[165-mrs. snappercaps] [she]165-mrs. snappercaps continued . " The worship and the love of[165-mrs. snappercaps]

[God]62-god flow from the inner mind , from the outer soul it must be free it must be like the rays of heaven . [I]0-i compel [no one]406-no one to stay . "[0-i]

" If [you]143-undine have no objection , [I]143-undine shall remain , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , who felt no inclination to leave the shade of the waggon and march off into the broiling sun with [Master John Wesley]168-master john wesley in [her]143-undine arms . [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps now seized [Masters Algernon Sidney]176-algernon sidney and [Ferdinando Shakespeare]166-ferdinando shakespeare , and seating [them]2159-them with great force very flat on the ground on each side of [her]165-mrs. snappercaps proceeded to loosen the clasps of [her]165-mrs. snappercaps [Wesley]168-master john wesley 's hymns . Having given out in the most approved style the whole of Hymn 1 , [she]165-mrs. snappercaps proceeded to sing it with great energy . [Mr. Snappercaps]164-mr. snappercaps pulled the hat yet lower over [his]164-mr. snappercaps eyes and reckoned out for the hundred and fiftieth time how much [he]164-mr. snappercaps was losing by this delay with the oxen . Nor were [the rest of [the audience]2161-the audience]2160-the rest of the audience very attentive . [Ferdinando Shakespeare]166-ferdinando shakespeare was engaged in counting [his]166-ferdinando shakespeare fingers , [Algernon Sidney]176-algernon sidney in catching the ants that ran up [his]164-mr. snappercaps legs , while [Undine]143-undine sat wondering for how long a time [John Wesley]168-master john wesley might be counted upon to remain quiet . [That young gentleman]987-that young gentleman sat motionless , with a finger hooked in [his]987-that young gentleman mouth , staring with wide - open eyes and rapt attention at the marvellous display of maternal stumps made visible on [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps ' upper and lower jaws during [her]165-mrs. snappercaps vocal effort .

The last verse having at last been reached , [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps put the hymn - book down on the ground

exactly in front of [her]165-mrs. snappercaps with great precision , and proceeded to open the red book . From its pages [she]165-mrs. snappercaps made a careful and apt selection of passages applicable , [she]165-mrs. snappercaps deemed , to the case of at least [one of [[her]165-mrs. snappercaps hearers]2164-her hearers]2163-one of her hearers . These [she]165-mrs. snappercaps read with much emphasis and many a long and ominous pause ; denunciations against [Pharisees]2165-pharisees , [hypocrites]2166-hypocrites and [unbelievers]2167-unbelievers [she]165-mrs. snappercaps delivered with equal fervour and point . Having brought this part of the proceeding to a termination , [she]165-mrs. snappercaps went on to part two of the programme . This consisted in reading the eleventh and twelfth chapters of the second book of [Samuel]177-samuel , wherein is recorded how [the amorous King of [Israel]36-israel]2168-the amorous king of israel walked on [his]2168-the amorous king of israel roof at evening tide and beheld the limbs of [the beautiful wife of [Uriah the Hittite]178-uriah the hittite]2169-the beautiful wife of uriah the hittite ; how for love of [them]2170-them [he]2168-the amorous king of israel caused [the faithful soldier]2171-the faithful soldier to meet [his]2168-the amorous king of israel death before the walls at [Rabbah]37-rabbah ; how [the wife of [Uriah the Hittite]178-uriah the hittite]2172-the wife of uriah the hittite , when [she]2172-the wife of uriah the hittite heard that [[her]2172-the wife of uriah the hittite husband]1482-her husband was dead , mourned for [him]2168-the amorous king of israel many days , and when the days of [her]2172-the wife of uriah the hittite mourning were ended went to the arms of [the king]2174-the king .

[Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps had just reached this point in the very appropriate narrative [she]165-mrs. snappercaps had selected , when [John Wesley]168-master john wesley , no longer entertained by the dental display , made the most emphatic demonstrations of disapproval and obliged [[his]168-master john wesley nurse]2175-his nurse to carry [him]168-master john wesley off .

[Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps now turned one eye on [[her]165-mrs. snappercaps husband]1482-her husband , otherwise [King David]179-david , and beheld [him]1482-her husband , much to [her]165-mrs. snappercaps wrath , either pretending to be or really fast

asleep . Preferring to act upon the assumption that [he]1482-her husband was pretending , [she]165-mrs. snappercaps addressed [him]1482-her husband thus , but in a tone loud enough to awaken [him]1482-her husband , however far gone in [the land of dreams]2177-the land of dreams :

Ho - o - o ! Ho - o - o ! "[164-mr. snappercaps]

This latter sound was as the whistling of the wind through a keyhole , produced by drawing [her]2178-her lips into the smallest possible circle and moving [her]2178-her head to and fro .

It was [her]2178-her way when [she]2178-her reached a climax and language failed [her]2178-her , and [Mr. Snappercaps]164-mr. snappercaps was accustomed to it ; but waking suddenly [he]164-mr. snappercaps felt confused , and looked out over [the still Sunday landscape]2179-the still sunday landscape , the clear blue sky , [the hazy brown hills clothed with clumps of dark green bush]2180-the hazy brown hills clothed with clumps of dark green bush , looked out and wondered

" So saying , [she]165-mrs. snappercaps raised [the Masters Ferdinando]166-ferdinando shakespeare and [Algernon]176-algernon sidney from the ground , with each arm and with as much energy as [she]165-mrs. snappercaps had seated [them]3752-them .[180-william]

" Did n't know [Christians]3766-christians took [folks]3767-folks to the devil , "[164-mr. snappercaps] said [Mr. Snappercaps]164-mr. snappercaps under [his]164-mr. snappercaps breath , as [he]164-mr. snappercaps walked off in the direction of [the muddy kloof 1]2188-the muddy kloof 1 from which [they]2189-their got [their]2189-their water , to seek for a sleeping - place under some brush .

It was near evening , and as [he]164-mr. snappercaps had not returned , [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps , after dozing all day in [the wagon]2190-the wagon , descended to resume [her]165-mrs. snappercaps old seat on the camp stool , and took [[her]165-mrs. snappercaps baby]1565-her baby . [Undine]143-undine , now [her]143-undine arms were free , sat with [the children]1821-the children at the side of [the road]1264-the road , making [houses]2194-houses in the sand for [them]1821-the children .

As mischance would have it , [Master Ferdinando Shakespeare]181-master ferdinando shakespeare bethought [him]164-mr. snappercaps at this moment of getting a mug of water from the iron bucket that stood under the waggon , the better to moisten [their]2189-their sand . Stumbling over the disselboom 2 with the mug in [his]164-mr. snappercaps hand , its contents were deposited on [his]164-mr. snappercaps person , drenching [his]164-mr. snappercaps begrimed white pinafore .

" That is what comes of playing on a Sunday , "[771-his mother]

1 [Ravine]182-ravine .

2 Pole of the waggon .

said [[his]164-mr. snappercaps mother]771-his mother . " [[You]1821-the children wicked little boys]3768-you wicked little boys ! Leave that sand alone . "[771-his mother]

" It was [my]143-undine fault ; [I]143-undine began the play , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . "[165-mrs. snappercaps] " Go to whom ? "[143-undine] asked [Undine]143-undine , looking round in blank astonishment , for [she]143-undine had been out of earshot when the little encounter of the morning took place , and imagined that [Mr. Snappercaps]164-mr. snappercaps had gone in search of [his]164-mr. snappercaps oxen .

" Oh , [you]143-undine sweet little thing ! "[165-mrs. snappercaps] said [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps . " [You]143-undine do n't know that [he]164-mr. snappercaps is over at [the kloof]2196-the kloof , do [you]143-undine ? [You]143-undine never sit with [your]143-undine head stuck on [your]143-undine hand staring at the fire , just to try and look sentimental and make [him]164-mr. snappercaps feel sorry for [you]143-undine . [You]143-undine never do , do [you]143-undine ? [You]143-undine would not do such a thing ! And [you]143-undine never pretended [you]143-undine could not make a fire on purpose to get [him]164-mr. snappercaps to come and help [you]143-undine ! And [you]143-undine do n't get up early , "[165-mrs. snappercaps] continued [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps , speaking very rapidly , with the solitary

canine , the only complete tooth [she]165-mrs. snappercaps boasted , looking very strangely like a fang ; " [you]143-undine do n't get up in the grey dawn and sit on the trap and try and look melancholy till [he]164-mr. snappercaps comes to talk with [you]143-undine . [You]143-undine would not think of doing such a thing ! [I]165-mrs. snappercaps 'm glad to see [you]143-undine do n't deny it ; [you]143-undine ca n't , "[165-mrs. snappercaps] said [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps , rocking [herself]165-mrs. snappercaps and [[her]165-mrs. snappercaps baby]1565-her baby energetically to and fro .

The true state of affairs now dawned on [Undine]143-undine , who stood irresolute with the soap and pinafores in [her]143-undine hand , half inclined to laugh , half to enter a protest . It ended in [her]143-undine doing neither , but asking very quietly whether [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps could tell [her]143-undine in which kloof [she]143-undine would find the little fountain [the driver]2120-the driver had discovered that morning . This cool manner of receiving [her]143-undine attack brought yellow spots to the corners of [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps ' mouth . [Her]143-undine only reply was a passionate and often repeated injunction to go to [him]2120-the driver , go to [him]2120-the driver , go , go , at once .

In direct opposition to these kindly instructions , [Undine]143-undine walked off through the bush in the direction of [a small kloof where , instead of the great clumps of elephants]2199-a small kloof where , instead of the great clumps of elephants - food 1 and coonie with which [the hills]752-the hills were covered , a thin line of forest trees showed , at least sometimes , the presence of water .

The sun was almost setting ; [his]2120-the driver rays made the great round clumps cast long oval shadows , and the

1 Elephants - food and coonie are hardy shrubs .

busy red and black ants were hurrying [home]246-home with [their]2202-their last load of sticks . [Undine]143-undine killed many of [them]2202-their as [she]143-undine walked on quickly , and [her]143-undine heart was not very light as [she]143-undine passed in and out among the bushes . [She]143-undine had worked till [she]143-undine felt as though [she]143-undine had no head left , and no soul , and the golden glory of the sky and the still beauty of the bush said nothing to [her]143-undine . In [her]143-undine ears rang the yells of [a baby]1552-a baby ; with its weight [her]143-undine arms ached , and [her]143-undine whole body too , from head to foot , for want of rest . [She]143-undine was tired ; [she]143-undine was wretched ; [she]143-undine was finding out that there are aches other than those of the heart , and weariness unutterable that is not of the spirit . May [a man]3044-a man 's soul be tapped out through [his]3044-a man muscle ? Are there things more enervating and destructive to its life than being the idle plaything of [a rich man]945-a rich man ? Is it crueler pain to be pricked by [a woman]374-a woman 's pins than lashed by a great affliction ? When [we]2207-we labour like [brutes]2208-brutes , do [our]2207-we hearts become like [theirs]2208-brutes , till to eat and have rest becomes all [our]2207-we ambition ?

The busy ants as [they]2209-they hurried [home]246-home had no answer for [her]143-undine question , nor [the still green bushes]2211-the still green bushes . Only one feathery outstretched arm of wild asparagus caught at [her]143-undine dress as [she]143-undine passed by and tore it , because [she]143-undine would not stay to loosen it , but hurried on angrily , petulantly . [She]143-undine was tired , [she]143-undine was wretched , [she]143-undine was disappointed .

To rush [the world]222-the world over seeking for happiness is [a fool]890-a fool 's work . Is it also [a fool]890-a fool 's to look for a life

which , however hard and rough , shall be high and noble , a life worth living ?

From being the useless plaything of [a man]3044-a man , from dressing and eating and lounging on sofas , to nursing [[another woman]3325-another woman 's children]2217-another woman 's children , to making [another woman]3325-another woman 's bed ! Will life 's changes be always so , shall [we]2207-we never get any higher ? Oh , the things of life are very little , and the soul is great .

[She]143-undine walked on till , just as the sun set , [she]143-undine reached the little kloof and , forcing [her]143-undine way through the rocks and trees , came to the bed of [the mountain torrent]2219-the mountain torrent . [She]143-undine clambered down [its]2219-the mountain torrent steep bank and leaped on to the smooth white sand that lined its bottom . Then [she]143-undine paused to take breath and leaned against one of the great dark boulders that lay about on every hand . Long years ago the rushing torrent had torn [them]2220-them down from [[their]2220-them home on [the mountain - side]2222-the mountain - side]2221-their home on the mountain - side , but [they]2220-them lay very quiet and unmovable now on [their]2220-them bed of white sand . Over one of [them]2220-them , a little higher up in the bed of the torrent , a tiny stream of water trickled . The drops as [they]2220-them fell down slowly on the face of the flat stones below had the soft silver sound of far - away evening bells , and everything else was very silent . The silver band of water as it crept through [the sand]569-the sand made no sound , and the long low tremulous bank of [maiden - hair fern]2224-maiden - hair fern , though it heaved and swayed to and fro in the stillness , made no sound . High on [the western bank of [the stream]2226-the stream]2225-the western bank of the stream against the white dreamy evening sky ,

the branches of the oliven 1 trees were visible , with pale , quivering , up - pointed leaves . All the dark trees around lay glittering and motionless , but the air stirred those pale green upward - pointing leaves till they shook against the still white night sky ; and on [Undine]143-undine , as [she]143-undine stood looking up at it , a great hush came and a great joy ; for heaven is not a long way off , nor the beautiful for which [we]2227-we thirst . [She]143-undine dropped the pinafores [she]143-undine held in [her]143-undine hand and knelt down on the smooth white sand , and when [she]143-undine rose , just above the treetops the first star was shining .

[She]143-undine washed out the pinafores and then walked back with [them]2220-them to [the wagon]2190-the wagon . [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps wondered that [she]143-undine sang so softly to [the baby]1556-the baby as [she]143-undine put it to sleep and sat half smiling in the firelight with only the remnants of [their]2230-their supper before [her]143-undine . " [She]143-undine 's [a fool]890-a fool and out of [her]143-undine senses , "[165-mrs. snappercaps] said [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps as [she]165-mrs. snappercaps leaned back against the wheel , munching the last biscuit . Aye , and [a fool]890-a fool sees more than [a wise man]2232-a wise man , sometimes .

1 Oliven wild olive .

[XVI]183-xvi . NEW RUSH

EVERY grace must come to an end , so philosophises [the hungry child]2233-the hungry child ; and even the dominion of [a Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps has a limit and a termination . [She]143-undine and [her]143-undine little soul and [her]143-undine little tortures may shut out all the great varied world for a little time ; [she]143-undine may seem to engulf everything for a little time , till all above , around , below is [Mrs. Snappercaps]165-mrs. snappercaps and [[her]165-mrs. snappercaps babies]2234-her babies ; but [land]2235-land must be gained at last , if it be only [the land of death]2236-the land of death .

For [Mr. Snappercaps]164-mr. snappercaps that [land]2235-land might be the only one in which [[his]164-mr. snappercaps poor good old soul]2238-his poor good old soul should find refuge ; but [Undine]143-undine 's deliverance came near at hand when [the white tents of [Du Toit 's Pan 1]39-du toit 's pan 1]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 came in sight , gathered like a flock of white birds round [their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 monster sandheap .

The next evening , free and emancipated , [she]143-undine stood before [a store in [New Rush]40-new rush , where [Mr. Snappercaps]164-mr. snappercaps had just unloaded [his]164-mr. snappercaps wires and buckets]2240-a store in new rush , where mr. snappercaps had just unloaded his wires and buckets . [She]143-undine felt very strong and very free as [she]143-undine stood there , with [her]143-undine box at [her]143-undine side and two shillings in [her]143-undine pocket , and

1 Du Toit 's Pan now [a suburb of [Kimberley]29-kimberley]2241-a suburb of kimberley .

watched [the wagon]2190-the wagon roll slowly up [the street]1739-the street and out of sight .

It was glorious to be alone again . Alone , though [the street]1739-the street was so thronged with [the streaming crowd of [niggers]2246-niggers and [diggers]2247-diggers returning [home]246-home from the work]2245-the streaming crowd of niggers and diggers returning home from the work that [they]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 kicked up the red sand into a lurid cloud over [their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 heads [stark - naked savages from the interior , with [their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 bent spindle legs and [their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 big - jawed foreheadless monkey - faces , who , though [they]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 were going [home]246-home to fire and meals]2249-stark - naked savages from the interior , with their bent spindle legs and their big - jawed foreheadless monkey - faces , who , though they were going home to fire and meals , could hardly get out of [their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 habitual crawl colonial niggers half dressed , not half civilized , and with some hundred per cent more of evil in [their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 black countenances than in those of [[their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 wilder brethren great muscular fellows , almost taller and stronger than [[their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 masters]2252-their masters]2251-their wilder brethren great muscular fellows , almost taller and stronger than their masters , [the white diggers , who formed a thin sprinkling in the crowd and who , in spite of the thick dust that enveloped [them]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 , might be distinguished by [their]2239-the white tents of du toit 's pan 1 more quick and energetic movements]2253-the white diggers , who formed a thin sprinkling in the crowd and who , in spite of the thick dust that enveloped them , might be distinguished by their more quick and energetic movements . [Undine]143-undine stood watching [the crowd]2254-the crowd as it rolled past , till the sound of [some one]312-some one closing the window just behind [her]143-undine made [her]143-undine look round . [A very swell nigger with a real gold chain and a black cloth suit]2256-a very swell nigger with a real gold chain and a black cloth suit was putting up the bars . [He]2256-a very swell nigger with a real gold chain and a black cloth suit was [a gentleman who made [his]2256-a very swell nigger with a real gold chain and a black cloth suit living principally at night , but [he]2256-a very swell nigger with a real gold chain and a black cloth suit found it useful to have some ostensible employment which might serve to account for [his]2256-a very swell nigger with a real gold chain and a black cloth suit gold chain and black cloth , if ever [he]2256-a very swell nigger with a real gold chain and a black cloth suit found [himself]2256-a very swell nigger with a real gold chain and a black cloth suit in the close hand of the law]2257-a gentleman who made his living principally at night , but he found it useful to have some ostensible employment which might serve to account for his gold chain and black cloth , if ever he found himself in the close hand of the law .

[She]143-undine asked whether [she]143-undine might leave [her]143-undine box there till the morning . " No , "[143-undine] was the prompt rejoinder , " not if [you]143-undine do n't give [me]143-undine a shilling . "[143-undine] [She]143-undine gave it , for it was impossible to carry it with [her]143-undine or yet to leave it there in [the street]1739-the street . [She]143-undine saw it safely deposited in [the store]2259-the store , and then walked off in search of a bed of some kind , nothing doubting but that [her]143-undine shilling would gain [her]143-undine a resting - place , if it were only a little square of hard ground in the corner of [a tent]2260-a tent . [She]143-undine went to [a greasy - looking yellow canvas house with some kind of sign over [it]2261-a greasy - looking yellow canvas house with some kind of sign over it , in front of which half a dozen men were lounging , in front of which [half a dozen men]2262-half a dozen men were lounging]2261-a greasy - looking yellow canvas house with some kind of sign over it , in front of which half a dozen men were lounging . In [the house]228-the house there was only [one woman]1463-one woman , very gaudily dressed and very florid , whose eyes [Undine]143-undine imagined saw right through [her]143-undine pocket and purse and beheld [the one poor shilling that lay there in solitude]2265-the one poor shilling that lay there in solitude . [She]143-undine wished [herself]143-undine out in [the street]1739-the street again , but it was too late now . " Can [I]143-undine get a bed here for tonight ? "[143-undine] [she]143-undine asked . " [She]3773-she 's [a bad one]3774-a bad one , "[837-the woman] thought [the woman]837-the woman , who , being one [herself]837-the woman , ought certainly to have judged rightly . " [You]143-undine can get a bed for four and six , "[837-the woman] [she]837-the woman said ; and [Undine]143-undine with [her]143-undine shilling made a very speedy exit .

Out in [the street]1739-the street once more , [she]143-undine plodded on through the wilderness of canvas , past round tents , [square tents]2269-square tents , torn tents , and [whole tents]2270-whole tents ; past [canvas

houses]2271-canvas houses and [wooden houses]2272-wooden houses and [iron houses]2273-iron houses , and non - descripts . There were places enough and [people]3030-people enough , but just no place for [her]143-undine . The fresh night breeze as it crept among [the tents]2275-the tents struck [her]143-undine chill and made [her]143-undine feel cold and heavy to [her]143-undine heart . [She]143-undine was now in [the poorest and most wretched part of [the camp which lay around [the Circus]41-the circus]2277-the camp which lay around the circus]2276-the poorest and most wretched part of the camp which lay around the circus , and was walking on slowly when an empty scotchcart , coming [home]246-home from [the Kop 1]2279-the kop 1 and tearing down [the street]1739-the street in the gathering darkness , caused [her]143-undine to step quickly out of [[its]2279-the kop 1 road]2281-its road and almost into [a small open tent]2282-a small open tent .

It was hardly dark yet but there was a candle alight in it , and at a great packing - case [a dark bright - eyed Malay woman]2283-a dark bright - eyed malay woman stood ironing white shirts . On another case close at [her]2283-a dark bright - eyed malay woman side , a heap of articles , still waiting to be done , lay piled . There was little else in [the room]239-the room except a torn red curtain covered with lions , which marked off [the sleeping - place]2285-the sleeping - place . On the floor sprawled [the woman]837-the woman 's brood , forming a motley forest of dusky arms and legs . [She]143-undine was so engrossed in [her]143-undine work that [she]143-undine did not notice [the intruder]2025-the intruder 's presence till [she]143-undine had wished [her]143-undine good evening , then [she]143-undine looked up quickly and curiously . " Could [you]931-woman tell [me]143-undine where [I]143-undine could get lodgings for tonight ? "[143-undine] inquired [Undine]143-undine when [her]143-undine salutation had been returned .

" No , not in [this part of [the Camp]3776-the camp]3775-this part of the camp , "[184-colesberg koppie] said [the

1 Colesberg Koppie]184-colesberg koppie , now [the Kimberley Diamond Mine]2288-the kimberley diamond mine .

[woman]931-woman ; then eyeing [her]143-undine sharply , " Have [yer]143-undine been long in [New Rush]40-new rush ? "[931-woman]

" No , "[143-undine] replied [Undine]143-undine . " [I]143-undine arrived this evening . "[143-undine] A pause followed , then [Undine]143-undine said : " Perhaps [you]931-woman would be so kind as to tell [me]143-undine where [I]143-undine might be able to get work . [I]143-undine should be very much obliged to [you]931-woman if [you]931-woman could . "[143-undine] " Work ? "[837-the woman] said [the woman]837-the woman . " There 's work enough if there were only hands to do it . What sort of work do [yer]143-undine want ? "[837-the woman] " Ironing any kind of work , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . " [I]143-undine do n't care what . "[143-undine] [The woman]837-the woman looked at the great pile of ironing on the case beside [her]837-the woman . [She]837-the woman must get it done that night though [she]837-the woman stood over it till morning . So [she]837-the woman said : " If [yer]143-undine can iron , [yer]143-undine can come in and help [me]837-the woman get these things done and stay [here]3208-here tonight , but [I]837-the woman ca n't give [yer]143-undine a bed ; [we]3778-we 've only one and that 's only sacks . "[837-the woman]

So [Undine]143-undine stepped into [the tent]3712-the tent , to pass [her]143-undine first night at [New Rush]40-new rush in ironing [gentlemen]2293-gentlemen 's pocket handkerchiefs and nightshirts , leaving the other shirts for the more experienced iron of [Mrs. Snods]185-mrs. snods , which glided over [them]2294-them with marvellous rapidity and ease , leaving no singe or crease in its track . By - and - by the noise and squalling of [the children]1821-the children ceased as one by one [they]1821-the children fell asleep on the ground or crept off to the sacks ; only [the eldest , whose occupation it was to carry the irons in and out]2296-the eldest , whose occupation it was to carry the irons in and out , remained awake .

[He]2297-his was [an over - worked , under - grown boy of about nine years]2298-an over - worked , under - grown boy of about nine years , with a very solemn face and a pair of squinting bead - like eyes that were always trying to see each other across [his]2297-his nose . [He]2297-his wore a narrow - brimmed crownless hat , from the top of which [his]2297-his curly black hair rose in a great bunch ; the tattered remains of a red tancord jacket and trousers covered [his]2297-his body ; on [his]2297-his feet [he]2297-his carried a solitary boot , whose sole was loose and , at every step , flapped solemnly as [he]2297-his passed in and out with the irons . When not so occupied [he]2297-his stood bolt upright before the packing - case , with [his]2297-his hands clasped in front of [him]2297-his , slowly twirling [his]2297-his thumbs , always in the same direction and always very regularly .

About twelve the last shirt was finished , and [Undine]143-undine , half asleep , crept into one of the great packing - cases and slept soundly till morning . When [she]143-undine awoke [she]143-undine found [the woman]837-the woman already busy putting fresh clothes into starch , and [Tommy]186-tommy just starting off with last night 's work . It was agreed that [Undine]143-undine was to remain [there]3010-there that day , and in consideration of [her]143-undine assistance was to get food and a bed in the packing - case that night . Before setting to work , however , [she]143-undine started off in search of [her]143-undine box . It was a real New Rush morning . The fresh air seemed thrilling with a life that even in [the close man - defiled camp]2301-the close man - defiled camp it could not be robbed of ; it crept among [the tents]2275-the tents and [houses]2194-houses and brought back for the moment the roses to the sunburnt sallow

faces of [the dirty children]2304-the dirty children , and made [Undine]143-undine feel brave and able to face anything . [She]143-undine was almost sorry when , after wandering about for a little while , [she]143-undine discovered [the store at which [her]143-undine box had been left]2305-the store at which her box had been left . Before it stood [a digger]2306-a digger examining some picks that had been placed outside and [a couple of naked niggers who were gazing affectionately at a row of guns]2307-a couple of naked niggers who were gazing affectionately at a row of guns . In the doorway leaned the swell nigger with [his]2308-his legs crossed , playing with [his]2308-his watch chain .

" [I]143-undine 've come for the box [I]143-undine left here yesterday evening , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . [The nigger]2309-the nigger pointed with [his]2309-the nigger thumb over [his]2309-the nigger shoulder . " There it is , "[2309-the nigger] [he]2309-the nigger said . [Undine]143-undine went in and saw it standing against the counter . " Is there anyone [here]3208-here [I]143-undine could get to carry it ? "[143-undine] [she]143-undine asked . " It 's not very heavy . "[143-undine] " No , "[2309-the nigger] said [the nigger]2309-the nigger . " Ca n't [you]2309-the nigger ? It 's not very far , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , holding out the shilling . [He]2309-the nigger took it without making any reply , and spreading out [his]2309-the nigger white handkerchief upon [his]2309-the nigger shoulder to prevent the nap from rubbing off [his]2309-the nigger coat , [he]2309-the nigger raised the trunk .

[Undine]143-undine led the way ; [he]2309-the nigger followed close behind ; but [they]2311-they had not gone very far when the sound of [his]2309-the nigger loudly creaking boots suddenly ceased , and looking round [she]143-undine was astonished to behold [her]143-undine box

depos- deposited

ited in the middle of [the street]1739-the street , and the tall black form of [the nigger]2309-the nigger disappearing round the corner .

" This is not [the place]3080-the place ; [you]2309-the nigger have made a mistake , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said .

[The nigger]2309-the nigger was not [a man of many words]2315-a man of many words , so [he]2309-the nigger merely screwed up one eye very tight and opened the other very wide , and walked off . [Undine]143-undine went back to [her]143-undine box and stood by it , looking at [the passers by]2316-the passers by , but none were available for [her]143-undine purpose . There were [troops of [niggers]2246-niggers going to work at [the Kop]49-the kop]2317-troops of niggers going to work at the kop , 1 and [sharp little diamond - buyers]2319-sharp little diamond - buyers going to look for the worm , 2 and [busy diggers]2320-busy diggers in a desperate hurry , with [their]2320-busy diggers sleeves rolled up above [their]2320-busy diggers elbows . To none of [them]2317-troops of niggers going to work at the kop could [she]143-undine apply . At last [a good stupid - looking Kaffir]2321-a good stupid - looking kaffir made [his]2321-a good stupid - looking kaffir appearance . [He]2321-a good stupid - looking kaffir had no bucket or pick and seemed to have nothing to do , and though [he]2321-a good stupid - looking kaffir stared stupidly at [her]143-undine English and broken Dutch , [he]2321-a good stupid - looking kaffir soon comprehended the meaning of the scarf [she]143-undine held out to [him]2321-a good stupid - looking kaffir ; and the trunk was shouldered once more , [Undine]143-undine taking care to walk behind [him]2321-a good stupid - looking kaffir . When [she]143-undine reached the tent [Tommy]186-tommy had just returned with three loaves of bread , and the solitary knife of which [the establishment]2322-the establishment boasted not being forthcoming , [Undine]143-undine opened [her]143-undine box and produced a handsome silver - mounted penknife . The bright black eyes of [the Malay woman]2323-the malay woman marked it eagerly , and marked also the rich red shawl that

1 Kop : an abbreviation for " [Colesberg Koppie]184-colesberg koppie "[143-undine] [the Mine]2324-the mine .

2 Presumably the " worm "[143-undine] that [the " early birds "]3781-the " early birds "[143-undine] were out to " catch . "[143-undine]

covered the contents of the box . [She]143-undine watched the knife as it cut the bread and watched it as it went back into the box , and then began ironing again . Presently [she]143-undine called to [Tommy]186-tommy to come out with [her]143-undine to the back of [the tent]3712-the tent and help [her]143-undine chop some wood . [Tommy]186-tommy went , but there was no sound of chopping , nor , when [they]2326-they came in a few moments after , was there any wood to be seen .

[Undine]143-undine , who was busy ironing , never noticed this ; something in one of [the children]1821-the children 's faces had reminded [her]143-undine of what lay in [a little English grave far over [the water]1409-the water]2328-a little english grave far over the water . [The woman]837-the woman began ironing , too , but presently [she]837-the woman stopped and , leaning both elbows on the table and fixing [her]837-the woman bright eyes on [[her]837-the woman companion]584-her companion 's face , [she]837-the woman said :

" [I]837-the woman 've been thinking that perhaps [yer'd]584-her companion like rather to get work on [yer]584-her companion own account ; if [yer]584-her companion would , why , [I]837-the woman knows [a Mr. MacCuligan who pays well , [he]187-mr. macculigan does , and [he]187-mr. macculigan 's not over - particular neither]187-mr. macculigan . [I]837-the woman would not give [him]187-mr. macculigan up , but , [yer]584-her companion see , [I]837-the woman 've got more work than [I]837-the woman can manage , as ' tis . [You]584-her companion see , [everybody]3528-everybody knows [me]837-the woman , that 's the thing ; [they]3528-everybody know that [I]837-the woman 'm [a honest woman]3783-a honest woman , would not touch a button . It 's the character as brings the work . If [nobody]3024-nobody knows [yer]584-her companion , why , [yer]584-her companion wo n't get a shirt to iron , "[837-the woman] said [the woman]837-the woman , still fixing [her]837-the woman bright eyes on [Undine]143-undine 's face .

[Undine]143-undine wondered , if that were the case , how [anyone]3037-anyone ever came to be known , but [she]143-undine answered that ,

until [she]143-undine got irons and a place of [her]143-undine own and knew something of ironing , it was useless for [her]143-undine to think of taking work .

" Oh , [yer]584-her companion could use some of [my]143-undine irons ; [I]143-undine 've got a lot [yer]584-her companion see ; and wood and such like [yer]584-her companion could pay for , [yer]584-her companion know , and [Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan [he]187-mr. macculigan do n't care how [his]187-mr. macculigan shirts are neither . "[143-undine]

Somehow [Undine]143-undine did not take vastly to this idea of doing [Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan 's ironing , but [she]143-undine felt touched by [the woman]837-the woman 's kindness ; [she]143-undine could not pain [her]837-the woman by refusing to take advantage of it . It was very hard to be [a stranger]2024-a stranger at [the Fields]1783-the fields , [the woman]837-the woman said ; [she]837-the woman had known what it was ; but when once [a person]2338-a person got known , why , there was more work than [they]2338-a person had hands for . " It 's an awful paying thing , ironing is , "[837-the woman] said [the woman]837-the woman , " awful paying . It 's as good as having a claim in [New Rush Kop]44-new rush kop , it is "[837-the woman] ; and when [she]143-undine saw [Undine]143-undine cast a glance round [the empty tattered tent]2340-the empty tattered tent [she]143-undine added quickly : " To [yer]186-tommy it would be , of course , [I]143-undine mean . [I]143-undine 've got [so many brats]3785-so many brats , what [I]143-undine makes goes . "[143-undine] After a little more conversation it was decided that [Undine]143-undine , with [Tommy]186-tommy for [a guide]2341-a guide , should set off to [Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan 's to fetch the ironing .

" It 's a long way , "[837-the woman] said [the woman]837-the woman , " and perhaps [yer'll]186-tommy think it round about , but the ways in [this Fields]32-the fields is round about . [Tommy]186-tommy , [he]186-tommy knows the way to[837-the woman]

[Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan 's well , [he]186-tommy does . Do n't [yer]143-undine , [Tommy]186-tommy ? "[186-tommy]

[Tommy]186-tommy nodded [his]186-tommy head very confidently and was soon pattering along [the road]1264-the road in front of [Undine]143-undine , the flying sole of [his]186-tommy boot flapping up and down at every step . [They]2344-they turned in the direction of [the West End]2345-the west end , and [Undine]143-undine , as [she]143-undine trudged behind [him]186-tommy , tried to be profoundly philosophical and to place before [herself]143-undine very clearly [her]143-undine own advanced ideas on the subject of labour . How superficial were the general ideas on the subject . Is not all work , if it be earnestly done , noble and ennobling ? Is not all labour worship , be it only scraping a carrot or ironing a shirt ? No longer would [she]143-undine be bound by prejudice , but , leading a life based on reason , [she]143-undine would enjoy the greatness of [the man who labours]2346-the man who labours .

[They]2344-they had now reached [the West End]2345-the west end , [that most desolate wilderness of gravel - heaps 1 and tents]2348-that most desolate wilderness of gravel - heaps 1 and tents , [the tents for the most part]2349-the tents for the most part not arranged with any attempt at order but forming acute and obtuse angles of every degree . [They]2344-they with [[their]2344-they gravel - heaps]2350-their gravel - heaps are pervaded by a melancholy air of decayed greatness . To [Undine]143-undine [it]2351-it seemed a more desolate spot than [the most barren plain of [the Karoo]17-the karoo]2352-the most barren plain of the karoo as [they]2344-they wandered in and out among [the gravel - heaps on which the

blaz- blazing
