ing sun was now pouring down dazzling light blue gravel - heaps and yellow gravel - heaps , new gravelheaps beside [tents]2354-tents , [old gravel - heaps]2355-old gravel - heaps , where once , in better days , [tents]2354-tents had been . Up them and down [them]2354-tents , over [them]2354-tents and round [them]2354-tents , before [them]2354-tents and behind [them]2354-tents , [their]2344-they course was like that of the wind which goeth to the south , and turneth to the north , and whirleth about continually .

" Are [you]2357-her dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before her sure this is [the right road]3786-the right road ? "[143-undine] [she]143-undine inquired of [[her]143-undine dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before [her]143-undine]2357-her dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before her . " It 's the way , "[2357-her dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before her] [he]2357-her dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before her answered confidently , turning [his]2357-her dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before her head but not [his]2357-her dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before her body , and with both eyes still fixed most solemnly on [his]2357-her dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before her nose ; " it 's the way . "[2357-her dilapidated little guide , who was trotting on steadily before her] So [Undine]143-undine plodded on . " Why , [I]143-undine thought [we]2358-we passed this tent with the barrel before it a little while ago ! Are [we]2358-we not almost at [Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan 's yet ? "[143-undine] [she]143-undine asked again after a little time . " It 's the way , "[186-tommy] said [Tommy]186-tommy , shaking [his]186-tommy head confidently three or four times , but not even looking round ; and soon [they]2358-we found [themselves]2358-we in [the Circular Road]47-the circular road .

[The Road]48-the road was lively and busy enough , and the glare of the sun on [the white road]2359-the white road was almost blinding . A scotchcart drawn by a wretched mule and containing a huge barrel of water rattled past [them]2358-we . It leaked , and [some ragged little savages , one white and the rest black]2360-some ragged little savages , one white and the rest black , were clinging to [the cart]2361-the cart with

[their]2360-some ragged little savages , one white and the rest black mouths wide open and upturned to catch the drops as [they]2360-some ragged little savages , one white and the rest black fell .

" Where can [I]143-undine get a drink of water ? "[143-undine] inquired [Undine]143-undine of [[her]143-undine guide]2362-her guide , the bright drops making [her]143-undine more thirsty than ever . " [You]143-undine can buy some at the well , "[186-tommy] was [Tommy]186-tommy 's answer . Buy some ! [Undine]143-undine walked on and tried to forget [she]143-undine was thirsty , and wondered what the charm of [these strange Fields]2363-these strange fields might be that drew all to [them]2363-these strange fields . " If [we]3787-we 're not near [Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan 's yet , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , " [I]143-undine think [I]143-undine shall turn back . [I]143-undine ca n't go on any more . "[143-undine] [She]143-undine was growing dizzy from the fierce heat of the sun , and the white tents seemed to throb before [her]143-undine , and the burning sand into which [they]2364-they sank ankle - deep at each step blistered [her]143-undine feet . " It 's the way , but [yer]143-undine do n't get there if [yer]143-undine do n't keep on , "[186-tommy] said [Tommy]186-tommy , looking back over [his]186-tommy shoulder but never pausing for an instant . [Undine]143-undine , fixing [her]143-undine eyes on the flapping sole of [his]186-tommy shoe , followed on . [They]2365-they were in [the best part of [the Camp]3776-the camp]2366-the best part of the camp now , where [tents]2354-tents were scarce and [pretty little canvas houses with verandas]2369-pretty little canvas houses with verandas and reed fences lined [the road on every side]2370-the road on every side . Before one of these [Tommy]186-tommy stopped . " There 's [Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan 's , "[186-tommy] [he]186-tommy said , " and [I]186-tommy 'll run round to the back and see if [he]187-mr. macculigan 's in . "[186-tommy]

While [Undine]143-undine stood waiting for [his]186-tommy return , [she]143-undine

leaned against the reed fence of [the house that stood at [her]143-undine right and looked over into [the enclosure]213-the enclosure]2371-the house that stood at her right and looked over into the enclosure . There was [a new canvas house with [a pretty veranda]2374-a pretty veranda , at the ends of which hung great Venetian blinds to keep off the sun and wind]2373-a new canvas house with a pretty veranda , at the ends of which hung great venetian blinds to keep off the sun and wind . On [the veranda]2375-the veranda were some green garden benches and two large cane armchairs . In one of [them]2376-them sat [a lady]1822-a lady , a delicate milk - white thing dressed in pale blue , with rippling gold hair that was simply gathered into a knot at the back of [her]1822-a lady small head . [Undine]143-undine looked at [her]1822-a lady breathlessly . [Women]346-women as beautiful , more beautiful , [she]143-undine had often seen , but [none]2379-none had ever looked to [her]143-undine as [that woman]1613-that woman did , contrasted with the coarse clay [she]143-undine had looked at for so many weeks , and contrasted with the boiling , toiling , sandy , grimy world around [them]346-women . [The lady]263-the lady 's white slender hands were crossed softly over the gamboge cover of the novel that lay in [her]263-the lady lap , and [she]263-the lady leaned back with closed eyes , looking like [some fairy queen whom a strange chance had transported into the land of dust and diamonds]2382-some fairy queen whom a strange chance had transported into the land of dust and diamonds . [Undine]143-undine leaned long against the fence , watching [her]1822-a lady till [she]143-undine slowly opened [her]143-undine eyes and looked up . [They]2383-they were straight - out - looking , cloudless baby - blue eyes ; there was not much expression in them when they fixed themselves on the head and battered hat that showed themselves over [her]143-undine fence ; but [Undine]143-undine limped away quickly and looked down at [her]143-undine own " bits of paws , "[2383-they] already brown and rough , and at [her]143-undine own dust - begrimed garments , and felt a little

ashamed of them . What are fine clothes , and a fine skin ? Well , nothing , just nothing , when [you]2384-you come to reason about them , and just everything when [you]2384-you come to look at them .

[Undine]143-undine limped away as quickly as might be to the back of [[Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan 's compound]2385-mr. macculigan 's compound , but when there [she]143-undine was astonished to find no opening by which [Tommy]186-tommy could have gained an entrance to make [his]186-tommy inquiries , and [no Tommy]2386-no tommy was to be seen . The fence was very high , but , mounting on a gravel heap that lay against it , [she]143-undine was able to look over . [A coolie]188-a coolie was squatting in the shade , cleaning a pair of boots . [Undine]143-undine inquired whether [he]188-a coolie had seen anything of [[her]143-undine guide]2362-her guide and whether [the compound]2388-the compound were [Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan 's . To both these questions [the coolie]2389-the coolie replied by shaking [his]2389-the coolie head and staring . Did [he]188-a coolie know where [Mr. MacCuligan]187-mr. macculigan lived ? [The coolie]2389-the coolie shook [his]2389-the coolie head again . Did n't live in [that part of [the Camp]3776-the camp]2391-that part of the camp . Did n't know [him]188-a coolie if [he]188-a coolie did . [Undine]143-undine dropped down on the ground in the shade of the high fence and held [her]143-undine throbbing head between [her]143-undine hands . [She]143-undine tried to think , but before [she]143-undine knew [she]143-undine had dropped into a heavy sleep .

When [she]143-undine awoke it was almost evening and the cool breeze was blowing in [her]143-undine face . [She]143-undine felt better after [her]143-undine sleep , though [her]143-undine feet were still blistered and [her]143-undine legs trembled a little . [She]143-undine made [her]143-undine way back into [the street]1739-the street , and after not many inquiries found [herself]143-undine once more in [the neighbourhood of [the

Circus]2395-the circus]2394-the neighbourhood of the circus , and was soon in sight of [the iron 1 canteen]2396-the iron 1 canteen , that [she]143-undine knew stood next [the tent [she]143-undine was in search of]2397-the tent she was in search of .

When [she]143-undine stood before [it]2396-the iron 1 canteen , [Undine]143-undine raised [her]143-undine hand to [her]143-undine forehead , for surely the terrible heat of the day had touched [her]143-undine reason . [She]143-undine looked and looked again . There was [the iron canteen]2398-the iron canteen on this side ; there was [[the shoemaker]2399-the shoemaker 's tent]2400-the shoemaker 's tent on the other ; but [the tent [she]143-undine looked for and the box [she]143-undine came for]2401-the tent she looked for and the box she came for were nowhere to be seen . [A good - natured man who stood at the door of [the canteen]2403-the canteen]2402-a good - natured man who stood at the door of the canteen noticed [her]143-undine bewilderment and called out : " If [you]143-undine 're looking for [the Malay woman who used to take in ironing]3788-the malay woman who used to take in ironing , [she]3788-the malay woman who used to take in ironing 's shifted early this morning . If [she]3788-the malay woman who used to take in ironing 's got work of [yours]143-undine there 's not much chance of [your]143-undine seeing it again , [I]486-the man 'm afraid . [She]3788-the malay woman who used to take in ironing was [a bad lot]3789-a bad lot , "[486-the man] said [the man]486-the man , stepping back into [[his]486-the man house]3254-his house to serve [a customer]2406-a customer . It took [her]143-undine a moment fairly to understand [her]143-undine situation , and then [she]143-undine soon persuaded [herself]143-undine that it was a most fortunate occurrence that had befallen [her]143-undine and freed [her]143-undine from [her]143-undine possessions . Were [they]2407-they not more trouble than they were worth ? And had not experience taught [her]143-undine a lesson which , as [that bitter dame]2408-that bitter dame teaches nothing for nothing , left [her]143-undine nothing to complain of ?

[She]143-undine began slowly to retrace [her]143-undine steps , thinking the while that [she]143-undine clearly perceived where [her]143-undine mistake had been . [She]143-undine had allowed [her]143-undine pride to keep [her]143-undine

1 Corrugated iron .

from [[her]143-undine own class]2409-her own class , from [the white - handed , silver - voiced people of refinement and polish]2410-the white - handed , silver - voiced people of refinement and polish that was the only reason why [she]143-undine had fared so ill .

With [that cool veranda]2411-that cool veranda and [its]2411-that cool veranda milk - white blossom in [her]143-undine eye , [she]143-undine pressed on through [the now crowded and busy evening streets]2412-the now crowded and busy evening streets till [she]143-undine came in sight of [it]2411-that cool veranda once more . Just as [she]143-undine had sat there in the morning , [the lady]263-the lady sat there now , only that [she]263-the lady had now a pure white dress , and in place of the gamboge - covered book [she]263-the lady held now a small china cup . A few rays of the setting sun had found their way under [the veranda]2375-the veranda and played on the rippling hair till it glittered like burnished gold . When [Undine]143-undine 's dusty figure and battered hat appeared before [her]143-undine , [she]143-undine raised [her]143-undine clear blue baby - eyes from [her]143-undine teacup and looked at [her]143-undine looked very straight , and said : " What do [you]143-undine want ? Work ? Yes , [I]143-undine have plenty of work . "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine 's eyes followed [her]143-undine tall graceful figure as it moved into [the house]228-the house . [She]143-undine returned in a moment with [a small child]220-a small child 's garment in [her]143-undine hand and held it out . " [You]143-undine can take this first , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " If it is well made [I]143-undine will give [you]143-undine two shillings for making it if it is well made , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said in a clear measured voice , and , without giving [the dusty little figure]2417-the dusty little figure before [her]143-undine a second glance , sank down into [her]143-undine chair and resumed [her]143-undine teacup .

[Undine]143-undine hesitated and spoke again , for work , without needle or thimble or cotton to do it with , would be small help . " [I]263-the lady will give [you]143-undine needles and cotton , if [you]143-undine wish it , "[263-the lady] [the lady]263-the lady said , " but not a thimble . [I]263-the lady never do that ; and sixpence must be taken off for the needle and cotton . "[263-the lady]

The little reed gate closed behind [Undine]143-undine , and soon [she]143-undine was again threading [her]143-undine way through [the crowded streets crowded with [home - goers]2420-home - goers]2419-the crowded streets crowded with home - goers . [They]2420-home - goers were all going to [a place of [their]2420-home - goers own]2421-a place of their own ; even [the naked Mahoras 1]2422-the naked mahoras 1 had a pot of mielie 2 pap and a skin waiting for [them]2420-home - goers ; but [she]143-undine wandered on till [she]143-undine found [herself]143-undine at [the entrance of [the Kop 3]2424-the kop 3 [they]2420-home - goers had just deserted]2423-the entrance of the kop 3 they had just deserted . [She]143-undine sat down to rest on the side of [one of the mountains of [gravel 4 between which the road]2426-gravel 4 between which the road passed]2425-one of the mountains of gravel 4 between which the road passed , and , when [the camp below]2427-the camp below was aglow with evening lights , and the noise and stir in [its tents and streets]2428-its tents and streets became louder and stronger , [she]143-undine rose up and walked into [the Kop]49-the kop in the bright moonlight . It was like entering [the city of the dead]2429-the city of the dead in [the land of]2430-the land of [the living]2431-the living , so quiet it was , so well did the high - piled gravel heaps keep out all sound of the seething noisy world around . Not a sound , not a movement . [She]143-undine walked to [the edge of [the reef]2433-the reef]2432-the edge of the reef and

[1 Natives]2434-1 natives .

2 Pap of ground maize .

3 [The Kop]49-the kop was [the actual site of [the mine]2324-the mine]2435-the actual site of the mine .

4 Dťbris .

looked down into [the crater]2437-the crater . 1 The thousand wires that crossed [it]2437-the crater , glistening in the moonlight , formed a weird , sheeny , mistlike veil over the black depths beneath . Very dark , very deep it lay all round the edge , but , high towering into the bright moonlight , rose the unworked centre . [She]143-undine crouched down at the foot of [the staging]2438-the staging and sat looking at it . In the magic of the moonlight it was [a giant castle]2439-a giant castle , [a castle of the olden knightly days]2440-a castle of the olden knightly days ; [you]2441-you might swear , as [you]2441-you gazed on [it]2439-a giant castle , that [you]2441-you saw the shadows of [its]2439-a giant castle castellated battlements , and the endless turrets that overcrowned [it]2439-a giant castle : [a giant castle]2439-a giant castle , lulled to sleep and bound in silence for a thousand years by the word of [some enchanter]2443-some enchanter . [You]2441-you might gaze until [you]2441-you almost saw the ivy clinging to [its]2439-a giant castle yellow crumbling walls , till [you]2441-you almost saw the figures of [brave knights]2444-brave knights and [lovely ladies , whom the death - like sleep]2445-lovely ladies , whom the death - like sleep had overtaken as [they]2445-lovely ladies , whom the death - like sleep wandered on [the castle terraces]2446-the castle terraces , till the motionless horse and the small arched window and the mighty dragon resting in the gateway were all visible .

[Undine]143-undine , as [she]143-undine crouched beneath [the staging]2438-the staging , looking at that silent moonlight wonder world , forgot [she]143-undine was hungry and forgot [she]143-undine was weary , and , when [she]143-undine grew drowsy , dropped asleep on the ground with [her]143-undine head resting on [her]143-undine work .

1 [The mine]2324-the mine was then worked by surface haulage . [This immense circular hole]2449-this immense circular hole is now claimed to be [the largest hole ever sunk into [the earth by]2451-the earth by [man]3103-man]2450-the largest hole ever sunk into the earth by man . The diamonds are found on a huge perpendicular pipe , not in [the reef surrounding]2453-the reef surrounding [it]2439-a giant castle .

The next morning the turning of the wheel 1 overhead aroused [her]143-undine . It was hardly light , but [the Kop]49-the kop wakes early , and there were [many men at work already among the staging]2454-many men at work already among the staging . [None of [them]2454-many men at work already among the staging]1521-none of them seemed to notice [her]143-undine , and [she]143-undine got up feeling a little stiff and a little cold . There was nothing of beauty about the scene before [her]143-undine now ; that had gone with the moonlight . It was nothing now but a great oval hole in the ground where worshippers of [King Gold]162-gold burrow and scrape and scratch , all in [his]3103-man service .

Very dull , and very prosaic now unless indeed [one had happened to be so high mounted above earth]2456-one had happened to be so high mounted above earth that all things fell into perspective , when even [Colesberg Kop]189-colesberg kop with its grovelling and grasping might , like [niggers]2246-niggers and blue - bottle flies and rouge pots , have a charm , a beauty of its own .

But [Undine]143-undine was not high mounted nor was [her]143-undine soul inclined to soar that morning ; rather to grovel very pitiably . [She]143-undine was cold , [she]143-undine was stiff , [she]143-undine was hungry , and [she]143-undine held the creed of the hungry that ideas are a delusion and sentiments a snare , that the way of [the world]222-the world is the wise way and leads to bread and butter , and that all ways which lead elsewhere are inventions of the devil and must be forsaken . [She]143-undine made [her]143-undine way into [Main Street]50-main street , and as [she]143-undine turned the corner [she]143-undine saw [a great naked nigger]2459-a great naked nigger devouring a huge lump of mielie - meal pap which [he]2459-a great naked nigger held in both hands as [he]2459-a great naked nigger passed down [the street]1739-the street on

1 A haulage wheel on [the rim of [the mine]2324-the mine]2461-the rim of the mine .

[his]2459-a great naked nigger way to work . [She]143-undine thought [him]2459-a great naked nigger the happiest soul [she]143-undine had passed that morning as [she]143-undine walked on looking for a place where [she]143-undine might sit down and work .

No such presented itself till [she]143-undine found [herself]143-undine free of tents and houses on [the long low grassy ridge that separated [New Rush]40-new rush from [Du Toit 's Pan]39-du toit 's pan 1]2463-the long low grassy ridge that separated new rush from du toit 's pan . There [she]143-undine sat down , screened by the low scraggy bushes , and began to work . [She]143-undine stitched as [one stitches who stitches for bread]2464-one stitches who stitches for bread , but the calico was stiff , and without a thimble the needle hardly went through , and it made long stitches and little ones , and worked a small hole in [her]143-undine finger which stained the work with little drops of blood . Yet [she]143-undine worked away , without pausing , for an hour , then [she]143-undine sat still for a moment and lay down upon [the ground]2126-the ground . It was so strong and drawing , [that earth]2466-that earth ; [she]143-undine stretched out both [her]143-undine hands and clung to it as [she]143-undine used when [a little child]703-a little child , as [we]2468-we can cling only when [we]2468-we are weary and heartsick and lonely , as [we]2468-we must cling to something if it be only a tree stump or a stone , feeling as if [we]2468-we were not then so forsaken .

It was a bright warm morning , but [she]143-undine was cold from hunger , and underneath the ground it must be warm , so warm . [The earth]920-the earth , the dear old earth that has been mother to [us]2468-we all and must cover [us]2468-we all again sooner or later it would be so easy to

drop asleep upon it , so much better than to go on living with nothing worth living for .

" [I]143-undine will die , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine thought . " Why should [I]143-undine go on like [a fool]890-a fool , labouring and striving to keep a life that is worthless ? [I]143-undine will lie still and die . "[143-undine] [She]143-undine turned [her]143-undine face round and looked at the grass on which [she]143-undine lay . Mingled with it were tiny blue and red bells and a bright creeper with yellow flowers . The sunshine came through the low bushes and danced on their golden faces , and up above the bushes [she]143-undine could see the clear blue sky .

It is not all dark , it is not all evil in this life ; while the sky hangs overhead and the many - tinted earth lies at [our]2468-we feet , there will always be what is beautiful , always be what makes life worth the battle ; and [her]143-undine heart grew strong again . Very empty life may be , very useless , but worth having while there is sunshine .

Hour after hour [Undine]143-undine sat there stitching , and the work became more stained and the stitches bigger and [her]143-undine hands trembled more . At last by mid - day it was finished . [She]143-undine rolled [it]2470-it up and sought [her]143-undine way back to [the canvas house]2471-the canvas house with [its]2471-the canvas house cool veranda and green Venetian blinds . [The lady]263-the lady was inside and opened the door , looking as fresh and fleecy - white as [she]263-the lady had done the day before . [She]263-the lady took the work from [Undine]143-undine and examined it carefully .

" [I]263-the lady do n't take such work , "[263-the lady] [she]263-the lady said , raising [her]263-the lady round baby - blue eyes to [Undine]143-undine 's face . " [You]143-undine must[263-the lady]

take it back and unpick it carefully and wash it , or if [you]143-undine wish [you]143-undine can leave it [here]3208-here ; but of course [I]0-i ca n't pay [you]143-undine for it . It is for [a bazaar]2474-a bazaar and should have been kept very clean . "[2475-they]

[They]2475-they were so pitiless , those baby - blue eyes . [Undine]143-undine felt the tears starting to [her]143-undine own ; so without giving any answer [she]143-undine turned round quickly and went out again to [the hot sandy street]2476-the hot sandy street . As bad as [a beggar]2477-a beggar ! Crying for sixpence ! Faugh ! [She]143-undine hated [herself]143-undine . [She]143-undine had undertaken to do the work , [she]143-undine had done it badly , [she]143-undine had got what [she]143-undine deserved . Besides , was it not for [a bazaar]2474-a bazaar that was to pay for [a church]2479-a church ? There should be no stains or long stitches in work intended for such a purpose . [She]143-undine was in fault , [no one else]253-no one else .

" Old clothes bought [here]3208-here , "[837-the woman] was written in large letters on a piece of battered cardboard that hung at the door of [a little wooden house]2481-a little wooden house . [Undine]143-undine noticed it and went in . [She]143-undine had nothing to sell but a fine white handkerchief , for which [the woman]837-the woman gave [her]143-undine sixpence , which at [the next shop]2483-the next shop [she]143-undine exchanged for a drink of water and a small piece of bread , such a small piece . When [she]143-undine sat down on the shady side of some gravel heaps that lay behind [the houses]2083-the houses , [she]143-undine held it in [her]143-undine hand and sat looking at it for a long time before [she]143-undine began to eat . [She]143-undine had felt so hungry in the morning , [she]143-undine could have made [friends]1102-friends with [the naked Kaffir]190-the naked kaffir for the sake of

[his]2486-his mielie - meal pap ; and now [she]143-undine sat there with the lump of bread in [her]143-undine hands and could hardly eat it . Slowly breaking off little bits of crust here and there , [she]143-undine got through half , and with the remainder still in [her]143-undine hand laid [her]143-undine head drowsily on the gravel and for half an hour lay there almost sleeping , but hearing always the rumbling of [the carts]2487-the carts as [they]2487-the carts passed in [the street]1739-the street . When [she]143-undine aroused [herself]143-undine [she]143-undine felt gnawingly hungry and very glad of the bread , which [she]143-undine still ate very slowly to make it go the farther .

Not far from [her]143-undine , crouching on the ground with [his]2486-his head between [his]2486-his paws , was a great brown dog ; surely the leanest and lankest that walked [New Rush]40-new rush . While [she]143-undine had slept [he]2486-his had crouched there , watching the piece of bread in [her]143-undine hand , and now with half - closed eyes [he]2486-his looked at it still . [Undine]143-undine looked at it too and then at [him]2486-his , and then took another bite , and then looked at [him]2486-his again , and then at the bread in [her]143-undine lap ; and feeling sure that if [she]143-undine waited it would not be there much longer , [she]143-undine took it up and threw it from [her]143-undine straight into the hungry jaws that were opened wide to receive it .

Almost without a gulp it was gone , and , resuming [his]2486-his old posture , the dog waited for more , but none came . Picking up the crumbs that lay in [her]143-undine lap , [she]143-undine rose to go . The dog sprang up too , and , sidling nearer to [her]143-undine , proceeded to perform around [her]143-undine

a grotesque dance , at every step of which the sharp bones threatened to protrude through the brown skin .

When [she]143-undine walked away [he]2486-his tried to follow [her]143-undine , but [she]143-undine drove [him]2486-his from [her]143-undine again and again . " Go away , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " Go away . Do not follow [me]143-undine . If [you]2486-his do [I]143-undine shall learn to love [you]2486-his , and [I]143-undine am tired ; [I]143-undine have had pain enough . "[143-undine] The afternoon light was beginning to grow old and yellow when [Undine]143-undine , passing among [the tents at [the North Side]2490-the north side]2489-the tents at the north side , was attracted by [a small figure seated on the ground between [two tents]2492-two tents]2491-a small figure seated on the ground between two tents . ' Twas [a child of it]2493-a child of it might be twelve years . [She]143-undine was leaning back against an old box , with [her]143-undine naked feet stretched out in front of [her]143-undine , and the afternoon sun looked full into [her]143-undine face and on the great shock of red hair that hung around it . [Everyone else Undine]2494-everyone else undine had passed had seemed so hard at work and so engrossed , even [the little children]2495-the little children in [their]2495-the little children play and [the women]1520-the women in [their]1520-the women talk ; but here sat [some one alone]2497-some one alone and doing nothing except gazing down at the half of an old iron three - legged pot which [she]143-undine held in [her]143-undine lap . [Undine]143-undine came near [her]143-undine . " What have [you]143-undine got there ? "[143-undine] [she]143-undine asked , softly .

[The girl]630-the girl raised [her]630-the girl head quickly and looked up . It was [a broad freckled face with very little forehead , and that little wrinkled and knit in every

direction , with a great heavy mouth and a pair of clear grey eyes]2499-a broad freckled face with very little forehead , and that little wrinkled and knit in every direction , with a great heavy mouth and a pair of clear grey eyes .

Before [she]143-undine answered [Undine]143-undine [she]143-undine fixed them on [her]143-undine , and then said in a low , sullen tone , " Looking at [my]143-undine plant . "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine stooped down and saw , surely enough , growing in the broken pot , the tiniest of rose slips not half an inch high and crowned with two tiny green leaves . " Do [you]143-undine like flowers ? "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine asked . " Yes . "[143-undine] For a moment the sullen look vanished and a smile that parted the heavy lips showed a set of dazzling white teeth ; then it settled down on [the child]223-the child 's face again and [she]143-undine looked at [her]143-undine pot . " It 's the first flower [I]143-undine have seen growing here , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , touching it softly with [her]143-undine finger . " [A gentleman]3792-a gentleman threw it away one day . [It]3793-it had a withered rose on it then ; but [I]143-undine put a white bottle over it , and [I]143-undine hold it in the sun all day , and now it 's growing , [you]223-the child see . "[143-undine] [She]143-undine touched its little leaves softly and caressingly with [her]143-undine finger as [she]143-undine spoke . " Do n't [you]143-undine get very tired of sitting still with it all day ? "[143-undine] asked [Undine]143-undine . A very black look came over [the child]223-the child 's face as [she]143-undine answered shortly , " [I]143-undine ca n't walk ; [my]143-undine back 's hurt . "[143-undine] " And so [you]143-undine sit here alone all day nursing [your]143-undine flower . "[143-undine]

" Mostly , but sometimes [the woman who stops with [father]880-father]3794-the woman who stops with father do n't always go out . [I]223-the child wish [she]3794-the woman who stops with father always did . When [mother]1559-mother was [here]3208-here [she]3794-the woman who stops with father always stayed in , but [she]3794-the woman who stops with father 's dead , "[223-the child] said [the child]223-the child . There was infinite satisfaction in the tone in which the last three words were uttered . " Have [you]143-undine been long unable to walk ? "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , laying [her]143-undine hand softly on the red head . " Since [she]3794-the woman who stops with father beat [me]143-undine the night before [she]3794-the woman who stops with father died . "[143-undine] [She]143-undine spoke more sullenly than ever and twitched [her]143-undine little brown toes backwards and forwards . " What do [you]143-undine do to try and get better ? "[143-undine] " Nothing , "[223-the child] said [the child]223-the child . " One of [those gentlemen that go about with the little black bags and the sugar pills]3798-those gentlemen that go about with the little black bags and the sugar pills , [he]3794-the woman who stops with father stopped and talked to [me]223-the child one day and [he]3794-the woman who stops with father gave [me]223-the child something to rub with , but [I]223-the child ca n't rub it and there is [no one]406-no one can . "[223-the child] " Ca n't [I]223-the child rub it for [you]143-undine ? "[223-the child] [The child]223-the child looked up half suspiciously , then [her]143-undine eyes brightened a little . " It 's in [the tent]3712-the tent , and [Mary Jones]191-mary jones would be angry if [anyone]3037-anyone went in when [she]191-mary jones 's gone out . Do [you]143-undine live far from [here]3208-here ? "[143-undine] " [I]143-undine do n't live anywhere , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . " [I]223-the child am looking for work . "[223-the child] [The child]223-the child scrutinized [her]143-undine from head to foot , with [the shrewd suspicious old woman]2506-the shrewd suspicious old woman 's look that the faces of [Field children]2507-field children so soon learn to wear . Then [she]143-undine said :

" What kind of work ? "[143-undine] " Anything ironing . "[143-undine] [She]143-undine would have added , " Needlework , "[143-undine] but a short experience had made [her]143-undine very wise , and [she]143-undine knew that [a man]3044-a man 's dog is an animal more enviable than [[a woman]374-a woman 's friend]2510-a woman 's friend if so be the one is [mistress]2511-mistress and [the other maid]2512-the other maid . Needlework must be done for [women]346-women , ironing might be for [men]710-men , so [she]143-undine decided in favour of the ironing . [[Her]143-undine red - headed little companion]2515-her red - headed little companion meditated for a time , then [she]2515-her red - headed little companion said , " [Mary Jones]191-mary jones has lots of ironing in [the tent]3712-the tent , and [she]191-mary jones always drinks too much to do it . If [you]3804-you stay till [she]191-mary jones comes [I]2515-her red - headed little companion think [she]191-mary jones 'll let [you]3804-you get some . So [Undine]143-undine sat down on the ground beside [her]191-mary jones and waited .[2515-her red - headed little companion]

XVII . LITTLE IRONS

SIX months after , [Undine]143-undine stood in [[her]143-undine own little tent]2516-her own little tent , sorting and piling into heaps the ironing [she]143-undine had just finished .

' Twas a New Rush winter 's morning ; in the blue sky there was not a cloud , and if it was cold and numbing in the inside of [tents]2354-tents and on the shady side of gravel - heaps , out in the sunshine it was warm and genial .

[She]143-undine was hurrying to get out into it , and truly to impartial eyes there was nothing very alluring in the interior of [the little tent]2518-the little tent . ' Twas [a small place , six feet by eight , and held three packing - cases]2519-a small place , six feet by eight , and held three packing - cases . The largest was a table , covered over with shirts . [The second]2520-the second was a bed ; [it]2520-the second had low sides which lay flat on the ground and served to keep off the wind which at night blew in chill under the skirting . The smallest had a kind of tick ; it was a desk and general repository . [It]2518-the little tent did not lock , but that mattered less , as its only contents were paper scribbled over and clothes that would not have paid [a Kaffir]190-the naked kaffir the time it took to steal them . [It]2516-her own little tent was [an empty place]2521-an empty place , and cheerless it would have looked to other eyes ; but to

[Undine]143-undine not a yellow water stain in the canvas nor a mark in the cracked poles , nor a knot in the rough cases but had its own story , and a pleasant familiar face showed itself in each of them . Even the old black bottle stood in the corner made [home]246-home , more [home]246-home . [She]143-undine might have changed it now for a candlestick , but so many pleasant thoughts hung round its old black neck that the bottle kept its ground .

Placing on a tray one of the piles of ironing , and putting on the huge white kappie which had replaced the battered silk hat and very much added to the respectability of [the ironing woman]2524-the ironing woman , [she]143-undine went out into the sunshine , buttoning down the door after [her]143-undine .

[The tent]3712-the tent stood in [a quiet corner of [the Camp]3776-the camp on [the outskirts of [the North End]2529-the north end]2528-the outskirts of the north end]2526-a quiet corner of the camp on the outskirts of the north end . [The only very near neighbours]2530-the only very near neighbours were [a family of Dutch Boers who camped on the right]2531-a family of dutch boers who camped on the right . On all other sides [it]3712-the tent was surrounded by low gravel - heaps , 1 among which [the tent]3712-the tent nestled like a white bird in a yellow nest , as [Undine]143-undine said when describing it to [[her]143-undine little broken - backed friend]2533-her little broken - backed friend .

[She]143-undine went to visit [her]143-undine this morning before taking [her]143-undine work to its destination , and found [her]143-undine basking in the warmth at the back of [the tent]3712-the tent , a veritable Diogenes , with only [her]143-undine head and shoulders sticking out of the great tub in which [she]143-undine had ensconced [herself]143-undine .

1 Dťbris .

In answer to [[her]143-undine visitor]1434-her visitor 's look of inquiry , [she]143-undine said , " [The ground]2126-the ground 's so wet [I]143-undine ca n't lie on it , and in here it 's so nice . [I]143-undine can rock from side to side . Just see ! "[143-undine] And [she]143-undine put the tub in motion , leaning heavily first on one elbow and then on the other . " And the rose ? "[143-undine] " Oh , it 's all right , but it seems as though spring would never come , "[630-the girl] said [the girl]630-the girl , touching with [her]630-the girl thick little forefinger the still leafless and brown slip that stood in the side of the old three - legged pot . " [You]143-undine only stayed such a little while yesterday , [you]143-undine must not go soon today , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said ; and [Undine]143-undine put down [her]143-undine tray and sat down on the ground beside [her]143-undine . " [I]143-undine ca n't stay very long today , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " [I]143-undine must try and find [the owner of those shirts]3806-the owner of those shirts . Three months ago they were brought [me]143-undine , and [no one]406-no one has ever called for them ; [I]143-undine am afraid [the person to whom they belong]3808-the person to whom they belong must be poor and need [them]3809-them , they are so fine and so old and worn . "[143-undine] " [He]3806-the owner of those shirts 's waited so long , [he]3806-the owner of those shirts wo n't mind waiting a little longer , "[630-the girl] said [the girl]630-the girl , resting [her]630-the girl head in [[her]630-the girl companion]584-her companion 's lap and looking up into [her]143-undine face with [her]143-undine clear grey eyes . " Tell [me]143-undine what [you]143-undine wrote about last night , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said .

[Undine]143-undine 's hand rested on the same great shock of wild red hair , and the broad freckled face that looked up at [hers]143-undine was the same that six months

before [she]143-undine had seen for the first time ; yet it resembled that face only as a face awake resembles the same face asleep . It was like a dark room into which the sunshine had looked .

" [I]143-undine did not write anything , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , as [she]143-undine passed [her]143-undine finger tenderly along the lines in the low forehead ; " [I]143-undine was so tired [I]143-undine went to sleep with the pen in [my]143-undine hand , and when [I]143-undine woke the candle had quite burnt out . "[143-undine] " Sometimes , not often ; but yesterday evening , when [I]223-the child was putting the collars into starch , a little story came to [me]223-the child that seemed beautiful then , though it does not now . " [Death]192-death was very tall and calm and [his]192-death face was smooth and white , like a face cut out of marble ; [his]192-death[143-undine]

eyelids were half closed and in the eyes beneath them lay the shadows of wonderful dreams . Round [him]2540-his was a mantle of many cold grey tints , and [his]2540-his wings were folded close against [his]2540-his side .

" Now [Life]193-life was very beautiful ; [her]193-life hair was like the yellow glory of the sunset , and [her]193-life limbs were strong and soft and round , and [her]193-life breast was as white as an open lily . [She]193-life was very beautiful ; but[193-life]

[You]0-i have gained all that ; surely [you]0-i are blessed . It is true [you]0-i have paid something for it a little some pleasure , the rest of a few[0-i]

thou- thousand

sand nights , [the woman [you]0-i loved]2614-the woman you loved but what is that ! [Many]2615-many pay all that and die in a garret , or on a dung - heap . [You]0-i are blessed!í

" "[0-i] If that were all , then better never have been born , í said [the great man]3892-the great man , bitterly . " [They]3895-the high and noble write of [me]3892-the great man in [their]3895-the high and noble papers ; [I]3892-the great man never read [their]3895-the high and noble praises now . [[My]3892-the great man house]3899-my house is better why should [I]3892-the great man go to [theirs]3895-the high and noble ! [Fair women]3897-fair women come to see [me]3892-the great man what are [fair women to [me]3892-the great man]3901-fair women to me ! [They]3897-fair women only disturb [me]3892-the great man with [their]3897-fair women childish chatter ; and sometimes , if [they]3897-fair women have blue eyes Ha ! if that were all , better to have died a baby.í "[3892-the great man] [The phantom]2610-the phantom leaned [his]2610-the phantom hands upon [his]2610-the phantom knees and leered across the firelight .

" "[2610-the phantom] What has it been for then ? All this battling , all this striving , all this heartache ? Surely it has not been for nothing?í

" "[3892-the great man] No , í said [the great man]3892-the great man ; " it has not been for nothing . [The man who looks for happiness in this life]3902-the man who looks for happiness in this life is [a fool]890-a fool . [I]3892-the great man live for the future . [I]3892-the great man would be immortal . Immortal!í[3892-the great man]

" [The phantom]2610-the phantom leaned back in [his]2610-the phantom armchair and laughed till the silvered tassel of [his]2610-the phantom red cap trembled again in the firelight ![3892-the great man]

" "[3892-the great man] Immortal ! [I]0-i thought [you]2610-the phantom were [a great man]2619-a great man , yet [you]2610-the phantom juggle with this word immortal , like the rest of [[your]2610-the phantom kind]2620-your kind . What do [you]2610-the phantom mean by it now ? That [your]2610-the phantom name shall live after [you]2610-the phantom are dead ? Well , if that is all [you]2610-the phantom seek , [you]2610-the phantom shall have it . [They]2621-they will give [you]2610-the phantom a grand funeral , and write of [you]2610-the phantom in papers

bordered deep with black , and for a few days , [a very few]2622-a very few , [everyone]375-everyone will speak of [you]2610-the phantom . But there will be [no woman to wear one flower the less]2624-no woman to wear one flower the less in [her]2624-no woman to wear one flower the less hair , and [no man to drink one glass less of wine]2625-no man to drink one glass less of wine , because [you]2610-the phantom died that morning . [You]2610-the phantom are [a great man]2619-a great man , [a very great man]2627-a very great man , so perhaps [they]2621-they will raise a statue of [you]2610-the phantom , and for a few hundred years , now and then , [some one]312-some one will speak of [you]2610-the phantom , oftenest in praise at first , oftenest in blame at last ; for to [men of the new ideas and the new light]2629-men of the new ideas and the new light [the great men of old]2630-the great men of old look very small . Immortal ! Ha ! Ha ! Who are [you]2610-the phantom ? What are you?í laughed [the phantom]2610-the phantom . " A paltry two thousand years has dimmed the radiance of [[her]2624-no woman to wear one flower the less redeemers]3905-her redeemers and [prophets]3906-prophets ; how long do [you]2610-the phantom think [earth]651-earth will remember you?í[2610-the phantom]

" [The phantom]2610-the phantom laughed again and looked into the fire : "[2610-the phantom] That coal that is burning there : Five million years ago or so it was a great tree growing in [the green old forests]2632-the green old forests . Perhaps [it]2633-it thought it was to be immortalised immortalised into coal . And so it was , for five million years ; but in five minutes it will be ashes now . In five million years where will [you]2610-the phantom be ? Immortal Ha ! Ha ! Ha!í laughed [the phantom]2610-the phantom . " [Fool]3383-fool ! [Fool]3383-fool ! Fool!í[2610-the phantom]

" With [his]0-i hands clasped over [his]0-i face and [his]0-i head bowed down to [his]0-i knees , [the old man]624-the old man sat . " Three days later [the great man]3892-the great man died , and [the[2635-they]

noble and the great]3913-the noble and the great followed [him]0-i to [his]0-i grave , and [they]2635-they wrote of [him]0-i in [their]2635-they papers . [They]2635-they said , " Weep , weep , for [a great man]2619-a great man is dead ; weep , weep!í But for all that , [no one]406-no one wept . " Then [Life]193-life dropped [her]193-life lids for a moment . "[2635-they] " And [I]1601-the mother have rest , í said [Death]192-death . "[1601-the mother] And [the mother]1601-the mother would have given [him]0-i [[her]1601-the mother child]1724-her child , but [Life]193-life said : " Look again , once more;í and [the mother]1601-the mother looked for the last time . "[193-life] It was four o'clock in the morning , and beside a table , with [his]0-i forehead resting in [his]0-i two hands , [a man]3044-a man was sitting . The candle was almost burnt out , and soon it would be time for [him]0-i to go out to [his]0-i day 's work ; for all day [he]0-i stood behind a counter , selling yards of print and muslin to [the ladies that came in]2639-the ladies that came in . " [The other clerks]3918-the other clerks called [him]0-i [fool]3383-fool ; if [they]3918-the other clerks had known how [his]0-i nights were spent [they]3918-the other clerks would have called [him]0-i so more often . When [their]3918-the other clerks day 's work was over [they]3918-the other clerks went out to amuse [themselves]3918-the other clerks , but [he]0-i only shut [himself]0-i up in [[his]0-i room]1917-his room and walked up and down and prayed and wrote [himself]0-i half mad before the morning came .[0-i]

" It was well there was no living thing to see [him]0-i but the little brown mouse that looked out of its hole and wished it could have nibbled at the candle .[2640-she]

But the candle stood safe and did nothing but devour the bits of paper scribbled over with songs that were always being put to [her]2640-she . [She]2640-she had just devoured two great blue pages , on which was much of such hot talk as comes from young pens at four o'clock in the morning .

" [She]2640-she would get no more , however , for the pen was lying under the table , and [the man]486-the man looked very disconsolate as [he]486-the man sat beside it . "[2640-she] If [he]2641-he had written anything just now , it would have been : " Yes , [I]2641-he 'm [a great fool]3352-a great fool , as [they]3918-the other clerks say . Let [us]3923-us eat and drink , for tomorrow [we]3923-us die . Let [us]3923-us do as [the sheep]3924-the sheep do ; [they]3924-the sheep only are wise . [Beauty]194-beauty is an angel that [no man]3304-no man ever caught ; truth is a deception that changes to falsehood while [you]3926-you finger it . [We]3923-us are shadows among shadows . Why be so in earnest ? Why make [oneself]3927-oneself so hot about it all ? Why strive and pray and make so great a bluster ? Life is n't worth it . Something , nothing , here , gone ; let [us]3923-us make the best of it , wear the nicest clothes , eat the nicest meat , and love the easiest love , and believe what comes to hand ; tread on , steady and safe , step by step , in the narrow sandy path [[our]3923-us fathers]3928-our fathers cleared from stones and bushes long ago . If this can not be , why , curse life and die it is the best thing left.í "[2641-he] So [he]2641-he thought then , for [he]2641-he was weary , and threw [himself]2641-he down on [his]2641-he bed . Perhaps [he]2641-he slept , but [his]2641-he eyes were heavy and red the next morning as [he]2641-he stood behind the counter , selling ribbons and prints .

" So [this poor clerk]3929-this poor clerk went on , month after month , praying and writing all night and measuring off dresses by [the yard]324-the yard all day ; but at last it happened that one of [his]2641-he dreams took a human shape , and a pair of clear still eyes looked into [his]2641-he life and made [him]2641-he richer than [the great princes of [the Golden Isles]3932-the golden isles]3931-the great princes of the golden isles , whose [houses and whose shoes are covered with jewels]3933-houses and whose shoes are covered with jewels . It was true , as [men]710-men speak , that the eyes belonged not to [him]2641-he but to [a woman who was nothing to [him]2641-he a woman who was high above [him]2641-he and who would surely be carried , some day , to [[another man]3936-another man 's home]3937-another man 's home]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home . Yet when [he]2641-he was beside [her]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home [she]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home spoke to [him]2641-he kindly , and in [her]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home face [he]2641-he found the beauty in [her]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home mind , the truth [he]2641-he dreamed of . [He]2641-he knew that [she]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home was [his]2641-he though [she]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home did not love [him]2641-he , for [he]2641-he loved [her]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home , and [no one]406-no one could ever take [her]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home from [him]2641-he , not [she]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home [herself]3935-a woman who was nothing to him a woman who was high above him and who would surely be carried , some day , to another man 's home . "[2642-he] [He]2642-he heard at last that [she]2643-her was going to be married , and then [he]2642-he left [the town]2005-the town and went far , far away , and for a little time there was a heavy aching at [his]2642-he heart all day as [he]2642-he stood behind the counter or sat alone in [[his]2642-he silent room]2645-his silent room . But at last the aching went , and there was only gladness left . [He]2642-he had not [her]2643-her body , it was true , but [her]2643-her beautiful soul was living somewhere and it was true and real , and [the earth]920-the earth was never again quite empty for [him]2642-he .

" The years passed on , and [they]3939-they still called [him]2642-he [a fool]890-a fool , for [he]2642-he made no money . [He]2642-he never stayed long enough in any place , but wandered on from [town]2075-town[443-a child]

to [town]2075-town and [land to land]2648-land to land , just when the longing seized [him]2642-he . Sometimes [a child]443-a child 's face , or a reach of [sea beach]2650-sea beach , or the charm of [snow - crowned mountains]2651-snow - crowned mountains made [him]2642-he pause a little , but having got all [they]2652-they had to give , [he]2642-he wandered on again .

" [He]2642-he made no money and [no friends]1159-no friends , [this poor fool of [a clerk]3944-a clerk]3943-this poor fool of a clerk . Only sometimes , when pain or sorrow would draw [people]3030-people to [him]2642-he , [they]3030-people would enter [his]2642-he life for a little time ; but when [they]3030-people were comforted [they]3030-people would go out of it again , and [he]2642-he would go on with [his]2642-he wanderings and sing [his]2642-he songs and smile and love [the beautiful green old earth]3946-the beautiful green old earth . "[2642-he] Sometimes [his]2642-he songs were sad , but oftener [they]2652-they were glad , for it did not take much to make [him]2642-he happy a little stream of sunlight breaking in through the goods within the window , or the shadows which the trees cast as [he]2642-he passed below [them]2653-them on [his]2642-he way to work or to lie on the grass on Sunday morning and watch the rippling in the pool of water ; that was enough to make life sweet to [him]2642-he so sweet that , when the death [he]2642-he had once longed for came to [him]2642-he , [he]2642-he was almost sorry to leave it . Yet it seemed so pleasant to think of lying deep in [the soft old earth]2654-the soft old earth [he]2642-he loved , and [he]2642-he was glad [he]2642-he had lived . There was not one night of sleepless agony , nor one hour of bitterness [he]2642-he would have missed , even if [he]2642-he might . It was all good , looked at from the end . Life lay very beautiful behind , and death was not terrible , only very strange .

" [He]2642-he died young and [they]3947-they buried [him]2642-he in [the earth]920-the earth [he]2642-he loved ; but there was not a tear shed over [him]2642-he . For why ? What had [he]2642-he done all [his]2642-he life ? Sold a few yards of print and ribbon , cast up a few accounts , suffered a little agony , prayed a little , doubted a little , comforted [a few people who were sad]3949-a few people who were sad ; and for the rest lived much as the birds live , singing and loving and revelling in the sunshine . "[1601-the mother] " [I]1601-the mother have that to give , í said [Life]193-life . "[1601-the mother] And [the mother]1601-the mother said : " Take [[my]1601-the mother child]3379-my child . [Your]3379-my child best is bitter sweet , but it is sweet.í "[1601-the mother] So [Death]192-death took [the mother]1601-the mother and [Life]193-life [the child]223-the child . " When [Undine]143-undine had finished [her]143-undine story [they]3951-they sat quiet for a little time . [I]0-i like this story . " "[0-i] [I]0-i like them too , " said [Undine]143-undine , "[0-i] when [they]2658-them come to [me]0-i as [I]0-i am at [my]0-i work . The air was so cool and it was dark as though there was going to be a great storm ; [I]195-diogenes was looking up into [your]143-undine face , and [you]143-undine were looking straight out before [you]143-undine , and [your]143-undine eyes were so strange . It 's so nice to dream . "[195-diogenes]

" Yes , dreams are nice . Good - bye . "[2661-the little ironing woman] And [the little ironing woman]2661-the little ironing woman trudged off with [her]2661-the little ironing woman shirts , leaving [Diogenes]195-diogenes with enough food for reverie , conjecture and enjoyment for the rest of the day . [The owner of the shirts]2662-the owner of the shirts , [she]2661-the little ironing woman had been told by [the Kaffir who brought [them]2664-them]2663-the kaffir who brought them , lived near [the Circus]2395-the circus ; that [his]2662-the owner of the shirts name was [W. Brown]196-w. brown [the shirts themselves]2666-the shirts themselves told [her]2661-the little ironing woman ; but to discover [his]2662-the owner of the shirts whereabouts seemed a hopeless task . [Most people]2667-most people answered [her]2661-the little ironing woman shortly enough . [One old woman]2668-one old woman , in answer to [her]2668-one old woman questions , began the long story of [one [Bill Brown]197-one bill brown , who might be the bill brown she was in search of , who had lived at graaff rienet , who had set out for the fields , but who , as turned out in the sequel , had died before reaching them , who might be [the Bill Brown]197-one bill brown , who might be the bill brown she was in search of , who had lived at graaff rienet , who had set out for the fields , but who , as turned out in the sequel , had died before reaching them [she]2668-one old woman was in search of , who had lived at [Graaff Rienet]197-one bill brown , who might be the bill brown she was in search of , who had lived at graaff rienet , who had set out for the fields , but who , as turned out in the sequel , had died before reaching them , who had set out for [the Fields]1783-the fields , but who , as turned out in the sequel , had died before reaching [them]1783-the fields]197-one bill brown , who might be the bill brown she was in search of , who had lived at graaff rienet , who had set out for the fields , but who , as turned out in the sequel , had died before reaching them . [He]2662-the owner of the shirts could hardly be [the owner of the shirt]2670-the owner of the shirt , nor yet [the widow [Brown]197-one bill brown , who might be the bill brown she was in search of , who had lived at graaff rienet , who had set out for the fields , but who , as turned out in the sequel , had died before reaching them to whose tent [some well - disposed digger]2672-some well - disposed digger sent [her]2661-the little ironing woman]2671-the widow brown to whose tent some well - disposed digger sent her . [Undine]143-undine was giving up the quest when [a Kaffir woman]2673-a kaffir woman , hearing [her]143-undine question , directed [her]143-undine to [a small tent the top of which was just visible behind [its]2674-a small tent the top of which was just visible behind its larger compeers larger compeers]2674-a small tent the top of which was just visible behind its larger compeers . Making [her]143-undine way between [the tents]2275-the tents over broken bottles , empty tins and rubbish of all kinds , [Undine]143-undine soon found [herself]143-undine before [it]2674-a small tent the top of which was just visible behind its larger compeers , and a glance through [its]2674-a small tent the top of which was just visible behind its larger compeers open door convinced [her]143-undine that [she]143-undine had found the right place at last .

' Twas [a tent of about the size of [her]143-undine own]2676-a tent of about the size of her own , but [its]2674-a small tent the top of which was just visible behind its larger compeers interior presented an infinitely more comfortless

ap- appearance

pearance , though [it]2674-a small tent the top of which was just visible behind its larger compeers was furnished with a wooden stretcher , two camp stools and a huge padlocked sea - chest .

The gravel that covered the floor was trodden into mounds and heaps of all sizes . More laths of the wooden stretcher hung down broken than were left to support the red sand - coloured bedding that lay on it . On the sea - chest that stood in the middle of [the tent]3712-the tent was such a multifarious and miscellaneous collection of articles as surely never sea - chest bore before . There were tins and bottles of every description , the latter crowned with the remains of half burnt candles ; there were old newspapers and shoe blacking , books and a pepper caster , pens and cigar ends , a paint box and a broken looking - glass , a microscope and combs , hair brushes , tooth brushes , boot brushes , nail brushes and a papier - mache desk on which was a silver - clasped album across which lay the broken head of a pick ; these with an infinitude of other smaller and larger articles covered it . On the ground at [its]2674-a small tent the top of which was just visible behind its larger compeers side lay an empty meal sack , the last of whose contents had evidently been used to compose the great leadeny - looking roaster - cake that was standing beside a tin mug of water on [the sea - chest]2678-the sea - chest ; the look of the roaster - cake was not inviting , except it were to throw at the head of [an enemy]1367-an enemy , yet [some one]312-some one had evidently tried to put it to some other use , for there were small pieces chipped off every here and there .

Close beside the sea - chest , on one of the camp stools leaning against the central pole , with [his]2681-his head hanging on [his]2681-his breast , sat [a man]3044-a man . [He]2681-his was in digger trim , with [his]2681-his shirt sleeves rolled up above [his]2681-his elbows , perhaps to hide their frayed and worn condition , certainly not for work , for the long arms [they]2683-they left uncovered seemed hardly strong enough to raise themselves , still less to handle sieve or pick . [His]2681-his eyes were closed , but a very light tap at the door - post caused [him]2681-his to raise [his]2681-his head and look up heavily at [the white - clad figure that stood in [his]2681-his doorway]2684-the white - clad figure that stood in his doorway . If [he]2681-his were [Mr. Brown]180-william , [she]2685-she said , [she]2685-she had brought [his]2681-his shirts . A slight flush came into [his]2681-his face . " [I]2681-his do n't want them ; [you]2685-she had better take them and keep them as payment , "[2681-his] [he]2681-his said ; then [he]2681-his drooped back into [his]2681-his old posture . [He]2681-his was greatly changed , but , when [he]2681-his looked up , [Undine]143-undine at once recognised [him]2681-his as [the passenger who , on that first morning on board [the steamer]1747-the steamer]2686-the passenger who , on that first morning on board the steamer had seemed the only glad thing in harmony with [the fresh breezy water]2688-the fresh breezy water and the sweeping sea - birds . [He]2681-his was in harmony with [his]2681-his surroundings now also , for the broken tins and bottles and [the old stretcher]2689-the old stretcher did not look more hopelessly down - and - out and good - for - nothing than [[their]2690-their master]2691-their master .

[Undine]143-undine looked at [his]2681-his wasted arms , at the empty meal sack , and the leaden roaster - cake , and listened to [his]2681-his hollow cough , and wondered where [the long-

whiskered captain]2692-the long- whiskered captain and [[his]2681-his brilliant sister]2693-his brilliant sister might be . Perhaps [they]2690-their were only of the sunflower species whom [only fools think to find growing in the shade]2694-only fools think to find growing in the shade .

[She]143-undine watched [him]2681-his in silence for a minute , then [she]143-undine stepped lightly into [the tent]3712-the tent and , putting [her]143-undine tray down on the floor , came and stood beside [him]2681-his . It was not till [she]143-undine had spoken twice and touched [him]2681-his softly on the shoulder that [he]2681-his seemed to hear [her]143-undine . " [You]2681-his are very ill , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said . " Have [you]2681-his much pain ? "[143-undine] " No , "[2681-his] [he]2681-his answered , heavily , without raising [his]2681-his head or opening [his]2681-his eyes . " Have [you]2681-his been ill long ? "[2681-his] " Yes no [I]143-undine do n't know ; "[143-undine] and a long hollow cough followed . " Would [you]2681-his not feel a little better if [you]2681-his tried to lie down ? It must be very hard to sit up here , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , gently . " [I]143-undine would , but it 's such a long way . "[143-undine] [He]2681-his raised [his]2681-his head again and looked with [his]2681-his heavy eyes across the three feet that separated [him]2681-his from [his]2681-his stretcher as [a man]3044-a man might to [a land of promise across [an ocean]2698-an ocean]2697-a land of promise across an ocean . [Undine]143-undine shook out the pillows and smoothed the blanket , and putting [his]2681-his hand on [her]143-undine shoulder helped [him]2681-his to reach it .

[He]2681-his did not thank [her]143-undine , but dropped down on it with a weary sigh . [He]2681-his had bonny light curls like

some one [she]143-undine had cared for long ago , and [he]2681-his had broken boots and stockings so old that the red flesh showed through . [She]143-undine hardly knew which drew [her]143-undine to [him]2681-his most , the curls or the boots , for there is something achingly pitiable in broken boots .

When [a man]3044-a man who has called [himself]3044-a man [a gentleman]3792-a gentleman falls to that , [he]3044-a man can fall no lower .

XVIII . [LITTLE IRONS]198-little irons AND [A DIGGER

DIOGENES]199-a digger diogenes ' little red head peeped out of [her]143-undine tub and [she]143-undine rolled [herself]143-undine from side to side and felt sadly disconsolate . [Her]143-undine rose bush was full of tender leaves , [her]143-undine back was not bad and the weather was glorious , but for three whole weeks [she]143-undine had had no story , and for three whole weeks [[her]143-undine daily visitor]2701-her daily visitor had come only to go . [She]143-undine felt aggrieved and greatly wronged .

" [I]143-undine wish [he]2681-his had stopped in [England]5-england ; it would have been a great deal nicer for [him]2681-his , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine soliloquised , [her]143-undine little forehead all gathered up into knots and puckers .

" [England]5-england 's such [a nice country]3960-a nice country , [they]3961-they say , and there 's nothing nice in [this land]3962-this land . [I]143-undine wonder why [he]2681-his came . "[143-undine] Just at that moment [Undine]143-undine arrived . " Is [he]2681-his better ? "[195-diogenes] inquired [Diogenes]195-diogenes , evidently with great interest , and [her]195-diogenes lips seemed to grow yet heavier when [she]195-diogenes had received [her]195-diogenes answer . " [I]195-diogenes do n't believe [he]2681-his tries to get better , "[195-diogenes] [she]195-diogenes said in an aggrieved tone . " Do n't [you]195-diogenes get tired to keep running up here all day ? "[195-diogenes]

" Not tired , but [I]195-diogenes am going to look for [some Kaffir men]3963-some kaffir men to carry [[his]2681-his tent]3964-his tent down next to [mine]195-diogenes ; then [I]195-diogenes will be able to take care of [him]2681-his and iron too . How is [your]195-diogenes back this morning ? "[195-diogenes] " Well , "[195-diogenes] said [Diogenes]195-diogenes , sullenly . " [I]143-undine 'm glad , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . " [I]143-undine 'll come back again when [I]143-undine have got [the Kaffirs]200-the kaffirs . Good - bye . "[143-undine] And [she]143-undine was gone .

" [I]195-diogenes wish [he]2681-his was gone , "[195-diogenes] said [Diogenes]195-diogenes . " It is not a bit nice any more . Heigh - ho ! "[143-undine] And [she]143-undine traced with [her]143-undine finger on the ground the B 's and C 's [Undine]143-undine had taught [her]143-undine to make .

As [Undine]143-undine had thought , it was a change for the better which brought the second tent into [[her]143-undine little nest among the gravel - heaps]2702-her little nest among the gravel - heaps . While one pair of hands and four irons had to skim over shirts enough in the twenty - four hours to pay for [doctor]737-doctor , eggs , milk , medicine , and sufficient bread to keep the hands [themselves]2704-themselves going , [they]2704-themselves could ill afford to be long at rest . Now [she]143-undine could go on ironing all day without interruption , peeping in at [[his]2705-he tent]3964-his tent every time [she]143-undine passed to change an iron at the fire , which was built between three round stones at the back of [the tent]3712-the tent .

[The doctor]3282-the doctor did not give much hope of [his]2705-he recovery . [He]2705-he was completely broken down , said [the doctor]3282-the doctor , with hard work and bad living . All day [he]2705-he lay there as helpless as [a little child]703-a little child , never speaking but when [his]2705-he mind wandered . Then [he]2705-he would often

fancy [himself]2705-he talking with [the mine - captain]2711-the mine - captain and begging [him]2711-the mine - captain not to give up yet , to keep on a little longer , to advance a little more money . Luck must turn soon . Or sometimes [he]2705-he was walking on [the deck]1752-the deck with [[the captain]1814-the captain 's pretty sister]1815-the captain 's pretty sister , and [he]2705-he would be whispering on softly for hours .

When [Undine]143-undine heard [him]2705-he [she]143-undine sometimes wondered whether it would not almost have been best to let [him]2705-he die alone , with [his]2705-he bit of roaster - cake in [[his]2705-he solitary tent]2715-his solitary tent . [He]2705-he did not look much like winning the heart of [any woman]2716-any woman as [he]2705-he lay there moaning , with even [his]2705-he bonny curls cut off . At last [he]2705-he grew better , and then it was hard to find time for the inevitable ironing . Let [him]2705-he seem ever so fast asleep , [his]2705-he eyes were sure to open if [she]143-undine rose to leave [him]2705-he . If [she]143-undine had nothing else to do for [him]2705-he , [he]2705-he liked [her]143-undine to sit beside [him]2705-he and talk . One day [she]143-undine looked in at the door with a furiously red face and in one hand a hot iron that [she]143-undine had just been to fetch at the fire . " Put that iron away "[2705-he] , [he]2705-he said , feebly , " till it gets cool . [My]2705-he eyes ache with them . They are always in [your]143-undine hands . [I]2705-he want [you]143-undine to answer [me]2705-he a question [I]2705-he ca n't answer for [myself]2705-he . "[2705-he] " Well ? "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , pushing back [her]143-undine cap a little and leaning over to one side to balance the iron [she]143-undine held in the other . " What is it ? [I]143-undine do n't think the irons have absorbed quite all [my]143-undine intellect yet . "[143-undine]

" As the spades and picks did [mine]143-undine . Tell [me]2705-he how it is that [I]2705-he am quite contented to lie here and be fed and nursed by [you]143-undine , and do n't feel as though [I]2705-he ought even to thank [you]143-undine , when [I]2705-he would die sooner than take a broken sixpence from [my]2705-he own flesh and blood ? How is it ? [I]2705-he 'm too weak to think . "[2705-he]

" [You]2717-you must be weak if [you]2717-you ca n't think that out , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , twisting one arm round the tent - post to keep [her]143-undine steady , and looking , [he]2717-you thought , almost beautiful in spite of [her]143-undine redness . " Do n't [you]2717-you know there are things [we]3965-we have to be more grateful for than being nursed and fed ? [You]2717-you 've given [me]143-undine something to take care of , and so , though [you]2717-you do n't think it , [you]2717-you feel [you]2717-you have done more for [me]143-undine than [I]143-undine for [you]2717-you . As for getting help from [[our]3965-we relations]3966-our relations , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , resting [her]143-undine head against the pole , " [they]3966-our relations are just [the last people]3967-the last people to go to unless one likes getting a pain in one 's pride bones . [One]397-one always has a lurking suspicion [they]3966-our relations are doing it from principle or necessity or something equally disagreeable ; and that 's why [their]3966-our relations money hurts . But [my]143-undine irons are getting cold , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , turning to go .

" Do n't [you]143-undine ever get tired of them ? "[2718-he] [he]2718-he asked . " It 's so burning hot today . "[143-undine] " Oh no , [I]143-undine never get tired , and it 's not so hot today as it might be . [I]143-undine get to like it . "[143-undine]

[She]143-undine walked off , but the iron [she]143-undine was using must have been a very heavy one , for when [she]143-undine was taking

it back to the fire [she]143-undine stumbled two or three times as though [she]143-undine would have fallen .

" What a very uneven little path this is , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said to [herself]143-undine , thereby greatly maligning the very smooth little path over the gravel that led from the door of [[her]143-undine tent]2719-her tent to the fireplace . Perhaps it was by way of smoothing it that [she]143-undine knelt down by the water barrel and damped the crown of [her]143-undine head and lay there for half an hour looking very white . Anyhow , [she]143-undine did not say any more about the path being uneven after that . A few days later , [Undine]143-undine paid [her]143-undine daily visit to [Diogenes]195-diogenes , who as usual lay in [her]143-undine tub with [her]143-undine rose bush before [her]143-undine . The discerning eyes of [that small individual]2720-that small individual perceived something unusual and amiss in the face of [[her]143-undine friend]1176-her friend , and when [Undine]143-undine sat down beside the tub and leaned [her]143-undine hand against it , [she]143-undine said , " Are [you]195-diogenes very tired today ? "[143-undine] " No , not at all . "[143-undine] " [You]195-diogenes do n't look happy . [I]143-undine wish [I]143-undine knew what was the matter ; [I]143-undine wish [you]195-diogenes need never be tired or sad "[143-undine] ; and [Diogenes]195-diogenes took [Undine]143-undine 's rough little hand and rubbed it softly up and down with [her]195-diogenes chin . It was [her]195-diogenes way of showing sympathy ; and it showed it more effectually than any words could have done so effectually that it ended in making [Undine]143-undine cry . [She]143-undine pressed [her]143-undine face against the tub , and [Diogenes]195-diogenes fancied [she]195-diogenes heard a sob .

" Oh dear ! what is it ? "[195-diogenes] said [Diogenes]195-diogenes , looking up , terribly troubled at the sound . " [I]195-diogenes did not know [you]195-diogenes could be so miserable . [I]195-diogenes thought [you]195-diogenes saw such beautiful things , [you]195-diogenes were always happy . [I]195-diogenes 'm sure it 's all [that man]3969-that man 's fault "[195-diogenes] ; and [Diogenes]195-diogenes ' clear grey eyes filled with wrathful but partly sympathetic tears .

" No , it is not ; only [I]195-diogenes am weak and faint , and [I]195-diogenes want money . "[195-diogenes] If [her]195-diogenes rose bush had stirred its tender leaves and said it wanted high - heeled boots and a fashionable bonnet , it would not have astonished [Diogenes]195-diogenes more . " [Thou]3970-thou shalt not love money ; [thou]3970-thou shalt not desire it ; [thou]3970-thou shalt despise it ; it is [the child of the devil]3971-the child of the devil , and [[his]3969-that man eldest born]3972-his eldest born . "[195-diogenes] This was the little bit of ethical teaching which was sure to lift up its head in the wildest of [Undine]143-undine 's fairy stories , and the effect on [Diogenes]195-diogenes had been so great that [she]195-diogenes often seriously debated in [her]195-diogenes own mind whether , seeing a pound lying at [her]195-diogenes feet , there would not be a certain amount of degradation in stooping to pick it up . To look up , therefore , and see [[her]195-diogenes instructor]2722-her instructor 's face wet with tears because [she]195-diogenes wanted money , wanted money , so puzzled [Diogenes]195-diogenes that [she]195-diogenes remained quiet for a few minutes . Then [she]195-diogenes began to use [her]195-diogenes very practical little brains , and quickly came to certain conclusions .

" Ca n't [you]195-diogenes get money enough to pay [the doctor]3282-the doctor ? "[195-diogenes]

[she]195-diogenes asked , looking up softly from under [her]195-diogenes great shock of red hair .

" No , [I]195-diogenes can get that . [I]195-diogenes want much money , almost a hundred pounds . If [I]195-diogenes ca n't get that [I]195-diogenes do n't want any , [I]195-diogenes do n't want anything . "[195-diogenes]

[Diogenes]195-diogenes drew a long breath . [She]195-diogenes felt sure that disagreeable [he]2723-he was at the bottom of it all , but [she]195-diogenes would ask no more questions . [She]195-diogenes was rubbing [her]195-diogenes chin softly up and down [Undine]143-undine 's hand when it touched the ring upon it [Aunt Margaret]77-aunt margaret 's ring .

" If [you]143-undine were to sell this , perhaps [you]143-undine would get much money ; diamonds are so dear and it is so beautiful . "[195-diogenes] [Undine]143-undine lifted [her]143-undine head quickly and looked down at it . [She]143-undine had as little thought of it as a thing to be parted with as the hand which wore it . The one link between [her]143-undine and the old days . [She]143-undine had worn it till it seemed to have grown a part of [herself]143-undine . [[Her]143-undine baby friend]2724-her baby friend had touched it , pleased with its flash and gleam . [It]2725-it had whispered to [her]143-undine that truth and love were possibilities when [she]143-undine had sat toying with it in [the great , gayly filled , empty rooms of [[her]143-undine husband]1482-her husband 's house]2726-the great , gayly filled , empty rooms of her husband 's house . It had shone on a soft hand that had so often rested tenderly on [her]143-undine head . It had been the sign of a great love , faithful even unto death . [She]143-undine moved it softly round [her]143-undine finger two or three times ; then [she]143-undine drew it off .

Why sacrifice [the living]2431-the living to the dead , the present

to the past ? The past is a fruitless dream , the present only is living and demands all things .

" Are [you]143-undine going to sell it ? "[195-diogenes] asked [Diogenes]195-diogenes . " Yes , at once , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , rising quickly , " and [I]143-undine will come back soon . "[143-undine]

" [I]195-diogenes know [she]143-undine liked that ring , and now [she]143-undine has got to sell it , "[195-diogenes] said [Diogenes]195-diogenes to [herself]195-diogenes as soon as [Undine]143-undine was out of hearing . " It 's all [his]1482-her husband fault , [I]195-diogenes know it is . Perhaps [she]143-undine wants to send [him]1482-her husband to [England]5-england . [She]143-undine said yesterday [he]1482-her husband was worse and would never get better if [he]1482-her husband could n't go . [I]195-diogenes do wonder why [he]1482-her husband did not stay [there]3010-there , "[195-diogenes] said [Diogenes]195-diogenes , in [her]195-diogenes anger pulling so vigorously at one leaf of [her]195-diogenes rose that it came off . " [I]195-diogenes do n't go about everywhere making [everybody]3528-everybody miserable .
