"[195-diogenes] Lost in the contemplation of [her]195-diogenes own virtue in abstaining from a crime which by no possibility [she]195-diogenes could have committed , and finding immense satisfaction in so doing , [Diogenes]195-diogenes lay still in [her]195-diogenes tub and waited for [Undine]143-undine 's return .

[She]143-undine was long gone , but when [she]143-undine did make [her]143-undine appearance , it was so radiantly , joyfully , that [Diogenes]195-diogenes felt ashamed of [her]195-diogenes tears . If [she]143-undine had not liked parting with [her]143-undine ring , there was no sign of it in [her]143-undine face . [She]143-undine had got as much as [she]143-undine wanted , almost more ; now [he]2729-he would know that [he]2729-he could go to [England]5-england , and the hope would make [him]2729-he well .

" [I]195-diogenes knew it was for [him]2729-he , "[195-diogenes] muttered [Diogenes]195-diogenes under [her]195-diogenes breath ; but [Undine]143-undine was too glad to hear it , too glad to sit down , and soon fluttered off . [She]143-undine

hardly felt [the sandy road]2034-the sandy road [she]143-undine plodded in , but only the little roll of notes tight - clasped in [her]143-undine hand , the little roll that meant hope and strength and life for [him]2729-he and , it might be , more than life gladness in place of long years of weary loneliness . Even if [he]2729-he got well and , staying at [New Rush]40-new rush till [he]2729-he had money , at last went [home]246-home to find [the woman who had charmed away [his]2729-he soul given to [another]3274-another]2732-the woman who had charmed away his soul given to another , would [he]2729-he not curse the hand that had kept [him]2729-he from a quiet sleep in [the New Rush graveyard]2734-the new rush graveyard ?

It might be that , going [home]246-home even now , [he]2729-he might find the bright eyes had fooled [him]2729-he ; but [Undine]143-undine put the thought from [her]143-undine and enjoyed the sunshine of the moment .

[He]2729-he should never know from whom it came ; it should be burdened with no debt of gratitude . Generally the work is heart - sickening , that of trying to bring joy and good to [our]2736-our heart 's own , work in which failures are in number as gravel bort , 1 and the successes as diamonds . But for once [Undine]143-undine found success . The mysterious little parcel which the post brought [him]2729-he seemed to work in [him]2729-he all the wonders of the old life waters .

There were no more refusals to eat ; no more weary days of stupor and relapse coming when [he]2729-he had wearied [himself]2729-he out with calculation as to the

1 " Bort "[2737-i.e.] diamond dust ; [i.e.]2737-i.e. , the " dust "[2737-i.e.] infinitely outnumbering the " diamonds . "[2737-i.e.]

length of time it would take [him]2729-he to get strong and then to earn money enough for the long journey .

When the days grew warmer , [he]2729-he was strong enough to sit outside , among rugs and cushions on the shady side of [the tent]3712-the tent ; sometimes to use [his]2729-he pencils ; sometimes to watch [Undine]143-undine through the tent door as [she]143-undine stood smoothing away at [her]143-undine packing - case . Pleasant days they were , flying all too quickly , for one at least , who worked and enjoyed the present and put the future from [her]143-undine . At last the time came when [they]2739-they were only hours that could be counted before [his]2729-he departure . [He]2729-he was still so weak that it took [him]2729-he a long time to get from [one tent]2740-one tent to the other , but [he]2729-he was to leave by the next morning 's coach . The last evening came . [He]2729-he lay on [his]2729-he stretcher , and [Undine]143-undine sat at its foot on the skirting in the doorway , trying to make the most of the daylight . [She]143-undine was darning the best of [his]2729-he old stockings , and [he]2729-he all the while chatted on eagerly of the future , in spirits unnaturally high , springing quickly from one subject to another .

" [You]2729-he are such a genius , [Little Irons]198-little irons , in spite of [your]2729-he big kappie and [your]2729-he shirts . [The world]222-the world shall know of [you]2729-he some day , and [I]2729-he shall be so proud of the Little Irons who came to help [me]2729-he when all [the world]222-the world would have left [me]2729-he to drop out of life like a dog . "[2729-he] Then [he]2729-he speculated as to where the money could have come from , then on [his]2729-he own course for

the future ; then talked of those first dreadful days of labour and failure , of the time it would take [him]2729-he to reach [The Bay]53-the bay , 1 and at last talked [himself]2729-he to sleep . Then [she]143-undine stood up and put the stockings [she]143-undine had mended into [his]2729-he bag , and moved softly about [the tent]3712-the tent collecting pencils and various trifles that still lay about .

[She]143-undine had just packed the last of them when [a coolie , 2 late out]2742-a coolie , 2 late out , passed [the tent]3712-the tent with [his]2729-he tray of wares upon [his]2729-he head . There were still two oranges left on it , so [she]143-undine told [him]2729-he to wait , and went into [[her]143-undine tent]2719-her tent to the broken ink pot where [she]143-undine kept [her]143-undine money . There was only one shilling in it , so one of the oranges had to go ; the other [she]143-undine put in the pocket of the coat [he]2729-he was to wear tomorrow , which lay on the box at [his]2729-he side . There was no more money left in the ink pot , but what did it matter ? There would be [nobody to care for after tomorrow]2745-nobody to care for after tomorrow . What did anything matter ? [She]143-undine went to [[her]143-undine own tent]2746-her own tent and sat down in the doorway and tried to eat [her]143-undine supper ; but eating did not answer ; so presently [she]143-undine sat still with [her]143-undine head leaning against the door - post .

Across [the road]1264-the road were [the children of [the Dutchwoman]2749-the dutchwoman]2748-the children of the dutchwoman , shouting and tumbling over [one another]567-one another in [their]2748-the children of the dutchwoman play . [They]2748-the children of the dutchwoman had done so every night for the last six months , but did that night seem just like every other night to [them]2748-the children of the dutchwoman ?

1 [Port Elizabeth]25-port elizabeth .

[2 Indian]2751-2 indian .

[He]2729-he did not wake to eat [his]2729-he supper , and slept on straight till morning . Just at daybreak [she]143-undine stepped softly into [[his]2729-he tent]3964-his tent to wake [him]2729-he . [The cart [they]2754-they had ordered to take [him]2729-he]2753-the cart they had ordered to take him to [the hotel]1971-the hotel would be [there]3010-there soon . [He]2729-he was scarcely ready , and [Undine]143-undine was still busy cutting up [his]2729-he tobacco when [she]143-undine caught the sound of the approaching wheels . [He]2729-he did not hear [them]2754-they till [they]2754-they were just before [the tent]3712-the tent ; then [he]2729-he rose quickly and pressed the cut tobcacco into [his]2729-he pouch while [the driver]2120-the driver carried out [his]2729-he luggage . Then [he]2729-he turned to wish [her]143-undine good - bye . The grey light was just turning into white , and gusts of cold early wind blew in through the rolled up door . " Good - bye , [[my]2729-he friend]1259-my friend , [[my]2729-he dear]2975-my dear [Little Irons]198-little irons , "[2729-he] [he]2729-he said , warmly yet very gladly , and [he]2729-he stooped down to kiss [her]143-undine ; but it was such a cold , trembling little face [he]2729-he touched that something smote [his]2729-he heart . " [I]2729-he 've been a great bother to [you]143-undine , [dear Little Irons]198-little irons , "[2729-he] [he]2729-he said , resting [his]2729-he right hand tenderly on [her]143-undine shoulder . " [You]143-undine will have rest when [I]2729-he am gone and go back to [your]143-undine happy , quiet old life ; and [I]2729-he shall never forget [you]143-undine , never . How could [I]2729-he ? "[2729-he] [She]143-undine stood on tiptoe and wound a scarf round [his]2729-he neck . " Do n't take it off till the sun gets warm , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said .

" Oh , [I]2729-he 'll take good care of [myself]2729-he , "[2729-he] [he]2729-he answered as [he]2729-he passed out of the door . Then [he]2729-he turned round to say good - bye once more . " Good - bye , but not for[2729-he]

very long ; [I]0-i feel sure [we]2759-we shall soon meet again , " [he]2729-he said , as [he]2729-he took [her]143-undine hand in [his]2729-he .[0-i]

[He]2729-he climbed up at the back of [the cart]2361-the cart , and a moment after only the faint rumbling of the wheels broke the stillness . [Undine]143-undine stood in the tent door . " Meet again ! meet again ! "[143-undine] Poor human hearts that must still [their]2761-their aching with such vain words . Meet again ! Who ever met again ? [The child [we]2759-we love]2762-the child we love goes from [us]2759-we and comes back to [us]2759-we [a man]3044-a man , and [all others]708-all others praise the change ; but [we]2759-we , even while [we]2759-we run [our]2759-we fingers through [his]3044-a man curls , [we]2759-we hunger for [the little child that sat upon [our]2759-we knee]2765-the little child that sat upon our knee . [We]2759-we part with [the friend of [our]2759-we childhood]2766-the friend of our childhood , and [we]2759-we say , " [We]2759-we part only for today ; through life [we]2759-we shall often meet again , "[2759-we] and it may be [we]2759-we clasp hands often in the years that come and talk of the old days ; but [we]2759-we know , though [we]2759-we never say it , that [the two who parted have never met again]2767-the two who parted have never met again , that the sea of time has run up between [us]2759-we , and [we]2759-we can not touch . Who can part , forever ; only when [we]2759-we come so close that nothing separates [us]2759-we can [we]2759-we meet again , only when what binds [us]2759-we is not [my]0-i need of [you]2768-you or [your]2768-you need of [me]0-i nor any chance circumstance , but a deep ingrained likeness of nature that can not pass away . " [We]2759-we shall meet again some day , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine as [she]143-undine stood in the tent door , comforting [herself]143-undine with this great lie .

A little after the sun had risen , [she]143-undine hurried along

[the path in the direction of [the Toit 's Pan Road]2770-the toit 's pan road]2769-the path in the direction of the toit 's pan road , and stopped when [she]143-undine came to [the last of the enclosures that lined [it]2770-the toit 's pan road on either side]2771-the last of the enclosures that lined it on either side . [The coach]2772-the coach would have to pass [there]3010-there , and [she]143-undine must see [it]2772-the coach ; so [she]143-undine stood there waiting while the quickly moving [passenger carts from [Toit 's Pan]54-toit 's pan]2774-passenger carts from toit 's pan passed and repassed [her]143-undine , breaking the stillness of the quiet morning .

At last , after long waiting , it came with [[its]2772-the coach great red tent]2775-its great red tent , with [its]2775-its great red tent blowing bugle , with its eight prancing horses , with [its]2775-its great red tent crowded roof ; and inside , just as it tore past [her]143-undine , [she]143-undine saw [him]2776-he . It was only a glimpse , but that was enough , for [he]2776-he looked bright and glad . [He]2776-he was speaking to [the passenger who sat next [him]2776-he and laughing and peeling the orange [he]2776-he had found in [his]2776-he pocket]2777-the passenger who sat next him and laughing and peeling the orange he had found in his pocket . A piece of peel [he]2776-he threw out fell at [the roadside]2778-the roadside , and [she]143-undine picked it up after [the coach]2772-the coach had passed . " It is all right . [He]2776-he is happy , very happy , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , and turned to go back to [[her]143-undine tent]2719-her tent . " [He]2776-he is happy , very happy , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine kept on repeating to [herself]143-undine when [she]143-undine got back to [the tent]3712-the tent . Remnants of the tobacco [she]143-undine had been cutting still lay on the old sea - chest , the boots [he]2776-he had worn yesterday still lay beside it , and the half drunk cup of chocolate was hardly cold . [She]143-undine looked in at the door for a minute , and then went to [[her]143-undine own tent]2746-her own tent .

[[Her]143-undine own little tent , which [she]143-undine had said was so full and rich to [her]143-undine]2783-her own little tent , which she had said was so full and rich to her , which was so empty and silent now . [She]143-undine walked up and down , not daring to sit

down and rest . Well had [she]143-undine said to that hungry dog on that day long ago : " Go away , and do not follow [me]143-undine . If [you]2776-he follow [me]143-undine [I]143-undine shall love [you]2776-he and [I]143-undine , [I]143-undine have had pain enough . "[143-undine]

At last [she]143-undine sat down by the old packing - case and drew out the old papers , and the pens that had been unused so long . [She]143-undine took up the newspaper and scribbled all over the edges one of those stories in which the heart of [Diogenes]195-diogenes delighted . [Its]2784-its keynote was the very safe and comforting reflection that all love dies sooner or later ; only that which has no existence , which the young dream of , lasts forever . It comforted [her]143-undine greatly that morning . After a few months [she]143-undine would be happy without [him]2785-him and almost forget [this boy whom [she]143-undine had loved with a more yearning tenderness than [[her]143-undine own little child]1720-her own little child]2786-this boy whom she had loved with a more yearning tenderness than her own little child . " [I]143-undine will forget , [I]143-undine will forget everything , and live only in the present ; then , soon , there will be no reason to forget , for this little love will fade away like the yearning for [my]143-undine monkey and the madness that looks so grotesque , and unreal now and which nothing could ever again bring back nothing . "[143-undine] The margins of the newspaper were full to overflowing and [she]143-undine was already crossing it over in every direction , when a shadow fell across the sunlight that streamed in through the tent door .

Some coolie bringing the milk [he]2785-him was accustomed to sell there , [she]143-undine thought , as [she]143-undine looked up to see

the figure of [a man with [his]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance back turned to the entrance]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance . The opening was so low that [his]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance head was not visible , but an elegant little black cane moved slowly backwards and forwards , and there was that in the cut of the black cloth coat and the hang of the trousers that carried [her]143-undine back from [New Rush]40-new rush to that first meeting before the picture in [Blair House]18-blair house . Soon [the figure]2789-the figure turned and [Undine]143-undine hardly knew what [she]143-undine expected to see , but it was only the very ugly face of [a very black nigger]2790-a very black nigger that stuck itself in at the doorway .

" Have [you]143-undine done the shirts [a girl]906-a girl brought [here]3208-here yesterday ? "[2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance] [he]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance asked in very good English and in a very leisurely and self - possessed manner . Evidently [he]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance had taken [some Englishman]2791-some englishman , probably [[his]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance master]1052-his master , as the model upon which to form [himself]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance . [Undine]143-undine brought [him]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance the shirts , which [the swell nigger]2793-the swell nigger took with the extreme tips of [his]2793-the swell nigger fingers , as though it were greatly derogatory to [his]2793-the swell nigger dignity and [he]2793-the swell nigger only submitted to a most painful necessity . Touching gracefully [his]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance woolless upper lip with the hand in which [he]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance held the cane , [he]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance said : " If [you]143-undine want more work , [I]2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance dare say [you]143-undine could get it if [you]143-undine come to [[our]3982-our place [Mr. Albert Blair]97-albert blair 's]3983-our place mr. albert blair 's . "[2788-a man with his back turned to the entrance]

[The nigger]2309-the nigger rolled out the name very full and with evident satisfaction , at the same time holding out a five - shilling piece to [Undine]143-undine with an air that clearly evinced how greatly [he]2309-the nigger scorned the performing of so trivial an action . [He]2309-the nigger thought [the ironing-

woman]2795-the ironing- woman was certainly half daft , or it might be drunk , for [she]143-undine stood in the tent door staring at [him]2309-the nigger and never holding out [her]143-undine hand to receive the money . [He]2309-the nigger was on the point of informing [her]143-undine of [his]2309-the nigger opinion in very plain language when [she]143-undine said , " [You]2309-the nigger can keep the money for [yourself]2309-the nigger . "[143-undine]

There was no doubt now as to [the ironing - woman]2796-the ironing - woman 's daftness or drunkenness , for who gives five shillings for nothing ? But [the nigger]2309-the nigger no longer felt [himself]2309-the nigger under the painful necessity of informing [her]143-undine of the fact , and , great as [his]2309-the nigger scorn for the five - shilling piece had appeared to be , it quickly found its way into [his]2309-the nigger waistcoat pocket . In reply to a question from [Undine]143-undine [he]2309-the nigger proceeded to inform [her]143-undine where [[[his]2309-the nigger master]1052-his master 's house]2799-his master 's house might be found , and wrapping up the shirts in a newspaper [he]2309-the nigger had brought for the purpose , and tucking them under [his]2309-the nigger arm , [he]2309-the nigger walked off switching [his]2309-the nigger black cane . Near evening [Undine]143-undine too went out , but in an opposite direction , and forgetting today even to button down [her]143-undine tent door . There was not a shilling in the bottle nor a whole slice of bread in the box , yet [she]143-undine was not going to look for work now . [She]143-undine was going to [Diogenes]195-diogenes , but the walk seemed a weary long one ; it had never seemed so long before . [Her]143-undine legs ached , [her]143-undine head ached , and sometimes [she]143-undine grew dizzy .

[Diogenes]195-diogenes was not in [[her]195-diogenes tub]2800-her tub today . [She]143-undine was greatly excited and the tub seemed to confine [her]143-undine .

[She]143-undine was leaning against it and almost started to [her]143-undine feet when [Undine]143-undine appeared round [the tent]3712-the tent 's corner .

" [I]195-diogenes 've been so tired of waiting for [you]143-undine all these two days . [I]195-diogenes thought [you]143-undine would never come . Stoop down before the tub and shut [your]143-undine eyes tight and then look in and see what [I]195-diogenes 've got for [you]143-undine , "[195-diogenes] cried [Diogenes]195-diogenes , giving two gentle claps with [her]195-diogenes hands , for once [a perfect child]2802-a perfect child in [her]195-diogenes delight . [Undine]143-undine did as [she]143-undine was told and looked in , to see the tiny rose bush adorned with one deep - bosomed red rosebud . " Is n't it beautiful ? Is n't it beautiful ? "[195-diogenes] said [Diogenes]195-diogenes , enthusiastically clasping [her]143-undine hands . " Pick it ; it 's for [you]143-undine . No [you]143-undine must not pick it . [I]195-diogenes will and fasten it in [your]143-undine hair just like it was in [my]195-diogenes dream . Oh , how beautiful ! "[195-diogenes] [Undine]143-undine put the iron pot down in [Diogenes]195-diogenes ' lap , but [Diogenes]195-diogenes ' fingers were so tremulous with gladness that [she]143-undine almost uprooted the rose bush before the flower was severed from the stem . " Now , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , putting the old pot down at one side , " lay down [your]143-undine head and [I]143-undine will put it in . "[143-undine] [Undine]143-undine sat down beside [her]143-undine and put [her]143-undine head in [Diogenes]195-diogenes ' lap , and [the child]223-the child did and undid the hair half a score of times before the flower was fixed to [her]143-undine satisfaction . " Now turn round and look at [me]143-undine , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , when all was done . But it was such a weary face that looked up at [hers]143-undine that [Diogenes]195-diogenes ' face fell also .

" [I]195-diogenes had quite forgotten [he]2804-he went away this[195-diogenes]

morn- morning

ing , and [you]143-undine must be sorry , [you]143-undine 've taken care of [him]2804-he so long , " said [Diogenes]195-diogenes , who , in truth , for the last forty - eight hours had been gloriously oblivious of every existence save that of [her]195-diogenes wonderful rosebud .[143-undine]

[Diogenes]195-diogenes did not know what to say ; so [she]195-diogenes resorted to dumb sympathy , which [she]195-diogenes did understand , and drew [Undine]143-undine 's face very close to [her]143-undine and smoothed it with the palms of [her]195-diogenes little hands . After a long quiet [she]195-diogenes said , " [I]195-diogenes love [you]143-undine better than anything , better even than [my]195-diogenes rose bush . "[195-diogenes] It was only [a child]443-a child 's way of comforting , those few words of love and that smoothing [her]143-undine cheek with [her]195-diogenes little hands . [A child]443-a child 's way , yet by it [she]195-diogenes paid back more than all the good that had been brought to [her]195-diogenes . " It is nice to lie here and rest , but [I]143-undine must go , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , when the last rays of the sun were shining on the little green leaves of the rose bush , which stood just beyond the end of [the tent]3712-the tent where it could catch them . " [You]143-undine are sick , too , "[195-diogenes] said [Diogenes]195-diogenes , noticing how [she]195-diogenes leaned [her]195-diogenes hand against the tub to help [herself]195-diogenes in rising . " Not sick , only tired . [I]195-diogenes have not been so tired for many years . [I]195-diogenes want to sleep for a long , long time . [I]195-diogenes shall be better then . "[195-diogenes] [She]195-diogenes smiled as [she]195-diogenes looked down into the earnest eyes that were fixed on [her]195-diogenes .

" Come again soon , very soon , "[195-diogenes] said [Diogenes]195-diogenes , as [Undine]143-undine was going out of sight . [She]143-undine did not answer , but turned round for a moment and looked back at [her]143-undine , still smiling . The rose had fallen out of [her]143-undine hair and [she]143-undine held it in [her]143-undine hand . " [You]195-diogenes look just like [you]195-diogenes did in [my]195-diogenes dream , "[195-diogenes] [Diogenes]195-diogenes said ; but [Undine]143-undine did not hear [her]143-undine , for [she]143-undine had turned to go . It may be that in the years to come [Diogenes]195-diogenes shall grow into [a great , coarse , red woman as [[her]195-diogenes mother]272-her mother was before [her]195-diogenes [the mother of [many children]2811-many children]2810-the mother of many children , the wife of many husbands whom [she]195-diogenes may drop as easily as [she]195-diogenes does every hour the words that are not choice . It may be but there will come hours when the one pure and tender memory of [her]195-diogenes childhood will come back to [her]195-diogenes , and [[her]195-diogenes children]2600-her children]2808-a great , coarse , red woman as her mother was before her the mother of many children , the wife of many husbands whom she may drop as easily as she does every hour the words that are not choice . it may be but there will come hours when the one pure and tender memory of her childhood will come back to her , and her children will wonder why [she]195-diogenes speaks so softly and [the men]2813-the men why [she]195-diogenes has no oath to throw back at [them]2600-her children . [They]2600-her children would wonder if [they]2600-her children knew it was only the picture of that summer evening at [New Rush]40-new rush and [the little slight figure standing at [the tent corner]2815-the tent corner with the red rosebud in [its]2814-the little slight figure standing at the tent corner with the red rosebud in its hand , and its great white kappie , and the yellow evening sunlight streaming over it from behind hand , and [its]2814-the little slight figure standing at the tent corner with the red rosebud in its hand , and its great white kappie , and the yellow evening sunlight streaming over it from behind great white kappie , and the yellow evening sunlight streaming over it from behind]2814-the little slight figure standing at the tent corner with the red rosebud in its hand , and its great white kappie , and the yellow evening sunlight streaming over it from behind . As [Undine]143-undine had said , [she]143-undine was tired , very tired ; but instead of going [home]246-home [she]143-undine turned slowly to that part of [the camp]3776-the camp to which [[her]143-undine little squint - eyed guide]2818-her little squint - eyed guide had once conducted [her]143-undine .

[She]143-undine stopped when [she]143-undine came to the reed fence that encircled [the home of [the baby - faced golden - haired lady]2820-the baby - faced golden - haired lady]2819-the home of the baby - faced golden - haired lady . [She]143-undine was on [the veranda]2375-the veranda again this evening , but [she]143-undine was not alone now . Over [her]143-undine chair was leaning [a man , whose head was bent so low over [hers]143-undine that the black beard mingled with the golden ripples on [her]143-undine forehead]2822-a man , whose head was bent so low over hers that the black beard mingled with the golden ripples on her forehead . [They]2823-they spoke very soft and low , and [they]2823-they did not notice [Undine]143-undine , for [their]2823-they backs were to [her]143-undine and [their]2823-they talk was very interesting . But [a little boy]2824-a little boy , who sat behind [them]2823-they playing , now lifted [his]2824-a little boy blue eyes to look at [the woman on the other side of the hedge]2825-the woman on the other side of the hedge and caught sight of the bright rose [she]143-undine held . [He]2824-a little boy slipped down from [the veranda]2375-the veranda and stood before [her]143-undine . " Give , "[2824-a little boy] [he]2824-a little boy said , and held out imperiously one small hand . [Undine]143-undine dropped the rose into it and turned to go back to [[her]143-undine tent]2719-her tent .

" [You]143-undine must come , "[2828-the dark - whiskered gentleman] whispered [the dark - whiskered gentleman]2828-the dark - whiskered gentleman as [he]2828-the dark - whiskered gentleman stooped low over the golden head . " Come if it is for only one short half hour . [You]143-undine may allow [yourself]143-undine to be robbed of all pleasure , but [others]713-others must not be quite forgotten , [you]143-undine know ; even if [our]3985-our claim to be considered is not very strong . "[2828-the dark - whiskered gentleman]

[The lady]263-the lady smiled very softly and smoothed out the fringe on [her]263-the lady sleeve with [her]263-the lady little pink finger .

" Surely [you]143-undine have done enough in coming to such a place as this . [You]143-undine need not renounce [the world]222-the world altogether ; [you]143-undine are too young to do penance yet "[263-the lady] ;

and [the gentleman]2830-the gentleman 's breath was warm on [her]263-the lady cheek . Then [she]263-the lady lifted [her]263-the lady baby face up to [his]2830-the gentleman , and [her]263-the lady eyes were just as they had been when [she]263-the lady looked down at [Undine]143-undine , placid , smiling ; there was no harm in them .

" [I]263-the lady 've been out two nights this week , "[263-the lady] [she]263-the lady said , " and [people]3030-people might think it strange , [you]2830-the gentleman know . [The doctor]3282-the doctor said [he]3282-the doctor was much worse today , and [he]3282-the doctor would be so angry if [they]3030-people told [him]3282-the doctor . "[263-the lady] It might have ended in [her]263-the lady not going to the ball that night , but at that moment [the child]223-the child passed [them]2832-them with the bright flower in its hand . " What a lovely flower ! "[1601-the mother] said [the mother]1601-the mother , and [she]1601-the mother held out [her]1601-the mother hand for it ; but [the child]223-the child clasped it tightly in [his]223-the child fist and held it close against [his]223-the child little breast . It was only a moment 's work for [the gentleman]2830-the gentleman to unclasp the little fingers and put the flower into [the mother]1601-the mother 's hand . [The child]223-the child did not cry ; [he]223-the child only pressed [his]223-the child little thin arched lips together and drooped the lids over the blue eyes with which [he]223-the child looked at them . [He]223-the child was only [a baby]1552-a baby : there was no sin in taking it . " [You]1601-the mother see [the very gods]3989-the very gods have condescended to interfere in [my]2830-the gentleman behalf , "[2830-the gentleman] whispered [the gentleman]2830-the gentleman . " This rose means that [you]1601-the mother are to go and wear it here tonight . "[2830-the gentleman]

[He]2830-the gentleman lay it very softly on [her]1601-the mother breast and whispered words , so softly that only the ear in which they were spoken could catch them ; and when [the mother]1601-the mother rose

to go into [the house]228-the house [she]1601-the mother said , " Well just for one hour , just for one , [you]2830-the gentleman know . "[1601-the mother]

And so [she]1601-the mother went to the ball that night and danced , the loveliest of all [the women there]2842-the women there , with that bright flower at [her]1601-the mother heart ; and [all]1512-all praised [her]1601-the mother and looked at [her]1601-the mother . And that night , alone , when [the nigger who had been left to watch]2844-the nigger who had been left to watch [him]2844-the nigger who had been left to watch had gone out to spend the five shillings , [Albert Blair]97-albert blair died .

XIX . [ALBERT BLAIR]97-albert blair

" Vat jou goed en trek , [Ferreira]202-ferreira , [Vat jou goed en trek]3990-vat jou goed en trek ;[2793-the swell nigger]

[Swaar dra]56-swaar dra , swaar dra ... " 1[2793-the swell nigger]

whistled [the swell nigger]2793-the swell nigger next morning as [he]2793-the swell nigger walked , switching [his]2793-the swell nigger cane , in the direction of [[Undine]143-undine 's tent]2846-undine 's tent .

Generally [she]143-undine rose early , but this morning [she]143-undine was sleeping late and so heavily that [he]2793-the swell nigger had to knock two or three times at the tent pole before [she]143-undine came to unbutton the sail . " Do [you]143-undine want any needlework ? "[2309-the nigger] asked [the nigger]2309-the nigger , touching [his]2309-the nigger hat quite respectfully , for , even with a salary of six pounds a month , five shillings are not to be despised . [Undine]143-undine said [she]143-undine wanted no work .

[The nigger]2309-the nigger looked disappointed . [He]2793-the swell nigger had hoped [she]143-undine would take the work , and show as great an

1

" Take [your]143-undine things and go , [Ferreira]202-ferreira , Take [your]143-undine things and go ; Heavy to carry , heavy to carry ... "[2793-the swell nigger]

These words are from the Afrikaans folk - song lied " [Jannie]203-jannie met die hoepelbeen , [Ferreira]202-ferreira "[204-jack] [Johnny]204-jack with the bandy leg , [Ferreira]202-ferreira perhaps the best known folk - song in [South Africa]21-south africa . [Ferreira]202-ferreira is a not uncommon Afrikaner surname .

objection to accepting payment for black skirts as for ironing shirts .

" [You]143-undine see , [[my]2796-the ironing - woman master]3463-my master died last night , and [Mrs. Blair]143-undine wants [her]143-undine mourning quickly . Do n't [you]143-undine think , if [I]2796-the ironing - woman was to bring some stuff now , [you]143-undine would be able to do it for [her]143-undine ? "[2796-the ironing - woman] There was no doubt today about [the ironing - woman]2796-the ironing - woman 's daftness . [She]143-undine took no notice of [his]2850-his question , but said , after a pause , " What did [[your]2850-his master]3992-your master die of ? "[143-undine] " Well , [you]143-undine see , "[2309-the nigger] replied [the nigger]2309-the nigger , resting [his]2309-the nigger hand on the head of [his]2309-the nigger cane and leaning elegantly forward , " [I]2309-the nigger do n't just rightly know . [He]3992-your master came here just to have a look at everything , and [he]3992-your master took ill , something wrong inside , and [the doctors [they]3993-the doctors they wo n't let him travel wo n't let [him]3992-your master travel]3993-the doctors they wo n't let him travel ; and this six months [he]3992-your master 's been lying here , and [they]3993-the doctors they wo n't let him travel 've been saying [he]3992-your master was going to die , but [he]3992-your master never did till last night . "[2309-the nigger] Having got so far , [the nigger]2309-the nigger turned round and looked across [the road]1264-the road to see what it might be [the ironing - woman]2796-the ironing - woman saw that made [her]2796-the ironing - woman eyes look so strange . [He]2309-the nigger could see nothing but just a blade or two of grass which had not yet been trodden down and which were heavy with the morning dew ; so [he]2309-the nigger looked at [her]2796-the ironing - woman again . " When are [they]3993-the doctors they wo n't let him travel going to bury [him]3992-your master ? "[2796-the ironing - woman] " Tomorrow morning . [They]3993-the doctors they wo n't let him travel 've put [him]3992-your master in [a house in [the yard]324-the yard]3994-a house in the yard ; for [Mrs. Blair]143-undine [she]143-undine 's frightened of ghosts . "[2309-the nigger]

There was nothing to be gained by wasting more words over [her]2796-the ironing - woman just now , so [the nigger]2309-the nigger resumed [his]2309-the nigger " Swaar dra , [swaar dra]3996-swaar dra , "[2309-the nigger] and , without touching [his]2309-the nigger hat , turned away and walked jauntily whistling down [the road]1264-the road . [Undine]143-undine stood in the doorway and looked after [him]2309-the nigger . There were sparrows hopping about at [the tent]3712-the tent - side , picking up crumbs and insects ; and [diggers]2247-diggers passed with [their]2247-diggers sleeves rolled up above [their]2247-diggers elbows , walking briskly , whistling , some of [them]2247-diggers , for the morning air was fresh and made [them]2247-diggers feel that life , though it might mean small finds and hard work , was a pleasant thing and worth the having . [Some of [her]143-undine children]2859-some of her children die every day , and [Nature]205-nature might go about forever in deep weeds and mourning if [she]143-undine took the trouble to lament for [them]2859-some of her children ; so [she]143-undine goes on smiling , though [the best loved and the dearest]2860-the best loved and the dearest have just gone smiling , smiling , when [our]2861-our hearts are breaking . Why should the sky be clouded and the birds fly home hungry , because in [one small tent]2862-one small tent [a man]3044-a man lay stiff and white ? [Men whom [women]346-women 's hearts had yearned over]2864-men whom women 's hearts had yearned over died just so every week , and [the world]222-the world rocked on the same .

[Undine]143-undine slept heavily all day , a heavy sleep but troubled by many dreams ; and when [she]143-undine woke the sun had long set . [She]143-undine went out to the barrel that stood at the back of [the tent]3712-the tent , and drained the last drop of water into the mug . [She]143-undine was thirsty , parched with thirst , but [she]143-undine felt no hunger . The slice of

bread , very dry now , still lay upon the box unfinished .

[She]143-undine sat down on the side of [her]143-undine bed and held [her]143-undine head between [her]143-undine hands and tried to think , but [her]143-undine brain seemed very numb . After about an hour [she]143-undine stood up and went out , taking [the road by which [she]143-undine had come yesterday evening]2868-the road by which she had come yesterday evening . It was very dark , but [she]143-undine knew [her]143-undine way well . [The Compound]2388-the compound was very quiet tonight . There was [no one]406-no one on [the veranda]2375-the veranda , no light in [the house]228-the house . Only in [the little tent at the back]2873-the little tent at the back there was a light visible , and presently [two men]3279-two men came out . The night was still and , though [they]3279-two men spoke low , [she]143-undine could hear every word that passed : " Put the candle and matches down , [Jack]204-jack , just there inside the door and button it down tight , "[2875-the first man] said [the first man]2875-the first man . " [I]2875-the first man wonder [they]3279-two men like leaving it alone like this without a soul in [the place]3080-the place . Dogs might get in . "[2875-the first man] " No fear of that while this dog lies here , "[2520-the second] said [the second]2520-the second . " If [I]2520-the second was not with [you]204-jack , [I]2520-the second expect [you]204-jack 'd rather be pretty near anywhere than here ; [he]2875-the first man 'd think no more of tearing [you]204-jack than of growling , if [you]204-jack tried to go in [there]3010-there alone ; [he]2875-the first man do n't half like it as it is , for all that [I]2520-the second 've had the feeding of [the beggar]3999-the beggar for the last six months . Down , [Prince]3295-prince , down ! "[2520-the second] [The men]2813-the men passed close to where [Undine]143-undine stood . " [I]1457-the first tell [you]204-jack what , [Jack]204-jack , "[1457-the first] said [the first]1457-the first , " that coffin was damned heavy . [My]1457-the first shoulders ache . "[1457-the first]

" Charge it all in the bill , "[2520-the second] said [the second]2520-the second with a laugh :

" [Ten little nigger boys]4001-ten little nigger boys Fiddling over wine ; [One]397-one got so jolly drunk , And then there were nine , nine , nine . "[2520-the second]

Then [they]2813-the men went out at the gate , and [the Compound]2388-the compound was silent once more . By and by [Undine]143-undine went round and opened the gate and walked in . " [Prince]3295-prince , [Prince]3295-prince , [old boy]4005-old boy , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine called softly ; for [Prince]132-prince had risen to [his]2881-his feet and uttered a low growl at the sound of approaching footsteps . " [Prince]3295-prince , have [you]3295-prince quite forgotten [me]132-prince ? "[132-prince] The dog did not leave [his]2881-his post , but when [she]143-undine came close to [him]2881-his [he]2881-his laid [his]2881-his head against [her]143-undine knee . " [Prince]3295-prince , [Prince]132-prince ! Oh , [Prince]132-prince ! "[2881-his]

[He]2881-his seemed to understand [her]143-undine , for [he]2881-his uttered a long low growl , and [they]2882-they crouched down together at the entrance . Is [he]2881-his listening for the sound of [[his]2881-his master]1052-his master 's breathing in [the quiet tent]2884-the quiet tent ? Or is it only one who remembers how [they]2882-they two waited and listened , long ago ?

Only the heavy breathing of the dog and the quick low breath of [the woman]837-the woman break the stillness and are heard loud and clear in the quiet night ; but in [the tent]3712-the tent , in [the tent]3712-the tent , there is deadly stillness .

It was near midnight now , and in [the street]1739-the street [passenger - carts]2889-passenger - carts rumbled past , bearing [home]246-home [Toit]206-toit 's Pan

visitors from [the fast - closing houses of amusement]2891-the fast - closing houses of amusement .

Now [she]143-undine stood up and loosened the lower buttons that fastened down the canvas door . Stooping low , [she]143-undine went in , and the dog followed [her]143-undine , lying down close to the doorway and uttering a low short howl . Then it was quite silent in [the tent]3712-the tent , and very dark . Feeling [her]143-undine way along its side , [her]143-undine fingers touched at last the cold back of a chair , but that was not what [she]143-undine looked for ; then the edge of a small table ; then something lower than the table , long and narrow but with nothing inside . [She]143-undine felt that [it]2884-the quiet tent was empty , so [she]143-undine moved on softly . [Her]143-undine hand was on the iron bedpost , then on the smooth sheet , and then on something cold O , God how cold ! [She]143-undine took the sheet down off [his]2893-him face , and the cheek of [the living woman]2894-the living woman was pressed close to the cold face of [the dead man]2895-the dead man . In [his]2893-him ear [she]143-undine whispered the wild words of love that to [the living]2431-the living [she]143-undine would never utter wild passionate words , the outpourings of a life 's crushed - out love , the breaking forth of a fiercely suppressed passion . And [the dead man]2895-the dead man lies so still ; [he]2895-the dead man does not send [her]143-undine from [him]2895-the dead man ; [he]2895-the dead man does not silence [her]143-undine ; [he]2895-the dead man understands [her]143-undine now ; [he]2895-the dead man loves [her]143-undine now . [She]143-undine will see [his]2893-him face once more before it goes , and then [she]143-undine will creep close to [him]2893-him , and lie there , and never leave [him]2893-him .

In its place near the door [she]143-undine found the glass candlestick and matches , and when [she]143-undine had struck a light [she]143-undine came and stood with it in [her]143-undine hand at the

bed 's foot till [her]143-undine eyes had grown accustomed to it ; then [she]143-undine looked up .

[It]2898-it was a calm white face that lay there above the sternly folded arms a calm white face with the old smile , half scornful , half defiant , on the delicate arched lips . [The old face]2899-the old face ! What use to cry aloud to [it]2899-the old face ! [Mad , mad , and fool]2900-mad , mad , and fool ! Was there room in those sternly folded arms for [her]143-undine ! [He]2893-him had lived alone and self - sufficient ; [he]2893-him had died alone . There was no room for [her]143-undine now . With a cry , as of [one whose last hope has passed away]2901-one whose last hope has passed away , [she]143-undine let the light fall upon the floor , and the glass broke into a thousand fragments . But [she]143-undine stayed at the bed 's foot till the grey light glimmered through the canvas . Then [she]143-undine crept out and left [him]2893-him . A few hours afterwards , when [all New Rush]2902-all new rush was astir again , [the young wife]1513-the young wife came in to see [[her]1513-the young wife husband]1482-her husband for the last time . [She]143-undine had never looked so lovely as that day in [her]143-undine flowing crape , with the great tears of fear in [her]143-undine baby eyes when [they]2905-they told [her]143-undine to stoop down and kiss [him]2893-him . " [I]143-undine can not , [I]143-undine can not , "[143-undine] [she]143-undine cried ; " [I]143-undine am so afraid . "[143-undine] And as [she]143-undine turned to go out , [the trailing crape]2906-the trailing crape rolled the broken glass upon the floor . That was all that told of last night 's watch .

[XX . ALONE WITH THE STARS

WATER]207-xx . alone with the stars water ! Water !

[She]143-undine had slept again all day , and now that [she]143-undine awoke it was dark , and [she]143-undine was parched with thirst and there was no water none in the barrel , none in the jug ; [her]143-undine tongue clave to the roof of [her]143-undine mouth and [her]143-undine veins seemed scorched by liquid fire . [She]143-undine shook the barrel fiercely in [her]143-undine anger and tried to draw the tap out with [her]143-undine teeth . There must be some water in it , if only one could get it ; it seemed to [her]143-undine some cruel living thing withholding life from [her]143-undine ; and when [she]143-undine found [she]143-undine could do nothing [she]143-undine ran round and round [the tent]3712-the tent in the vain hope of growing cool . In [her]143-undine delirium it seemed that behind [her]143-undine a whole host of [small hideous beings]2908-small hideous beings followed , [howling old women with long canine teeth that touched [their]2909-howling old women with long canine teeth that touched their breasts breasts]2909-howling old women with long canine teeth that touched their breasts , [old men with hunchbacks and little twinkling eyes]2910-old men with hunchbacks and little twinkling eyes which [they]2910-old men with hunchbacks and little twinkling eyes closed tight and then opened suddenly : before , behind , [they]2910-old men with hunchbacks and little twinkling eyes followed [her]143-undine ; at every side [they]2910-old men with hunchbacks and little twinkling eyes pressed [her]143-undine ; and [her]143-undine thirst grew greater , till [her]143-undine tongue refused to move and keep [them]2910-old men with hunchbacks and little twinkling eyes off by words .

" Water , water , water ! "[143-undine] was all [she]143-undine could murmur . And at last , as if in answer to [her]143-undine cry , water came . The great clouds that had made the night so dark burst , and the great torrent poured down on [the earth]920-the earth . In an instant the heavy canvas sails were drenched , and [she]143-undine knelt down eagerly , holding them in both hands and sucking [them]2910-old men with hunchbacks and little twinkling eyes . Then [she]143-undine lay down and let the rain fall on [her]143-undine till the fever left [her]143-undine and a great shivering seized [her]143-undine . [She]143-undine went into [[her]143-undine tent]2719-her tent and climbed into the box , but [her]143-undine hands seemed powerless to undo [her]143-undine wet clothes , so [she]143-undine drew the blanket over [her]143-undine and lay there till morning . " [Mother]149-mother , "[2748-the children of the dutchwoman] said [the children of [the Dutchwoman]2749-the dutchwoman]2748-the children of the dutchwoman opposite " [mother]1559-mother , perhaps [some wicked man]4009-some wicked man has been to kill [the Englishwoman]4010-the englishwoman in [the little tent]2518-the little tent . Three days the sail is hanging loose , but [we]4012-we never see [her]4010-the englishwoman coming out or doing ironing . [We]4012-we think [she]4010-the englishwoman must be dead . "[2748-the children of the dutchwoman] " Nonsense ! "[1601-the mother] said [the mother]1601-the mother . " Do n't [you]1482-her husband have anything to do with [her]4010-the englishwoman ; [she]4010-the englishwoman 's [a bad woman]2129-a bad woman . "[1601-the mother] " How do [you]1482-her husband know that ? "[1482-her husband] asked [[her]1601-the mother husband]1482-her husband , who sat at the door , smoking [his]1482-her husband pipe . " Because [I]2917-the wife asked [her]4010-the englishwoman the other day if [the man who lived with [her]4010-the englishwoman]4014-the man who lived with her was [[her]4010-the englishwoman husband]1482-her husband , and [she]4010-the englishwoman said no . And [I]2917-the wife asked [her]4010-the englishwoman if [he]4014-the man who lived with her was [any relation of [hers]4010-the englishwoman]4016-any relation of hers , and [she]4010-the englishwoman said no . So [she]4010-the englishwoman must be bad , "[2917-the wife] said [the wife]2917-the wife .

Nevertheless , when [her]1601-the mother work was done , curiosity

led [the dame]2918-the dame over to [[the Englishwoman]4010-the englishwoman 's tent]2920-the englishwoman 's tent . [She]1601-the mother looked in at the door and at first thought there was nothing but the three packing - cases in [the tent]3712-the tent ; then , in the farthest of these , which lay bottom downwards , [she]1601-the mother noticed the purple blanket move , and went up to it .

" [You]143-undine are very sick , "[2749-the dutchwoman] said [the Dutchwoman]2749-the dutchwoman in English , better than [Boers]2923-boers generally speak . [Undine]143-undine opened [her]143-undine eyes , but did not answer . " [You]143-undine are very sick , "[208-the dutchwoman] repeated [the Dutchwoman]208-the dutchwoman . " What is [your]143-undine name ? "[208-the dutchwoman] " [Undine]143-undine , [Undine Bock]143-undine , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine , slowly , as though puzzled to remember what it really was , and going back to the old name of [her]143-undine childhood . " Great heavens ! "[208-the dutchwoman] said [the Dutchwoman]208-the dutchwoman . " Do [you]143-undine remember [me]208-the dutchwoman [Sannie Muller]66-sannie ? "[208-the dutchwoman] " Yes , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine ; but [her]143-undine eyes had closed again . " Can [I]143-undine do anything for [you]143-undine ? "[143-undine] [Sannie]66-sannie asked with some real kindness in [her]66-sannie voice , as the memory came to [her]143-undine of [the little schoolmate who , in company with [[her]66-sannie monkey]2925-her monkey , had been first and foremost in all evil and forever in disgrace]2924-the little schoolmate who , in company with her monkey , had been first and foremost in all evil and forever in disgrace . " No , thank [you]143-undine , "[143-undine] said [Undine]143-undine . But [the woman]837-the woman remained sitting by [her]143-undine till it grew dark ; then [she]837-the woman lit a candle and stood at [her]143-undine side , saying as [she]837-the woman did so : " [I]837-the woman will come again during the night and see [you]143-undine . "[837-the woman]

" [Mother]1559-mother , "[837-the woman] asked [the little child who had been

waiting for [her]143-undine in [the road]1264-the road]2927-the little child who had been waiting for her in the road , as [she]2927-the little child who had been waiting for her in the road trotted along at [her]143-undine side , " is [the Englishwoman]4010-the englishwoman very sick ? "[2927-the little child who had been waiting for her in the road]

" Yes , "[1601-the mother] said [the mother]1601-the mother . " [She]4010-the englishwoman will be dead in the morning . "[1601-the mother] [The Dutchwoman]208-the dutchwoman had worked hard all day , and when once [she]208-the dutchwoman fell asleep [she]208-the dutchwoman did not awake . But [the little tent]2518-the little tent had [another visitor]2931-another visitor that night . Not long after [the Dutchwoman]2749-the dutchwoman left , a great , rough curly head pushed itself in at the door , sniffed for a moment , and then four black paws carried it up to the side of the box . [Undine]143-undine was roused by a soft warm touch on [her]143-undine hand and when [she]143-undine opened [her]143-undine eyes the rough old face was close above [hers]143-undine , looking down at [her]143-undine . [Her]143-undine mind was too confused and dull for [his]2933-his presence there to cause [her]143-undine even the vaguest wonder . [She]143-undine only moved [her]143-undine fingers feebly and called [his]2933-his name , " [Prince]132-prince , [Prince]132-prince . "[143-undine] [He]2933-his stepped over the low side of the packing - case and lay down across [her]143-undine feet , with [his]2933-his head turned to one side so that [he]2933-his could watch [her]143-undine as [he]2933-his lay there . A very quiet sleep followed , and [Undine]143-undine did not know when the candle dropped into the bottle , or when [Prince]132-prince moved higher up so that [his]2933-his head rested on [her]143-undine breast . [She]143-undine knew nothing till [she]143-undine woke at one o'clock . Then [she]143-undine raised [herself]143-undine a little on [her]143-undine elbow , looked round , and fell back heavily again on [her]143-undine pillow .

The racking pain , the fever , the dull confusion

of brain , all had vanished . Free from pain , calm and clear as [she]143-undine had never felt before , [she]143-undine lay there , yet cold , strangely cold . What did it mean , this strange feeling ? [She]143-undine lay wondering , thinking , with [her]143-undine hands folded on the dog 's black head . Then the truth came to [her]143-undine suddenly .

Death only that , nothing more . What [she]143-undine had longed and prayed for ; what [she]143-undine had looked for in [the muddy pool]1408-the muddy pool ; what [she]143-undine had sighed for in days of emptiness it had come at last . Again [she]143-undine raised [herself]143-undine and again fell back heavily upon the pillow . " Not death , not death ! "[143-undine] [she]143-undine said , " not death ! anything else death is too horrible and [I]143-undine , [I]143-undine am so young , so young to die ! "[143-undine]

What was the use of crying out ! [She]143-undine only grew stiffer and colder and [her]143-undine breath came slow and heavy in [the closed tent]2935-the closed tent . [She]143-undine would leave it and go out into the starlight , [she]143-undine would be braver [there]3010-there . The great horror that was upon [her]143-undine gave [her]143-undine strength , and [she]143-undine pushed the dog from [her]143-undine and crept slowly over the side of the low box . There [she]143-undine lay long , and then again , inch by inch , crawling on hands and knees , [she]143-undine reached the doorway . The skirting that crossed [it]2937-it , three inches high , was hard to pass , and again [she]143-undine lay still ; but when [she]143-undine turned [her]143-undine head and caught sight of clear starlight outside , [she]143-undine crept on once more . Still on [her]143-undine hands and knees , and falling sometimes with [her]143-undine face into the

dust , [she]143-undine gained at last one of [the low gravel - heaps 1]2938-the low gravel - heaps 1 and lay down on its side .

[She]143-undine looked up at the old stars that [she]143-undine had looked up to and loved from [her]143-undine childhood as [other men]899-other men love [[their]899-other men friends]2940-their friends of flesh and blood the dear old stars that had shed [their]899-other men light on the thatched roofs and stone walls of [the old farm on [the Karoo]17-the karoo]2941-the old farm on the karoo ; that had looked in at the window of [the little whitewashed room]2942-the little whitewashed room and on the leaves of the small brown Testament and [the little child who cried and prayed there]2943-the little child who cried and prayed there ; the same and yet , tonight , looking so strange and new to [her]143-undine . Over the tumult and agony that reigned within , [they]2944-they spoke a great peace , and [she]143-undine lay still and watched [them]2944-they . ' Twas one of the gorgeous nights when the sky , shooting light from a million points , overwhelms and silences [us]2945-us ; and the little circle of [our]2945-us life , that has seemed to fill all creation , sinks to its proper size a shadow , a breath of wind that , being or not being , matters not . High over [her]143-undine head was one great blue star that gave a steady and unflickering light . At this [she]143-undine looked with dark wide - open eyes till it seemed to speak to [her]143-undine as clearly as [the priest]2946-the priest speaks who stands at the bedside of [the dying with bread and wine , reproof and blessing]2947-the dying with bread and wine , reproof and blessing , whereby [he]2946-the priest hopes to help the soul in its last struggles among [the waters]2948-the waters .

" Is death so horrible and ghastly to [you]143-undine ? "[2949-1 dťbris] said

[1 Dťbris]2949-1 dťbris .

the star , " so ghastly that even the pain and suffering and despair that are in life grow beautiful in [your]143-undine eyes ? [I]2950-the star am only [[your]143-undine brother]3397-your brother , "[2950-the star] said [the star]2950-the star , " a few million years older than [you]143-undine , and [I]2950-the star know nothing ; but [I]2950-the star have seen some things a few . [I]2950-the star have seen the sun pour forth [his]2946-the priest light and heat as a great heart pours its life - blood for [others]713-others . [I]2950-the star have seen it fall on a world dead and silent , and awake it ; till in place of death there was life , and for silence sound and ceaseless change . [I]2950-the star have seen [a world]4021-a world find birth through that light , even those strange and tiny creatures 1 who deep at [the floor of [the sea]3156-the sea]4022-the floor of the sea have formed [their]4024-their graves and [a new land]4025-a new land ; the waves have rolled back from [it]4025-a new land and [the land that is built from [their]4024-their skeletons]4026-the land that is built from their skeletons has become tree and grass and a million forms of life ; on [these other creatures]4027-these other creatures have lived ; and these again have died that [others]713-others might have life ; and at last [man]3103-man has come , to bring one of whom from the shapeless germ in which [he]3103-man lies plants innumerable die , and [[his]3103-man very next of kin]4030-his very next of kin are sacrified that [he]3103-man may grow and be . [I]2950-the star have looked long and carefully , "[2950-the star] said [the star]2950-the star , " and [I]2950-the star have seen that the thing which [you]4031-you call death is [the father of all life and beauty]4032-the father of all life and beauty . Till life goes , till blood flows , no higher life can come . There is nothing added to Nature , nothing taken from [her]209-1 coral . [She]209-1 coral has only so much in [her]209-1 coral hand , and with that [she]209-1 coral must do all things . Would [she]209-1 coral build better , [she]209-1 coral must pull down[2950-the star]

[1 Coral]209-1 coral .

first ; would [she]209-1 coral raise [a new world]2952-a new world , an old must sink ; would [she]209-1 coral double a flower , the seed of the single must go ; and to make [a man]3044-a man a million million forms have been and are not .

" Without death there is no change , without change no life ; without the shedding of blood no good thing . "[209-1 coral] If what [you]2954-you fear in the death that is upon [you]2954-you is not change but a fearful endless silence and annihilation , then take comfort , " said [the star]2950-the star ; "[0-i] [I]0-i have been young and now am old ; [I]0-i have seen great ebbs and great flows , and myriad never - ending changes ; but such death as [you]2954-you dream of [I]0-i have nowhere seen . [Nature]205-nature is too poor to lose , too poor to let rest ; [her]205-nature work is not yet done ; [she]205-nature has other things to make . " Mark [you]2954-you well , [I]2950-the star know nothing , "[2950-the star] said [the star]2950-the star ; " and what [you]2954-you are , or [I]2950-the star am , or the gravel is on which [you]2954-you lie , [I]2950-the star can not tell , and what [we]4034-we mean [I]2950-the star can not tell ; only that which [I]2950-the star have seen [I]2950-the star speak of . "[2950-the star] The stump now burning at [your]2954-you side , it was a great brown lifeless stump an hour or two ago , now a lurid glowing mass shooting out flames and heat , cracking and changing every moment . It will be a small heap of ashes soon , but the light and heat were in it before the match touched it , and [I]0-i know they are not lost , only doing other work in other forms .

" [I]2950-the star have been young and now am old , "[2950-the star] said [the

star]2950-the star ; " yet if [I]2950-the star should say [I]2950-the star have seen death as [you]2954-you fear it , [I]2950-the star should lie . Change [I]2950-the star have seen and desolation , but no death . Take comfort . "[2950-the star]

And [she]2950-the star was comforted and looked upwards with [her]2950-the star arms folded and almost a smile on [her]2950-the star lips . For , as in [our]2957-our hours of sin and weakness , [we]2957-our weep because the great ever - changing , many - waved current on which [we]2957-our find [ourselves]2957-our will flow on just the same when [our]2957-our small wave has spent itself , so , in [our]2957-our moments of sight and strength , a joy , calm and mighty , comes to [us]2957-our when [we]2957-our see that the great current will flow on uninjured , unchanged by [our]2957-our loss , in its deathless progress . [She]2950-the star lay still and was comforted . And what if [the star]2950-the star never spoke , and only [her]2950-the star own thoughts were thrown back to [her]2950-the star ! If it be to a bedside with [priest]2959-priest , wafer , and book , or to [a gravel - heap under the stars]2960-a gravel - heap under the stars , that peace and strength come , are [they]2961-them not [the children of the soul]2962-the children of the soul , and no outcome of [wafer]2963-wafer , [priest]2959-priest , or star ? Though blessed be all three if [they]2961-them can call [them]2961-them forth in the hour of that battle the last and strongest . [She]2950-the star rested till it seemed as though a mist were creeping over the brilliant night sky , and then as though the smoke from the fire passed before [her]2950-the star eyes . [She]2950-the star raised [her]2950-the star hands slowly as though to wave it from [her]2950-the star ; but it grew darker , and one by one the stars vanished . Then [she]2950-the star knew that it was the shadow of death that lay between [her]2950-the star and [them]2961-them .

Slowly [she]2950-the star turned away [her]2950-the star head , and even in that darkness could see lying between the two great stones the stump , now coal from end to end with blood - red cracks upon its surface . The cold was growing greater , so [she]2950-the star crept a little nearer the coal and lay with [her]2950-the star face to it . Was it because the glowing light , seen through the mist , brought back a night of long ago , that [she]2950-the star heard in the dim delicious confusion the voice that had called [her]2950-the star so tenderly under the red lamplight in [the little hall]2965-the little hall ? " [[My]2966-my little girl]3335-my little girl , [[my]2966-my own little girl]4036-my own little girl [Undine]143-undine , "[2966-my] it said over and over , and the soft tears of gladness filled [her]2950-the star eyes , and in delicious dreamy darkness it seemed as though [his]2966-my arms were close around [her]2950-the star . Presently the moon rose and looked over the ridge of [the tent]3712-the tent into [the little yard]2968-the little yard among the gravel - heaps . The glowing stump had burnt out and gone to ashes between the great round stones . Before [them]2961-them , in [her]2950-the star little purple print , with [her]2950-the star feet crossed and [her]2950-the star head resting on one arm , lay [Undine]143-undine . [Her]2950-the star white kappie lay near [her]2950-the star and cast a grotesque shadow , like [a man]3044-a man 's face with long nose and chin ; and the light glistened on [her]2950-the star soft brown hair . There was nothing else to be seen in [the little yard]2968-the little yard .
